Reviews.Title: “Waterpark in the resort is totally worth the trip.”
Reviews.Author: Travelhappy31
Reviews.Content: If you want family and friends all together enjoying vacation together ,this is one very nice place.it has a waterpark that kids and adults will go crazy with and accommodation is like home with 3 rooms villa and 3 restrooms plus a kitchen.....can't wait o go back.

Reviews.Title: “A home from home”
Reviews.Author: fraggles
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week in a three bedroomed house with a pool. The house was spacious and clean and had everything you could need with daily housekeeping and free Wi-Fi. It was lovely to come back after a chaotic day at the parks and sit by the pool to relax. The resort is large and very spread out but the grounds are beautifully kept. There are no on site shops for groceries so a car is a must, although there are shops nearby. We would definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet &Comfortable! You will sleep well but not very clean!”
Reviews.Author: Rka62
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd stay at Reunion. We stayed in a similar 3 BR condo in 2009. Both vacations housekeeping "forgot to come". When I called the from desk they told me "it was a miscommunication". I've never stayed at another hotel where this has happened. I did not want housekeeping to come at a late hour so they delivered fresh towels and soap. Mgt gave us $100 credit for this error. I felt satisfied. I do feel housekeeping needs better oversight. Housekeeping is not keeping these lovely appointed condos as clean as they should be. Bed was comfortabe but sheets were very old and had stains. It's unbelievable that this happened to us on two seperate vacations. The kitchen cabinets had gooey stains. Felt like kitchen supplies were not very clean. The pool area was pretty but everyday we had trouble finding an open chair so often we had to sit on side of pool without chair. I came on vacation to relax and could not always relax at pool without a chair. Not sure if I would stay here again. Although I do like the peace and quiet just minutes away from Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Second time happy renter!”
Reviews.Author: JacksMomCalgary
Reviews.Content: Our family has rented a condo directly thru owners twice now. Both time were absolutely wonderful. We have stayed in 2 different areas of the resort, once in Center Court and once in Terrace Palms. With a car, everything is very close. Each condo complex has its own pool, which are lovely. There is also a fantastic "waterpark" that is for members only. However, you can arrange to gain access thru the owners if offered; if you rent thru the resort directly, you automatically get access. The Reunion is a very quiet resort - great sleeps! We saw lots of geckos and even an armadillo on the lawn one morning :) Renting thru an owner directly (we found ours on VRBO.com each time) is about half the price! We have always loaded up the condo with groceries; there are two grocery stores right down the road. Yes, you need a car, as Orlando IS very spread out. Disney was only 10 mins away and it is easy access off the I-4 Hwy. Find the back roads to avoid rush hour traffic on the I-4. The Reunion grounds are beautifully cared for, pools are super clean and it is very kid friendly. Our son is 7 and LOVES it there. There were mostly families when we were there; so lots of kids for our child to play with! The pools are not too deep. Lazy river is 3 feet deep all the way around. Kids can participate in the kids crew, rent bikes, swim, waterpark, and of course the theme parks. Service was wonderful everywhere we went, no complaints at all. Gratuity is automatically added in to the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Decent accommodations, very poor service!”
Reviews.Author: jellie2001
Reviews.Content: The pools and accommodations were nice, however if you want 5 star service this isn't the place! Gratuity is already included, so they have created a socialist environment. The wait staff doesn't go out of their way and they practically need to be waved down poolside. All in all, unless we were to get a "steal" on a room, we wouldn't go back. Most definitely wasn't worth the price we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: slpmom07
Reviews.Content: We went to reunion after a shady property management company left us with no house to rent. We had heard of it but had never stayed. Alex found us a condo when everything else in the city was booked. It was in the villas, beautifully furnished, near the fabulous water park and other pools. I like that you can use any pool of the 11 on the resort -there are big ones and smaller ones (hint:the smaller ones are warmer). The resort is immaculate and so was the condo and housekeeping comes everyday to ask if you need anything (sometimes at 9am which is a little early guys). It's a bummer that the water closes at 5pm. We did not use the other amenities except for having dinner at the 11th floor restaurant at the Grande and watching some distant fireworks. There were lots of kids there - I know some people have said it is not kid friendly but I can't see why they would think that. The resort is massive so I could see how if you are on one side of the resort in a home, you may not like having to take a car to the watermark. Stay in the villas and you won't have to! My husband liked playing the courses and said they were challenging (and he has played a lot of golf). Vacation saved!

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: BostonGrl_10
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a week long stay at Reunion Resort. We had stayed in a villa 3 years ago and had a great time. This time we rented a house with extended family. It was beautiful! It had a nice small pool for the kids and overlooked the golf course. The house was large enough to accomodate 8 of us very comfortably. We liked the short drive to Disney and appreciated the peace and quiet of the resort. The water park is fabulous and not so big that you will worry about kids getting lost. Kids over 7 years old will be able to stand in just about all parts of the pool and lazy river. The guys loved the golf courses and the restaurant at the top of the hotel is great. Everything was clean and updated. Maid service was top notch, although a bit stingy with the towels. The service here is friendly. We didn't encounter any problems. I did see a family turned away at the pool, due to renting a house directly through owners. They were asked to contact the owner to allow access to the pool. The staff were polite and not in any way rude. I would definitely suggest renting through the property if you want the great service and amenities. I will absolutely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Boring, old furnishings but clean. Careful on VRBO”
Reviews.Author: coloradomichelle
Reviews.Content: I was excited to stay here based on reviews. Stayed at a condo rented via VRBO. Thought we got a great price $(650 for 3 bedroom x 5 days) Turns out, our unit was old, tired and the area ( heritage crossing) was boring. There was one half roll of toilet paper in each bathroom without refills. One replacement trash bag. The master had the TP roll sitting on the floor ( no holder) Place was clean, no wifi. The second bedroom seemed to have no A/C access! Terribly hot unless door was left open constantly. VRBO rents cheaper than actual website but beware because you may not be able to golf or use waterpark. Better alternatives in kissemee.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Royalhalprin
Reviews.Content: Loved the rooms in the Grande, loved the grounds, loved the pool, loved the spa, most of the staff were helpful and a delight. Immensely disappointed with our restaurant service at Forte and at the Clubhouse for breakfast. New management are needed there. Also, new this year- no towels at the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort for golf getaway”
Reviews.Author: Edward G
Reviews.Content: We had our annual golf weekend with the boys at the resort. We occupied a nice house with a two car garage that also had a one bedroom apartment on top. The house was terrific with a courtyard between the garage and the main house that had a pool/hot tub combination (we never used it, but it was a nice thing to have). The resort itself is large with three golf courses that were all good and challenging in their own way, the Nicklaus course being the newest and most challenging. The service for the place was generally excellent. We had too many people for the place we rented based on the number of beds available but we easily arranged for roll-aways (provided by a third party through the resort). Our refrigerator died a day after we arrived, but they brought us a small replacement to get us through the duration of our stay. Beyond that, the place was excellently furnished, clean and had plenty of amenities (flat screens in every bedroom and living space, washer dryer, etc.). There were also general pool/spa areas scattered around the complex that folks could use in addition to what was at our house, which was use by some of the folks in our group. The only downside to the resort was that it isn't close to any type of nightlife outside of Disney being 15 minutes away. There are other places to go out for a decent meal, but you have to travel at least 30 minutes (except for another resort down the road with limited options). The other quirk was at the clubhouse and maybe the rest of the resort dining areas (we didn't use them) where they only took credit cards or charges to the rooms (no cash). Not really a problem but seemed a bit odd. The service was great for golfers. They really manage the golf well, store your clubs and have them ready on the carts for you the next day, clean them etc. No tipping allowed ("it's included, sir"). All the other service staff were great as well. Everyone was pleasant and professional. I recommend it for a family or if you want a nice self-contained getaway. If you want to hit the nightspots or have more options for dining, be prepared to drive at least 20 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations!”
Reviews.Author: SarahS411
Reviews.Content: I have to admit that I had some concerns that this resort might be too good to be true given that when I called only a few weeks before our trip to see if we could alter the dates of our reservation and they not only accommodated us, but upgraded us to a three bedroom villa and knocked a significant amount off of the room rate. However, this resort lived up to all of my expectations and even exceeded them! We stayed in a three bedroom villa in the Villas South. The villa was nicely decorated, spacious and within walking distance to the waterpark. We had everything we needed in the villa including a washer and dryer, dishwasher, wifi, refrigerator with water/ice dispenser and they even provided us with free extras such as laundry detergent. All of the staff at the resort were very friendly and helpful. There were no issues checking in or out. I was glad that we booked through the resort because it appeared that other people were having problems getting access to the waterpark when they had booked through the individual owner or management company instead of the resort. The waterpark area was really nice. It was beautiful and there were plenty of places to sit. The only issue that we had was the "no outside food and beverage" rule which is hard to follow when you have little kids. If they would have had some more healthy snacks for little kids (i.e. Goldfish), it would have been easier for us to stay there longer. Instead we ended up going back to the room for snacks. Last year we stayed at the Grand Floridian at Disney. I would have to say that this resort was much nicer - especially since we had so much more space. The drive to Disney isn't too bad either and if you factor in the cost savings, it's probably worth it to stay at Reunion instead. We will definitely be back! We will definitely be back here in the future. I can't say enough good things about this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value”
Reviews.Author: ensco3
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific resort. This was our third visit, we had 3 generations staying in a 3 bedroom on the golf course (in Center Court Ridge). Value for money is high (we paid $370/night plus taxes). The unit was very spacious and clean. You are close to two different Publix, and are not overly far from Disney, Universal or the I-Drive restaurants/shopping areas. The proximity of Reunion is overdone by others in my opinion, Disney is only 25 minutes away, but most other attractions inevitably require sitting in traffic jams. Orlando traffic is brutal, double any estimate you get from Google Maps in high season (the I-4 between exits 64-74, and International Drive, are particularly bad). The 11the floor bar/restaurant is very nice, and affords a distant view of the Disney fireworks shows at 9pm and 10pm. The golf and tennis are extremely high quality, if pricey. The water park is first rate in every way. They now have free resort-wide high speed wifi, which previously was not available.  I would recommend Reunion to anyone. But be warned, like a lot of Orlando, it's a little "pasteurized".

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a Golf Getaway”
Reviews.Author: CDNtraveller66
Reviews.Content: Stayed for the second time at Reunion resort. We rented a house for a boys golf weekend. This is one of the all-around best facilities in the country. Its fantastic value, from the prices of the lodgings, to the food and the golf. Service is excellent, we played 5 rounds over 4 days and we were always picked up on time at our luxury house and dropped off at the clubhouse. The courses have something for every golfer, from the forgiving Watson to the challenging Nicklaus. The only non positive comment is that some of the underdeveloped areas of the resort are a bit of an eyesore but I guess its understandable given the state of the economy...I guess they had grander plans when it was originally conceived. In any case it did not take away from our overall impression and we will return.

Reviews.Title: “Go out of your way to stay here”
Reviews.Author: sdr82
Reviews.Content: This is the best place to stay hands down when going to the parks or if you have busines in the surrounding areas. I bought my parents a getaway package for fathers day and wound up driving up to join them. The rooms (not houses) are like giant suites and they just lock the extra room doors according to how may beds you need. Its like staying in a nice apartment. Especially at that time of the year its a ghost town so you have the entire place to yourself. Rent bikes and ride around the propertey. Theres a private water park and just fairways as far as you can see. Do not miss the spa. Its in its own bungalow and is such a nice experience. Very knowledgeable staff also.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful! 5th trip there”
Reviews.Author: kello
Reviews.Content: Just got home from another wonderful stay at Reunion. Stayed in a 3 bed villa in Whisper Way. Villa was perfect and so spacious for us (2 adults and 2 kids). The waterpark was fantastic and I must compliment Amanda on doing a great job. We have been here 5 times and this is our first trip where we met Amanda and for some reason the general feel at the waterpark seems so much better. The wait staff were all very friendly and the lifeguards got to know us over the week. It was like a home away from home! We ate by the pool during the day and cooked in the villa or ordered from local chinese place/chillis-to-go in the evenings...so easy. We did one day at Disney and the other days just hung out at the waterpark or the local neighborhood pool. Our daughter made lots of friends at the pool and loved that she was now tall enough to go down the big slide. The grounds are kept so perfect and it's so quiet out for a morning walk or sitting on the balcony watching all the morning runners. Already looking forward to our next trip back.

Reviews.Title: “Step ford wives resort everything Perfect from food to gardens, villas absolutely perfect !”
Reviews.Author: Sarahbmw
Reviews.Content: This resort is fab so relaxing everything is so clean it's quiet the walks from our apartment to the main hotel were really nice, all the staff are so friendly I would highly recommend this place for couples or families and golf lovers aswell ! It reminded me off the film step ford wives with the grounds been so secure and perfect I'll definatly be back when in in Florida again !

Reviews.Title: “great time”
Reviews.Author: crazyflam
Reviews.Content: We Went around thanksgiving recieved a great deal. 3 bedroom suite with all the upgrade.the pool was excellent, had a water park for the kids, a lazy river, water slide and drinks and food.

Reviews.Title: “Returned again for the 6th time.. LOVED IT!”
Reviews.Author: JMLJBradley
Reviews.Content: Our family WILL be returning again this fall! Our children love the kids crew activites and staff, the playgrounds, the waterpark and they took their first mini jr tennis lesson at Reunion. The grounds and golf courses are stunning, and impecably maintained. We have booked through both the resort directly, and through private home owners. On our most recent trip we knew we would play golf and would want access to the waterpark so we booked direct. Simple, no hassel, top notch customer service. From the lifeguards, to the doormen, and the great day spa. Occasionally we have booked through a private homeowner. We made sure to view alot of pics, view the website of the home, and talk to the owner personally. This home had a private pool, and all the ammenities of home. Very clean, and we loved that we could BBQ. While we did not have access to the onsite golf or the waterpark,[tradeoff for the lower prices] we really enjoyed Seven eagles pool and tried another local golf course. Regardless of how we book, we go to our favorite restaurants in the Orlando area - right in Reunion. [So nice to be right there] Honestly the best sushi + oven baked pizza ever, and the chophouse service and food are amazing. Eleven restaurant is the perfect date night out, dinner with the doors open to a roof top pool and watching the Disney fireworks. We noticed improvements in services such as: security is much more diligent at the gates ensuring owners and resort guests only are accessing the resort. The waterpark food service staff are more numerous and attentive. The minor things we'd like to see improved for our next trip to Reunion - towels at seven eagles pool [suggstion: members/resort guests show their room keys for the towels] minor problem but very problematic to return to the room! The clubhouse food [breakfast] is not on par with the outstanding lobby bar, chophouse and eleven resturant.The gym could use a flooring facelift, to reflect the fact it is one of the better gyms we use in our travels in terms of quality of the machines, space and atmosphere. The business facilities/meeting rooms we have used once as well and we were very happy with the service and setup. The 3 golf courses are incredibly maintained and we are always marshalled off our tee on time. We are looking forward to returning to the sun and Reunion Resort and we are bringing our close freinds and thier children with us this time!

Reviews.Title: “Reunion Resort provided a terrific experience”
Reviews.Author: gary7777
Reviews.Content: My company had a conference for 80 people at the resort. Everything went perfect. The meeting space, food, and rooms were ideal. I can't say enough about the customer service. This was the best that we have experienced in all of our conferences. There was not one thing that led to disappointment. Strongly recommend using Eleven for any group dinners. The view of the resort from the rooftop was exceptional. A few of us also played golf during the trip. We played all three courses on the resort. They were all great. The Nicklaus course is a little tougher than I prefer. Be prepared to play out of sand. I look forward to visiting this resort in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay at 7451 Gathering Court "The Sunshine House"”
Reviews.Author: John R
Reviews.Content: Reunion Resort is lovely, however my family's experience at the hands of the Reunion Agents managing this villa and the Villa Owners themselves has been very very bad. The villa itself is nice and when considered in isolation more than meets the advertised specification of those anticipating a luxury villa vacation experience. This was exactly what my family was anticipating … and exactly what we did NOT get. The empty lot next door, referred to in other reviews on VRBO, is no longer empty as of 15th October 2011. During my vacation it was taken up by a team of 10-15 builders who proceeded to construct a villa for all the daylight hours of Tuesday through Saturday of our week long stay. The wall of the new villa next door was being built literally 6 yards from the edge of the poolside. As such, it was not possible to use the pool, or to sit or eat outside PERIOD. So why the poor rating? BECAUSE BOTH THE OWNER AND THE HANDLING AGENT IN FLORIDA KNEW ABOUT THE IMMINENT BUILDING WORK, well before my family’s arrival. And did they call me or the booking agent in London … NO THEY DID NOT! They did nothing except take my full fee clearly worried that I would ask for an alternative or a refund prior to departure if I was in any way in the know about the construction. And since my return I have spent weeks swapping email, sending photographs, asking for an apology but to no avail. I have been consistently stonewalled …. and now I have been left with little choice but to explore my legal options. The difficulty I am having is my family’s trip of a lifetime was ruined by let’s face it, the stereo-typical ‘Holiday-from-Hell’ scenario of builders next door. No remorse, and no comeback from the people I paid cash to for this experience, and no matter what comes back in reply to this review, if indeed they care, they cannot deny that they knew about the IMMINENT BUILDING WORK NEXT DOOR AND DID NOTHING and happily sat back, cash in bank, to leave my family’s vacation to fall way short of expectation. So if this review is not sufficient for you to look elsewhere in Reunion, then I would be sure to ask for updated photos of the villa given the new building 6 yards away, before hitting the ‘book it’ button and subjecting your family to naive faith in human nature, sadly the way I subjected mine. I should have posted this review earlier for all you prospective Reunion travelers, but I felt I wanted to give the owners the right of reply and the opportunity to right wrongs privately. They neglected to take this up.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property”
Reviews.Author: Rschrader
Reviews.Content: I was at the property for a meeting, Their was also a "welcome party" at one of the estate home and it was also very nice. I stayed in a 1 bedroom suite and it was very nice. The golf courses were beautiful and very challenging.

Reviews.Title: “Should of been great, far from it.”
Reviews.Author: Kim B
Reviews.Content: Booked 5 Bedroom, 4.5 bath Superior home for 5 days between December 26, 2011 and December 31, 2011. Here is a list of just some of the problems we encountered: 1) Lost use of 1 whole bed and bath (entire trip) because the air in the guest house was not working. We were told they finally got the air working on the 3rd day (unconfirmed as it got cooler outside), but due to the mold smell the bed/bath was unusable. Requests to change linens in guest house were ignored. 2) No workable keys till day 3. Yes, computer systems go down, but this was ridiculous. Even after the systems came back up, Security accused us of returning the wrong set of keys when we got locked out for the 4th time. Come to find out, the actual card reader on the front door was not working and had to be replaced. The attitude we got from Security because we kept repeatedly calling to get into the unit was laughable, as we were at zero fault and we were the ones being inconvenienced by having no keys. 3) Ice Maker broken/Refrigerator not cooling properly. This was found out after $400 of groceries was purchased. 4) Dishwasher broken. We found a screw that was preventing water from filling and had to fix ourselves. 5) Dirty floors and dingy carpet. Roaches on the floor with a 15 month old exploring is just gross. Even after demanding that the unit be cleaned, we could hardly tell a difference. When a unit remains uninhabited for long periods of time, thorough cleaning needs to be done, especially when such a premium is being charged. 6) No curtains in upstairs bathroom window. We were already short one bath, so having an open window from about 4.5 feet up facing the neighbors was not good. 7) Paid for pool heat. Called day before to ensure it was turned on. Pool heat broken and off when arrived. Pool not cleaned in who knows how long, green algae on all inner surfaces. Pool heat was fixed on day 3. When you rent a home with a pool, you expect to be able to use it. Now we were comp’ed one night due to our issues. Good yes, but I would rather have had the extra space that we paid for. We also were offered to transfer to another smaller unit. Good yes, as it was cleaner (no way to know if everything would have been in working order) but after unpacking and buying groceries, moving to a new house at 10:00 pm the night before going to Disney just wasn't going to happen. We shouldn't have been expected to have less room just to have a well maintained unit. This is an awesome resort in terms of amenities. We had a great time golfing. We liked the overall feel, but our housing just wasn't up to par. This is our 5th Disney Rental (and not the last with a 15 month old), was the most costly, and yet these were the worst accommodations so far. Cannot confirm this, but staff told us it is better to stay in the Villas than the homes, as the Villas have more turn over than the houses.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort Terrible Management”
Reviews.Author: lbaena
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to this resort. The first time was awesome. This time it was terrible. Here some issues I had this stay: The worst 5 Bedroom home at 7416 Astina. The Mother in law’s suite as they call it “Is to literally kill the mother in Law” My son stayed in it for two days and got sick because of the terrible humidity and odor of the suite. My 16-year-old son got his IPOD switched by someone who serviced the home, reported the issue and nothing happened. I was moved to another home because of the humidity and got a new home infested with ants and house keeping we got was very deficient. In summary management’s interest at Reunion Resort was to over book the resort in exchange of terrible service and poor quality of homes. I hope the guys at Reunion Resort fix this issues and until then I will refrain from going back.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort”
Reviews.Author: Scarf26
Reviews.Content: Great property,comfortable,best for the family. Just the sheets were very old

Reviews.Title: “golf with the guys”
Reviews.Author: pard76
Reviews.Content: golf trip with 9-10 guys. Golf courses were well maintained and fun to play..the golf staff was excellent....the rooms in the deluxe hotel were showing some need of refurbish/repair. Several in our group had problems with toilets, alrms going off in the suites, shower heads not working, etc. I guess they maintain by having vacationer call to complain..There should be some quality control at a facility with rates at top dollar...All in all a pleasant time, but there are many choices out there for less $$...They should adjust the golf packages to include a real breakfast...and they need to coordinate golf and food services, especially at lunch time, when groups are trying to make the turn for 36 a day...I suspect the new infusion of cash by Ms. Johnson may help...time will tell...

Reviews.Title: “Okay! But something is amiss...”
Reviews.Author: mlrl1965
Reviews.Content: Our group goes on an annual golf trip, right after Thanksgiving. This year there were 9 men and we chose Reunion. To look at the resort it is very nice. Accommodations looked appealing. We were in the main building with two bedroom suites. Every room had something wrong with it. In our suite, first day there was a leak from the ceiling between kitchen and living room. Toilet ran in one bathroom and the chain broke off in the other suite. Main electrical circuit for bathroom kept tripping, causing a beeping at 4:00am on two different nights. Most everything was fixed, with the exception of electrical. The staff were nice and tried to be helpful. There is no shop in the hotel if you need to buy incidentals or a magazine. Called for bellman service and they never came. They were talking amongst themselves and just did not respond.

Reviews.Title: “Great golf destination!”
Reviews.Author: Fiveshag
Reviews.Content: Went with a group of twelve to play in the PGA Magazine Pro-Am the first week in December. The golf courses were first rate and the conditions perfect. The food and accommodations were also terrific. Tony and Kevin who were the point men for the tournament went out of their way to make sure everything was hassle free and convenient for all of the participants. If any of you are looking for a great venue for a golf tournament, look no further then the Reunion resort. We'll definatley be back next year if not sooner!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property but empty.”
Reviews.Author: forensicformologist
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend there last weekend. The property and scenery were beautiful but for being a Wyndham property there were several below par items. The golf villa was very nice. The view from the patio over the course was amazing. The only flaw in the room was the peeling wallpaper and dirty grount in the floor of the bathroom. The room had a large soaking tub and a completely kitchen with all the utensils and dishes you would need. The old tube TV's need to be replaced with flatscreens The waterpark is an excellent feature. We were there on a 78 degree Sunny Saturday afternoon and there was only about 30 people in the whole park. Drinks at poolside were tasty and reasonable. Later we went to the pool at the cove to soak in a spa. They only heat the water to the 85 degrees in the spas. Hello Wyndham, turn the temperature up! They had a dive in movie later at the pool on a big inflatable screen.. Only problem was you could not see the movie with all the pool deck lights on. There was also no one else watching. There should be more disclaimers regarding dress code. Tennis courts are Clay so they will not allow anytning but approved tennis shoes on court. Thank God I didn't reserve a time ($40.00 for an hour?) They will charge you a broken apt fee of $20.00 if you don't show up or have the wrong shoes. Tried to go to the taunted Eleven restaurant and pool bar on the top floor. Be aware the dress code suggests no blue jeans. Found taht out after gettting a dirty look from another couple in the elevator. Then found out it was closed due to Holiday party. Finally got billed $23.00 for Wyndham experience. This apparently covers wifi and use of the water park for 2. Pretty expensive considering most Wyndham guests probably have 4g phones and pads. Overall I would probably come back again now that I know the rules. They could be much more successful in filling up the place if they would lighten up on the rules and do a littl updating.

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Funkacello
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to the Reunion Resort with my daughter, her husband and two boys ages 5 and 9. The unit we rented was spacious and exceptionally clean and modern. The boys enjoyed the water park with heated water, a giant slide, lazy river and spill area. Kid crafts were also available. We all enjoyed the various restaurants including an upscale one for just adults. The staff was very helpful and the golf courses (3) were well maintained. Tennis was also available with lessons for kids.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort; Very Poor Customer Relations”
Reviews.Author: trd1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are Wyndham Presidential Reserve owners. We stayed 11 days at Reunion, November 29 through December 10. We stayed in a 3 bedroom unit, as that is the only option for Wyndham owners. The unit was very spacious and was on par with other "deluxe" units that we have stayed in. What makes Reunion special though is the grounds. The golf courses and the grounds are amazing! We are not golfers, but we enjoy walking and the complex, which is huge, was simply a joy to walk each day. The down side to our trip though was my wife tripped and fell on a sprinkler hear that was IMPROPERLY PLACED (about 1-2 inches from a corner in the sidewalk and about 3-4 inches above the ground). My wife, who has had double knee replacement, badly bruised her knees, shoulder and forehead as well as injured her risk. Security was called and a report was completed. The next day the sprinkler head was properly placed (several inches from the sidewalk and flush with the ground). This, in my opinion, is an acknowledgement that it was impropererly placed. I went by and explained what happened to the Wyndham agent/representative at Reunion and showed her photos to document the before and after photos of the sprinkler head. She assured me that she would speak to management and someone would contact me. No one has to date. As I said earlier, we are proud Wyndham owners, but this incident really left my wife and me extremely disappointed in the total disregard for the safety and well being of it's owners. It would have been nice for someone to call and ask how my wife was doing and if there was anything we needed. Instead we only gotten silence. My wife is battered, bruised, and sore, and hopefully will be o.k. But what if she had broken bones or been more seriously injured due to this misplaced sprinkler head? As the last reviewer said Wyndham Reunion has "poor customer relation/service" and no one has the courtesy or respect to at least follow up on incidents that require reports from security. Wyndham Reunion----you can do better!

Reviews.Title: “REUNION RESORT IN ORLANDO FLORIDA.”
Reviews.Author: PK G
Reviews.Content: ttis year November 5th -12th a group of 16 from NY visitied / choose REUNION for our 17th year annual golf trip . I must say the resort and golf courses are beautiful. Unfortunately I am appalled and disapointed that during our stay at REUNION in Orlando Florida personal items were stolen from my Villa. In addition, money from another room was also stolen. I personally filed an complaint with security and discussed the issue with Mr Roth. Both promised that they would look into the matter and let me know prior to leaving. Today, December 5th no one had the courtesy or respect to inform me of their findings. It appears this must be a standard practice from management in an attempt to cloak these incidents from being exposed. I would not return to REUNION GOLF RESORT in the future. Very poor customer relation / service. THESE INCIDENTS RUINED A GREAT WEEK - IF YOU VALUE YOUR PROPERTY I WOULD NOT RECOMEND STAYING. overall evaluation id POOR

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Resort”
Reviews.Author: JMN19701
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at this resort for 10 nights ( I will call out that we booked one of the vacation homes on this property, thorugh a private owner- HINT- much cheaper! ) We had an amazing time! The resort is beyond huge- it's awesome and very secure. The spa is great too! Door to door to Magic Kingdom- 10 minutes. We rented a 5 bedroom, 4,200 sq foot home with an inground heated pool for a fraction of the price of what you would pay to stay on Disney property. We would stay here again without blinking an eye.

Reviews.Title: “Bitter Sweet”
Reviews.Author: Chkzf44
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the Florida Classic with my boyfriend and 7 of my other friends. Let's start with the bad, I booked a 3 bedroom 3 bath condo with a queen sofa bed. When I got there to check in they put me in a townhouse which was very old and dated in the inside. I called and told them that this is not what I wanted and they stated that they would change me to the room I want for a fee. I was not going for that so they changed me for free. The lady stated that they would bring me the keys to a new room. I was located right across the road from the check in an it took them 35 minutes to bring me new keys. The keys did not work so I waited another 20 minutes for a cleaning lady who came and opened the door. I asked her about new keys and she didn't speak English so I went to the check in myself to get keys. The staff was extremely friendly but after we left we decided to get gas and something to eat before going back to the room. Got back to the room around 10 that night to my surprise the keys still don't work. I was very pissed at this time and just wanted to find a new hotel. They called security and we had to wait again for keys this time they gave us a hard key and everything was okay. The resort gave us a $150 credit because of the key issue and that was nice. Now the good. Once I was moved from a townhouse to a condo I was very happy. The kitchen was amazing, the rooms were amazing. The master bath was great. I love how big the shower was and the flat screen tv's were nice even though the remotes did not work. I would stay here again because I love the place minus the few problems. I have stayed here before and did not have any problems so I have no idea what was going on with them this time.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME RESORT!!!!”
Reviews.Author: amberleemay
Reviews.Content: This place is beautiful! We stayed in the tower and after our car was parked with the complimentary valet, the friendly staff opened the front door for us and directed us to the check-in desk. There were no long, winding lines waiting to check-in, just nice comfortable chairs and only one person in front of us. Everything was impeccably decorated and so beautiful. The room was huge and had everything we needed. And the beds were very comfortable. They have a water park on the resort that is included in your stay. With a lazy river, water slide and a kids area, you don't even have to leave the resort. My husband and I are not golfers so we didn't go golfing, but the courses looked amazing. I would highly recommend this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Best Resory Ever”
Reviews.Author: LIttleaby
Reviews.Content: We just staid 4 days in this resort went to take my little toddler and our friends that also have one to see Disney parks etc. from the moment of the check in everything was exceptional we rented a 2 bedroom Villa south and gowt a three bedroom it was super clean huge all the rooms were spaciouse and neet, the kitchen had everything you can ask for. I could just keep going on and on about how great this resort is will definetly stay here again a give it 5 stars 6 if possible. In fact we plan on going to St. Agustine and will stay at Resort linked to this one this Resory is definetly worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Dreamy”
Reviews.Author: Leslie K
Reviews.Content: We purchased this hotel through Groupon and it was well worth the purchase. The hotel staff was extremely friendly and helpful. No matter what we requested they were there to help. We stayed in the Reunion Grande hotel in a 2 bedroom both with ensuites and a full kitchen. Absolutely wonderful!!! The rooftop pool was beautiful and very private, not many people used this area, maybe it was becuase they were out golfing on one of the 3 beautiful courses on site. About a 10 - 15 minute drive to all parks, but very easy to navigate to. I would highly recommend this place to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “I would not go back”
Reviews.Author: osito181825
Reviews.Content: This is a good resort for people that want to enjoy playing golf but thats it. There are better options out there with better value. The room was nice but it was smelly,without towels, menu guides even pens. The restaurants have average food. Room service was pretty bad. I waited 3 hours just to get more blankets. We ordered food from room service but the food took to long so we called and they said it was coming. I had to call again and they forgot to make it. the food sucks and the service is bad. I called the resort before going there to know if the children water park is open during the time we were going to stay. They said yes. We got there and most of the water park was close. I'm sorry but this resort should be considered a two stars. I would not recommend it to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Golf Weekend”
Reviews.Author: gators93
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights in November 2011 with some old friends. We stayed in the villas, which had 3 bedrooms and 3 baths. One of the bedrooms had twin beds. Each villa also has a full kitchen with dishes and cooking implements. The "apartments" are well furnished and plenty of room for 3 or 4 guys. The wifi (free with your stay) worked well. Generally they are upscale. The bathroom in the master suite was like I have at home. The golf courses are nice and challenging, though a ball-eating monster resides in the water on hole number 14. Our golf was well organized and the staff was friendly and on-the-ball. It is important to note there is a no-tipping policy too. We had been quoted one rate, and there appears to have been some error somewhere, so upon check in, they charged me an extra $70. They did this without even telling me. I do not know whose error it was - theirs or my group organizer ... but either way I was disappointed to find a second charge ... which a couple of my group members had to explain to me. Just in front of the resort is a Publix and McDonalds for cheap beer. We did not use the restaurant except for a quick lunch and it was fine for that. All in all it was a nice weekend and I would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at a large three bedroom unit”
Reviews.Author: lovelacer74
Reviews.Content: My good friend recommended the Reunion Resort for a trip to Disney that included my mother, sister, wife and three kids. I was surprised and very pleased with the unit we had, the three bedrooms were very large as were the living rooms and bathrooms with a total sq. ft. over 2000. The water park was up and running and the kids loved it. The resort is close to Disney (10 - 15 mins) and Legoland (30 mins). The courses looked great but didn't get to play. There is a grocery store less than 2 miles away and with a fully equipped kitchen we were able to have a nice home cooked family meal while there. I was disappointed that the resort isn't close to any higher end restaurants just the typical chains with the "nicest" being the outback (within 10mi) the resort restaurants are pretty nice but not suitable for young children. I hated using the in room tv remote solution but that was a very small blemish in a great stay in a bueatiful unit. Everyone loved it and we'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “just short of great”
Reviews.Author: Robby-Bobby
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights on a father-son golf trip with 20 men. The place should be great. Service is still not what it should be in the club house restaurant and our room was not serviced the frist night we were there. Slip ups that a top resort should avoid. The rest was great and the golf was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Dawn B
Reviews.Content: Traveled with our 3 year old son who is not ready for the theme parks yet but wanted something somewhat close to the downtown disney area. Also wanted something quiet, relaxing, and yet had things to do on property. The splash pad, lazy river, & pools had us sold. Though it rained our entire stay, it was so nice to have more than a hotel room, restaurants on property, and yet a grocery store & pharmacy right around the corner. The staff was so nice & accommodating. Our son was sick & I called to ask for an early check-in & they had everything ready when we got there. I would HIGHLY recommend this place & will be back even when my son is ready for the parks...it is only about 15 mins. from Disney & all that Orlando traffic. It was a pleasure to come back to our "place" & be able to relax. It was just like being at home...with the kitchen, laundry room, TV's and DVD players in every room,and everything was very clean. We stayed in the Grande & I also highly recommend the sushi restaurant there. Not a single complaint. Loved it and will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Ever”
Reviews.Author: eaglenet
Reviews.Content: We could not fault this place it was the best ever, staff were just amazing so friendly and helpful. Louis and the team on concierge were just wonderful they couldn’t do enough to help you. What we loved best is it’s a tip less resort (the tips are in the daily charge) so the staff weren’t just great for a good tip they all went above and beyond to make sure your holiday was great. The rooms were big modern and extremely clean the resort grounds and facilities’ were immaculate. It is about a 20min drive from most things except Disney but it’s worth the drive very quiet and relaxing away from the hustle and bustle. We will be definitely staying here again 

Reviews.Title: “The Best Property in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: laplume9254
Reviews.Content: I hesitate to write this review. I want to keep this place our secret. It is fabulous. We stayed in the 11 story Estate tower and I cannot say enough on how beautiful and perfect the unit was. Two bedrooms, two full baths, a full kitchen. Perfectly clean. Towels everywhere. The service is wonderful. I did not have to open a door the whole time I was there. Only 6 miles south of Disney World, the kids loved the water park. This is the place to stay in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: thepeters
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with some friends who own timeshare here & absolutely loved it. We were in town for a wedding & the 6 of us (3 couples) had plenty of space. The grounds, facilities, rooms & staff are top-notch. The only drawback is that it's not very easy to get to -- the "quickest" route involves paying a $0.25 toll, which isn't horrible, but it's still annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Great Golf & Holiday option”
Reviews.Author: J0hn_Frazer
Reviews.Content: We had a fabulous week at Reunion (September 2011) and found the resort to be very pleasant.. I must say it seemed to be almost empty the first half of the week but I think this is very common for this time of the year.. It was great for us as we virtually had the pools to ourselves (Great pool at the seven eagles just seconds from our door & very good set up at the water park which is in the resort but a short drive from the apartment. We played 4 rounds of golf at reunion, trying all three courses and taking on the Watson course a second time, although all three courses are a little different there is nothing to choose between them on quality. The golf clubhouse also provided a great lunch and the pro shop staff proved very accommodating as our tour operator had booked us for a 10am tee time each day, but were able to change on a daily basis to times that suited us. We were on holiday with our two year old, the resort staff made him feel very welcome and we found the resort a great base to visit the Disney parks, we were just 15 minutes away. So close enough to enjoy everything but far enough away to switch off and relax!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort, deserves what you pay”
Reviews.Author: MigueAngel
Reviews.Content: Very good place to stay and convenient location. Close to the I-4, attractions, shoppings and restaurants. Specially good for golf players, tennis facilities also available.

Reviews.Title: “Book. It. NOW!”
Reviews.Author: sommerlovin
Reviews.Content: We were expecting a really classy place to spend three nights after our Disney cruise. What we got was that - and more. This was a great place that we will return to again and again. Our family of four (two adults and two young preschoolers) came here to unwind after a Disney cruise. We realized how close to the action (Disney) it is, yet it feels like a serene place far from the Mouse. It took 12 minutes to Downtown Disney. As you enter the resort you get a small idea of the size and scale of the resort - three professionally designed golf courses, multiple communities, and neighborhood pools/tennis courts/play grounds abound. The grounds are all impeccably manicured (as are the homes and neighborhoods). It is very easy to navigate through the resort and check in (in a grand grand lobby) was a breeze. It's a no-tipping/no-cash resort, but expect 20% service charge added to anything you eat/buy in the resort. No big deal - we tip 20% usually - but it did feel odd not to hand a few bucks to the shuttle drivers who will take you anywhere with a call and 15 minutes. We were in Center Court Ridge. We had a gorgeous view of a course and the neighborhood pool was serene and beautiful. Our two kids made friends with the other visitors, but for the most part we had the place to ourselves. In our pool there was a hot tub, kids playground, tennis courts, a basketball course, and a nice pool house with bathrooms, showers, etc... the only odd thing about the upscale pool area is that pool towels are not provided. The resort does make up for this by offering as many towels as you want from housekeeping - and delivered quickly - but I found this a little strange not to have them readily available poolside. Everything just felt luxe and cared for. In Florida we are used to seeing a lot of leaves/bugs in the water, but here the pools always seemed freshly skimmed and cleaned. Our suite was fantastic! We were in "G 302" and it was as nice as any Ritz or JW Marriott we've seen. It was, in fact, a Ginn property at one point and it shows! Quality craftsmanship and all the amenities of home. Our three bedroom suite had all en-suite rooms. The smallest room was large with a queen, the other room had 2 Queens and the master a King and a HUGE bathroom. There were 4 large flat screen TV's with 100's of channels in the suite. The decor and cleanliness were a step above the rest. We also had a stocked kitchen with SS appliances, W/D, and all the start up amenities you need (dish soap, Tide detergent, hygiene items). We spent two mornings at the water park. This place had slides, a huge climbing/sliding area for kids of all ages, very large lazy river, zero entry pool, and a fantastic kids staff. Felinda made sure our kids were happy and having a ball in all the little hourly activities they provide all weekend long. The cleanliness and well-kept comments extend to the water park and towels are provided here. The food ordered from the Drink Deck was surprisingly great! I would put this property quite a few steps above most places you can stay in the Orlando area.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great Trip”
Reviews.Author: taholman
Reviews.Content: Sorority Reunion met there and had a great time! Close to everything and wonderful place to stay and NOT leave.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place for our family vacation”
Reviews.Author: RJM1468
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 spent a week in Orlando, the first half crammed into a standard hotel room on the Disney property, and the second half in a beautiful 3-bedroom single-floor condo at Reunion Resorts. While it was nice getting free parking at Disney by staying on property, you can not beat the extra room and accommodations at Reunion. I wish we could have stayed another week. With the buy one night, get one night free offer, we stayed 4 nights and paid for 2, so for the price of what a one bedroom unit would have cost us there, we got a three bedroom unit. Each kid in their own room was just like home, and led to very well rested kids. The water park was great, as was the roof top pool, and the main pool. The kitchens in the units were very well stocked and such a money saver to be able to make any meal you want at "home". Not to mention the many fast food places right across the street and stores and restaurants with-in a short drive. A great place and we will be back - and we hope to bring even more family with us next time.

Reviews.Title: “All the comforts of home!!”
Reviews.Author: MOMWITHTHREE94
Reviews.Content: Myself, husband, three children and mother stayed at Reunion Resort from August 14th through August 23rd. We booked this resort through All Star Vacation Homes and stayed in a three bedroom, three bath condo unit. To familiarize yourself with this resort, please keep in mind that it is huge. Approximately 220 acres compiling a luxury hotel, villas, condo units and private homes. The hotel, some of the villas and some home are offered through Wyndam and can be booked on the website. In addition, there are several affiliated rental management groups which are considered to be preferred partners which you can also book through. We chose All Star Vacation Homes which is a preferred partner, thereby giving us the opportunity to partake in all activities and events located within the resort. Please note that if you book through an individual owner, you may not have access to all available activities, so be cognizant in your search. We had booked a three bedroom - 3 bath unit in the Sandy Ridge Drive area - Building A - ground floor. The unit was about 1900 square feet of space - plenty of room for all. It came equipped with all the necessities. Top notch appliances, refrigierator with ice/water, microwave, range with great oven, dishwasher and garbage disposal. All dishes, pots, cutlery and samll appliances with included as well. It did have a washer and dryer. However, the site advertised it as full size - this was a stackable unit - a little tricky to use as it was not a common named appliance. Not a deal breaker, but if you are traveling with a group and need to wash clothes - you will have to plan on smaller loads and more time being used. The dining area was well laid out with a table and six chairs - living area consisted of a sofa (queen sized sofa bed), loveseat and chair. A 52' plasma tv adorned the wall with bose speakers and a PS 3 ( games and movies are avaialble at Allstar Vacation Homes for no charge for use if you book with them). The unit also included a laptop computer for use with free wireless internet. We did have a couple of isues with the internet, but a representative was quick to come out and rectify same. The bedrooms were all very spacious with beautiful linens and black out drapes. The master had a king size bed with a 32' TV - ensuite bath with double vanity, walk in shower and garden tub. All towels were provided. The second bedroom consisted of a queen size bed, 32" TV and ensuite bath with separate vanity area and tub/shower combo. The third bedroom included two double beds 32" tv and bath with tub/shower combo. All rooms also had a dvd player. This unit was ground floor and just steps from one of the resorts 10 pools. This was great when traveling with older children. They could go for a quick dip and still be within your view from the nicely furnished, covered patio. The pool area was well kept and very quiet. Almost like having your own pool in your own back yard. The resort does have its own water park - we only got to use this on one occasion. However, it was a nice respite from the hustle and bustle of the parks etc. It included a beautiful zero entry pool which adjoined a lazy river area and water slide. There was also a separate water/splash area for the smaller ones with fountains and play area with smaller water slides. The park does have activities for the children at certain times, i.e. crafts and games. Extremely clean and well managed by life guards. You may purchase food and sncks within the park, but no outside food or beverages are allowed. The food and drinks were a bit pricey and could add up quickly with a family. We did drive around the resort a bit to look at some of the other properties. Again, this resort is huge and I would definately recommend a rental car if you consider staying here. It is approximately 10 minutes to the Animal Kingdom and 15 to other Disney Parks. It would be approximatley 25 minutes to Universal. The resort is located in a very quiet area, which was pleasant to come back to after a hectic day of being at the parks. There are some stores and restaurant located close to the reosrt area for any grocery items or goodies you may need. Overall, we were extremely pleased with out experience at Reunion Resort. I would definately recommend using All Star Vacation Homes for your rental as they were wonderful to work with, and they are a preferred partner for this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Really enjoyed our stay.”
Reviews.Author: Andrea W
Reviews.Content: This was the second time we had stayed here and it was just as enjoyable as the first. We rented a four bedroom house, intending to relax after doing Disney and Universal hotels for the first part of our holiday. The house was magnificent, it certainly felt like the lap of luxury. It was also clean and a daily maid service kept it that way. I was particularly impressed with the way they cleaned and tidied my teenage boys' room, this in itself was a holiday for me! Nothing was too much trouble for them. We had a couple of minor issues, but they were sorted immediately (dirty bar b q from previous guests, but to be fair we left it in the same state after our cooking) The house pool was cleaned weekly. There are plenty of pools to go to, but the waterpark is definately the best. The poolside service is very good. We didn't get around to eating in the on site restaurants, mainly because we had eaten out so much at Disney and Universal, but the previous visit we particularly enjoyed eating in Eleven. I particulary like this resort because I feel secure. Security checks incoming vehicles and also drives around patroling the area. Free wi fi in the house was a big plus, especially after an internet deprived stay at Disney, the boys were desperate to keep up with the cricket scores. We would have liked to make use of the golf and tennis, but it was just too hot for us Brits. I would like to return at a cooler time of year. In fact, we were so impressed with the resort that we obtained details of properties for sale. It is a shame it is 3500 miles away from where we live. I would not hesitate to recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “I would go back!”
Reviews.Author: SleeperLongIsland
Reviews.Content: In general, the Reunion resort was wonderful. We stayed in the 3 bdrm/3 bath villas. The restaurants were good to very good, although I didn't care for plastic glassware at "Eleven". The golf courses were beautiful. I would recommend staying off the ground level due to high critter activity. The location was basically 30 minutes from everything and although it seemed the resort was out of the way, it really wasn't.

Reviews.Title: “Beware the building work - you have been warned”
Reviews.Author: rodneybutlionel
Reviews.Content: We booked a three week vacation, staying at the Royal Palm at 364 Muirfield Loop, Reunion Resort. This was made through ---. My daughter is autistic and ultra sensitive to noise. Accordingly when we made the booking in March, we specifically asked if there was any building work in the immediate vicinity. We were told the house next door was nearly finished but would be definitely completed by the time we arrived. When we arrived at the house late in the evening (from the UK), the alarm bells started ringing when we saw a builders toilet outside of the front door. Needless to say, the house next door wasn't complete. Every day, with the exception of two Sunday's, there was a team of builders working from 8 in the morning - laying a drive, putting up a fence, putting up guttering, finishing the decking, gardening etc etc. Consequently we did not stay around the villa during the day. I would estimate that Muirfield Loop and Palmilla Court are no more than 40% complete so building work is likely to remain an issue for several years. Be wary of agents who claim that the noise doesn't travel - golf courses are not exactly known for their ability to absorb noise. This will mean that building work will be an issue for this section of Reunion for the foreseeable future. I would also note, the house we stayed in was within range of a tee-box and we retrieved four golf balls from the pool during our stay - a netting should be put up to prevent what could be a very nasty accident. To be fair, the house itself was stunning and could not be faulted - the photographs do it justice. That said, the primary focus of a Florida holiday is not the interior decor of a home. On the subject of Reunion, reading some of the comments about the Waterpark, I would note we never had any problems there. The layout is fantastic, the staff were great and most importantly it was well short of capacity when we visited. Reunion has the undoubted potential to be an awesome destination when it is finished, but there are several areas that are currently incredibly under-built. We would be extremely careful when booking the larger homes in the more immature areas.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: kylaroy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night last week with the hubby and kids (10 and 7). The resort was empty! Our room was very nice and clean. Alot of the lamps were burned out which was a small inconvenience but, not major. The kids LOVED the water park on property and really enjoyed that. Went to the pool near the fitness center and it just looked dirty and was too warm to be refreshing. The only really negative thing I can say is this: THE FITNESS CENTER IS THE PITS here! Ugh! The carpets are stained and dirty. It feels dark and dingy and plain old gross. It desperately needs to be updated considering the cost of the rooms there, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Very good villa/house”
Reviews.Author: Johnathanjohnson
Reviews.Content: Staying in 5 bed houses with pool exceptional service and quality. We stayed for 4 weeks and it's like home from home the staff are very helpfull my daughter is in a wheel chair and there's was 1 step out side we new this before we came and though it woldent be a problem but it was abit bigger than we thought with in a hour they had put a ramp there so she could get in and out with ease I would highly recommend a stay eny where on this resort we will be back and hope to use more of the high quality services (waterpark. restaurants. Golf spa tennis fitness center) Thank you for an excellent stay J johnson

Reviews.Title: “Very nice resort”
Reviews.Author: familytripper1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a large 3br 3bath house/villa on the golf course. It was beautiful, new, and very clean. Maid service daily. The on-property water park was great for our family. In fact, we replaced a day at Typhoon Lagoon for this relaxing day at the resort. Very professional service. The three golf courses looked great.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised and happy - great Orlando outpost”
Reviews.Author: markrotoole
Reviews.Content: We've long stated away from on-site hotels and preferred to rent villas when possible, especially in Orlando. I'd driven past the Reuinion many times in various Orlando stays. It sits on the highway about five or ten miles outside of the Disneyworld entrance. We got a good rate on a three-bedroom villa so decided to check it out. Our first impression was, oh oh, we chose wrong. But we quickly realized we did choose correctly. The place is huge -- it feels like a small city. Three golf courses, a hotel, recreation areas, a waterpark, villas everywhere -- you do need a car even to get around the property. But we loved it all. The room was huge and nice. Well-decorated, everything worked, flat screen TV, etc. And despite that the front desk said the entire resort was sold out, we hardly ever saw anyone else. The resort is minutes from a supermarket and maybe ten minutes to Disney parks (and 25 or so to Universal). Beyond the room, the waterpark was low key. Don't expect big thrills but on hot days, it was perfect for a cool-down. It has a small lazy river, a decent slide, a bar for adults, drinks and snacks for kids, daily activities and a cool misting gazebo area. The resort's main pool near the clubhouse was huge. It also had a nice outdoor bar (though it closed at 6 for some reason -- isn't that the time you start to drink?) and lots of room to sit and hang out. The clubhouse restaurant was also very good. And if you golf, there are three very different courses to play. We'll likely be back. It was one of the nicer villa resorts we've stayed at in Orlando and we've stayed at a bunch. I know rates can get expensive, so book early, get a good rate and enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Accomodations - very large resort”
Reviews.Author: Buffalo33
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed in a 3 bedroom condo at the Reunion Resort, while other members of our group stayed in a 5 bedroom luxury home. We would have loved if the entire group could have been closer together - but since we were in different areas of this very large resort had to rely on a car to shuttle between the two locations. Our condo was wonderful - everything very comfortable for our kids and a beuatiful view of the golf course. The kids LOVED the resorts waterpark (slides, lazy river & water playgroud), and the food available at the pool was reasonably prced and well prepared - nice not to have to leave the resort for lunch. Only complaint about the luxury home was that the pool was protected by an alarm that was SOOOOOO sensitive that even the adults regularly set the thing off while trying to get onto the back patio. We stayed at the resort after a FABULOUS cruise on the Disney Dream.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't Stay Anywhere Else Now”
Reviews.Author: livsamat
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a fantastic two week stay at the Reunion Resort and will definitely stay here on furture trips to Orlando. The accommodation far exceeded our expectations - flatscreens aplenty in lounge and all bedrooms and free WiFi - all a plus for three kids age 10,12 and 16. We stayed in a beautiful three bedroomed condo in Heritage Crossing overlooking one of the three golf courses. The outlook was beautiful. Condo was very spacious and immaculate . We had housekeeping services daily - beds made and daily fresh towels all at no extra cost. There is a built in safe in the master bedroom. 50 yards to one of the many pools dotted round the resort - this also was immaculate and had a beautiful outlook and the kids were able to swim until whatever time they wanted which was a great way to unwind later at night after a day at the parks. The waterpark on the resort is excellent for the kids and the staff there very attentive and free iced water was available at the poolside to guests. I think it would be difficult staying at the resort without a car as it is very spread out and where we were was quite a long way from the main hotel area and waterpark although the resort provides a courtesy car service to collect you to transport to the main pool area should you require it. The resort is within very easy access to all the theme parks- 15 minutes to Disney area and 25 mins to Universal. This is our third family trip to Orlando in the last five years and Reunion is definitely the best we have stayed at. It is a bit more expensive than a lot of other hotels but we wanted somewhere this year that we could spend a bit more time unwinding and relaxing and we were certainly able to do that here and enjoyed our stay so much that we are looking into booking again for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay, but policies could stand some improvements”
Reviews.Author: w0rks2travel
Reviews.Content: We are members in the Wyndham Vacation Ownership (timeshares) and in my opinion, it is through this arrangement that you enjoy the most of the amenities this location has to offer. There were no additional fees for admission to the water park, clubhouse, etc. Of course the golf was not free, but we did get discounts on that and most other bar, dining and entertainment options. According to other reviews I've read that complained, most of the issues centered around not being familiar with how most timeshares operate (no daily maid service) and surprises to what they did and did not qualify for. Also, after speaking at length with a Wyndham representative on the property, it appears that this partnership is undergoing quite a bit of transition (Wyndham presently only owns about 40 units, with a plan for a total of approximately 200 by 2012) and when renting from private owners (maybe even through Wyndham reservations (not WVO members) perspective vacationers should be dutiful in asking questions about what to expect. Our group of six (three children ages 8-13) stayed in a three-bedroom corner unit in Cabana Court (BLDG B, #304) which is walking distance to the waterpark. The unit was very spacious and the large balcony had a great view. The unit had a washer/dryer unit that took some time to figure out, as did the dishwasher. Maintenance said they get the same calls most every time someone new checks in. This should be a clue to management that changes need to occur. Another seemingly bad business call is that there does not seem to be much rationale to the dining and recreation collaboration. Other reviewers have mentioned the early closing hour (6pm) at the waterpark, but additionally, the rooftop pool also closes at 6pm, at which time the restaurant opens. The other large pool at Eagle's Landing stays open until 11pm, but the bar/kitchen closes at 5pm. Therefore, it's pretty much impossible to eat/drink at the pool areas after 6pm. Even though we had our own kitchen facilities, we had guests over one night and would have liked to have some snacks/drinks while the kids played at the pool. I understand budget and staffing issues, but perhaps keeping just one bar/kitchen area open during evening hours would be worth trying out. There are several small pools around the property (kind of reminds you of a community pool), so there's plenty of opportunity and space for everyone to enjoy the water. Also in the Eagle's Landing section a pool table (in much need of repair), ping pong, computer room, and small game room. Overall, we enjoyed our short stay (3 nights prior to the Disney cruise) and would return.

Reviews.Title: “loved our visit!!!”
Reviews.Author: Johnb1007
Reviews.Content: We stayed in main hotel. My parents,my 4 and 5 year old girls really enjoyed our stay. We loved the valet service the men out there were unbelievably accomadating. they took our bags 7 groceries up. Which is such a big help when you have too little ones that are exhausted. The rooms were clean and really nice. We went during love bug season. that was my biggest complaint. if you went to the pool you had to be in the water because there were bugs everywhere. luckily we stayed for 2 weeks so we did get to enjoy the pool without bugs our last few days. we would have eaten at the pool everyday but just couldn't stand the bugs. We had lunch at the clubhouse which was very good. besides that we will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Something Special”
Reviews.Author: gaynor_777
Reviews.Content: I just wanted to thank Reunion for the trip of a lifetime. We rented an apartment in Centre Court Ridge with 3 bedroom and 3 bathrooms, the kids had their own rooms with TV, DVD and Xbox. Sheer bliss! The kitchen was better equipped than mine at home, the living room was beautifully furnished and very comfortable and the view from the ground floor terrace was incredible, we enjoyed friendly banter with the passing golfers whilst sipping cocktails! We had a pool, jacuzzi, tennis courts and volley ball just a short stroll from the door, although we had Disney tickets we hardly used them as no-one wanted to leave Reunion. There are a lot of pools dotted around the resort and we particularly liked the cove pool with the games rooms and gym, you could get food and drink at peak times too. There are several excellent restaurants on site, we ate breakfast in the clubhouse - very nice and had a lovely dinner on the top floor of the main hotel called Eleven which has views of the Disney fireworks in the distance. The sushi bar in the lobby is fantastic - had a look of a Ritz-Carlton and the service throughout was friendly and prompt and kids are welcome everywhere. A nice surprise was that valet parking at the Grand was free - no tipping. Some people have said it is expensive but I think you get what you pay for and the minute you drive into Reunion you can tell it's something special. Unhurried and uncrowded and that's just what the doctor ordered! Reunion itself is very close to Disney, we got to the Animal Kingdom in 10 mins down Old Lake Wilson Road, Premium Outlets 10mins on the I-4, Universal and Mall at Millenia around 15-20mins. There's what seems to be a secret road to Disney through the resort and onto the 429 exit 8, hardly any traffic and it makes getting to Disney easy. We booked our stay through an owner and I'm glad we did, we had a very personal service, the owner was attentive, knowledgeable and considerate, any questions or concerns were quickly dealt with. Before we got there, they gave us the heads up on carhire, places to visit, eat and the all important theme parks. They had provided so many nice touches in the condo, too numerous to mention but we even had a 3D TV in the living room. On arrival the apartment was spotless and welcoming, we had our own code for the door so could go straight in and start our holiday. "Jeeves" the people who take care of the condo were in contact to make sure we had settled in and if we needed anything, how refreshing! I especially liked the toiletries! We enjoyed ourselves so much, we will be coming back and I will be booking this same condo again.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: precky1234
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to thank Reunion for the holiday of a lifetime! We rented an apartment at Centre Court Ridge right on the golf course, 3 lovely bedrooms and 3 bathrooms. Kids had their own room with flat screen TV, DVD and Xbox. Sheer bliss. We even had a 3D internet TV in the living area. I would say the accommodation was sumptuous, the beds were a dream and the kitchen better equipped than mine at home. Views from our ground floor terrace were something else, we enjoyed friendly banter with the passing golfers, whilst sipping cocktails! We used the pool and Jacuzzi, tennis court and sand volley ball court that was a short stroll from the back door, kept everyone happy! There are excellent restaurants onsite, we ate breakfast at the clubhouse - very nice - dinner at Eleven or in the lobby at the main hotel which has a Ritz-Carlton feel about it. Staff very pleasant and whatsmore, they provide free valet parking - no tipping - at the hotel. We also found other pools dotted around this gorgeous resort - the Cove served food and drinks at peak times, there's also a gym, games room and deck games here. It was surprisingly accessible to Disney, we could get to the Animal Kingdom in 10 mins down Old Lake Wilson Road. And it was almost like there was a private road straight into Disney from the resort down the 429. The Premium outlets 10 mins down the I 4, Universal and the Mall at Millenia about 20 mins. We rented from the owner (all the units are privately owned) I'm glad we did, we had a very personal service and nothing was too much trouble, they provided so much, the condo was spotless, lovely towels and toiletries, dressing gowns, beach towels, cooler, DVD's as well as free movies and internet. Their management company "Jeeves" were in contact to make sure we were settled and had everything we needed - how refreshing. I would say you get what you pay for at Reunion compared to other resorts we stayed at and the space is the thing you get used to. I would highly recommend this resort and in particular this condo for either families or couples wanting a romantic getaway and of course golfers!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: penelope42
Reviews.Content: I can't believe some of the reviews I've just read. My husband and I recently spent 3 weeks at Reunion and it was fabulous!. Reunion is beautiful, I have never seen landscaping like it, from the many pools you can use, 10 I think, the golf courses, the waterpark, to the restaurants on site, it really is a five star experience. The sushi bar in the Grand lobby deserves a special mention, a very sophisticated but friendly atmosphere and the sushi is to die for! We enjoyed Eleven - a restaurant and pool on the 11th floor which is totally unique, great food and service and while a little more expensive than some of the grot on the 192, I willingly paid it for such a wonderful location. Yes, it is a large resort but it gives you a sense of space, It didn't feel claustrophobic like the Disney hotels, at least you could get a pool you could actually swim in! We rented directly from an owner (all the property at Reunion is privately owned - Wyndham only manage a small proportion of homes - we learned that the owners pay for everything from the landscaping to the electricity bills! We felt privileged to stay in a beautiful house on Patriots Landing. We felt at home the minute we crossed the door, the owners had provided everything you could hope for. We had so much space, our own private pool and a stunning view over the woods. We have travelled extensively in many 5 star hotels but never so much for our money, we got 4 luxury bedroom with en-suite for the price of one hotel room. The decor was kind of upscale Tommy Bahama - it had a Florida holiday feel. I am now a convert and will not be going back to a cramped room with the hoards again! There's even room service so no need to cook, but being able to make that necessary 1st cup of coffee in the morning and sitting by your own pool is priceless. The owner was very attentive and responded to our every request. His knowledge of the area and the tips he gave us was excellent and I have to say the Management company made us feel like VIP"s. We had such a special time that it was very hard to leave, so much so that we booked a return trip straight away and I'm already looking forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “Reunion Management - still not got their act together!”
Reviews.Author: Cantray2000
Reviews.Content: Oh dear. I hoped that given over a year had passed since the transition from Ginn to Wyndham, there would of been some improvements. Not so, and its now becoming obvious how much Reunion Resort has been de-valued by some of the policies in place. In the past, each year, we have stayed as a small family on Reunion renting a villa privately though the owners. We have tried to rent through the "program" but the price is to high for any vacations over more than a couple of days. We used to stay for three weeks. We still had access to all facilities and certainly spent plenty of cash on resort! Villas were more expensive than other villas in the area - but you got what you paid for and the resort was always busy and vibrant. Last year, following changes to the allowed resort facilities, we were disappointed with the resort - it felt like a "ghost town"! Reunion lost out on our on cash as we couldn't spend it on golf or at the water-park. The Omni Resort welcomed our money! For this years trip, we went to stay at Disney Beach Resort for the first part of our holiday and only spent a week at Reunion Resort.
