I think that we have finally admitted defeat and won't be back to Reunion! Because the villa owners cannot privately rent their villas with access to facilities, they are having to drop their prices. This is great in one sense but has had the effect of de-valuing the estate. Holiday-makers on a tighter budget can now afford to stay there - but they cannot afford the rest of Reunion prices. They don't have the money to spend in the restaurant, bar or club house. They may get to use the waterpark for the 1 day pass allocated from the villa owner - but are they buying any drinks? And as for using the golf courses - forget that as the cost is extortionate unless you're on a "stag weekend" special and then you can roll around it drunk! Sorry for sounding bitter - but Reunion Management you have lost the plot! During our stay this year, there were very few guests, considering the size of the estate. Golf courses were desserted apart from one very, very loud and obnoxious all male group who created merry hell and could be heard everywhere on site. Is this the clientele Reunion has been reduced to? Soooo not attractive to families - who would spend longer on site, more money on site and wouldn't leave such an unholy mess for staff to cope with! Come on Reunion. Give me something to consider you for next year. I used to recommend you to all my friends considering a trip to Florida - now I would just be embarrassed if anyone took up my past recommendations! I understand the dilemma with villa owners undercutting "program" prices but there has to be a better compromise than the current situation. Its a ridiculous situation for a holidaymaker to be on site clutching cash in hand but not being able to spend it as they have no access to the facilities and staff are standing idle with no customers to serve! Its all soooo sad!

Reviews.Title: “Family Pool CLOSED!!!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyTraveler027
Reviews.Content: We were on a family vacation to the Reunion resort which is a beautiful place. My family absolutely loves the lazy river and the slide. Well, the pump broke the day before and half way through the next day they closed the pool. No slide, no lazy river, no swimming. Just the kiddie area which was crammed full of guests. You could of course use one of the other pools on property, but that was not why we were there. Sure things break, but it wasn't until later the next day that it was reopened. It didn't seem like a priority as we were told by the staff that they were only at 50% capasity. They said they would offer 'more' activities. All they did was put out some soccer goals. Did I mention that it was 95 degrees outside? How about offering the kids some free ice cream or some free ice pops to console them. "No, we don't do that". Asked at the desk...same answer. 'No, we don't offer any remuneration or concessions". At reunion, you get what you get, which is normally great.....but if something is not working...you get that too at the same price.

Reviews.Title: “unethical business practices”
Reviews.Author: jpwsSeattle
Reviews.Content: I booked a package at Reunion via their website. The "Spring Breakation" package was for three nights and included a $100 resort credit for each night stayed. Upon checkout, the total bill was about $300 more than it should have been. Turns out the rate they were charging me had increased from the advertised rate when I put the deposit down. When I questioned them about it, the first two managers I talked to agreed that the charges were odd, indicated I was not the first guest with this problem, and had to call their manager in. The third manager I spoke to was extremely rude and actually said that there had been a glitch in their accounting system and that the additional expense was to cover the $300 credit they gave me. [WTF!] I refused to pay any more for the nightly room rate than was originally quoted until speaking to someone in accounting. Since they were not available on the weekend, I paid the amount I agreed I owed and was expecting a call on Monday morning from their accounting department. They never called, and my credit card eventually showed two charges from the date of checkout - the one that I agreed to and one that was for the additional $300 that they charged the minute I walked out the door. I challenged the charge with my credit card company. The rude treatment by that third manager, their passage of an "accounting glitch" on to me, and their complete lack of integrity in trying to resolve the problem ruined an otherwise nice visit. I certainly would not recommend this resort to any of my friends or family. Overall, the condo was well-kept, the housekeeping services good, and the spa nice. However, there were a number of ferrel cats around the building who dragged dead rodents into the stairwells - these were not removed during our entire stay. The pools were good - but not as big as they appear in the photos.

Reviews.Title: “Great family resort, highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: RebFly
Reviews.Content: Every year we go on a Memorial Weekend vacation with 2 other families. Between the 3 families we have 6 children (3 boys and 3 girls) ages ranging from 3 to 7. This year we chose Reunion Resort and overall we were very happy with the resort. The Positives: 1) The villas: We stayed in the South Villas. Each family had a 3 bedroom, 3 bath. More than enough room. If you really wanted to you could fit 2 families in there if you let some of the kids sleep on the sofa. Very clean and nicely decorated. The picures on the website are accurate. 4 plasma tvs and 3 dvd players. Very spacious bathrooms and the beds were very comfortable. Also the location of these villas is about a block walk to the water park so if you have kids, I highly recommend you stay in these south villas as they are the closest to the kids activities. 2) Water Park: It's awesome! The lazy river is huge and fun with waterfalls and caves. It is attached to a large lagoon pool with a slide and a zero depth entrance (nice for the little ones). There is also a waterpark playground that the kids loved. There were plenty of lounge chairs and you didnt have to fight to get one. 3) Kids activities: They have a kids club but we didnt register our kids because we wanted to spend the days with them ourselves. But whether your child is registered or not, all day long there are various activities for the kids. Some are free, some have a small fee. There were various contestes all day long - hot dog eating, hula hoop, water balloon, cannon ball, scavenger hunts, etc. (I dont know if they had these extra activities because it was Memorial Weekend or if they do them on a regular basis though.) All of these were free. Then they had arts activities for a small fee ranging from $3 to $15 - tie dye tshirts, painting piggy banks, etc. One night they did a "dive in" movie where they played a kids movie on the big screen poolside while you swam and the next night they had a luau with limbo contests. The Negatives: 1) Pool hours: The pools are only open a limited amount of time - 10am-6pm on weekends and I think they close at 5pm during the weekdays. Only one pool is open till 11 PM so you still have an evening/night swimming option but when your kids wake up at 6 am (even on vacation) and they want to keep swimming till it gets dark, the hours are kind of a damper. But at least there is the other pool you can go to if you still want some night swimming. 2) Lack of Towels: A few weeks before our trip, I called the resort and asked if we had to bring out own beach towels and they said no, they had towels at the pools for our use. This is inaccurate. The only pool that gives out towels is the water park. For any of the other 9 pools on premises you need to bring your own towels. When I complained, they said this new no towels policy started about a week before we arrived. They gave us extra bathroom towels so we could use them at the pool, so it wasnt the end of the world, but still... your are a resort with 10 pools, you really should give your guests pool towels at every pool. So my advice: BRING YOUR OWN TOWELS :) 2) Large property: The property is immense. Its so spread out that you need to either drive to the other pools or take the shuttle bus. It wasnt horrible, but in my opinion just a bit too spread out. If you are going with another family, make sure you stay on the same villas unless you just dont want to be near them at all and only want to see them at the pools. Neutral: No outside food or beverages at pools: This is a negative at any resort when you have small kids as they can be very picky about what they eat and you dont want to pay resort prices for food for them when you arent sure if they are going to eat it in the end...However, I will say that they were not strict at all in enforceing this rule. We brought the kids snacks, juice boxes, fruit and sandwiches every day and not one resort person stopped us or said anything. Also, when we did order food/drinks for the adults, the food was very good and the prices resonable for a resort. Overall a great trip, a fun resort and if you have kids, you are gonna love it there!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort (but a bit of a boys club) without the beautiful service (not suitable for kids)”
Reviews.Author: Sharenav
Reviews.Content: Reunion has defintely got 5 star facilities - beautiful golf courses, water park and beautiful accomodation. But in our view it is not for families with small children. Reunion is a great resort for golfers who want to get away for a coupel of days, don't be meslead by teh family atmosphere phots on teh website - yes there is a nice waterpark but it ends there - this appears to be a boys club. We didn't mind paying the price for the luxury accomodation but where surprised at the following when we arrived: No room cleaning - if you want your room cleaned you will pay extra for it - we felt this was a bit disappointing considering the price we paid for the accommodation The main complex is not suitable for children. No towels provided at pools This surprised us and is certainly not a 5 star service. We could get over these issues but unfortunately we suffered at the hands of groups of drunk golfers who were down for a couple of days. Our room doors were being knocked at 5 and 6 in the morning (we have 3 small children so imagine how nervous they became). The police arrived at one stage and some idiots started harrassing married women at the bar (whilst their kids were present!!). This obviously put a big downer on our holiday and made us feel uncomfortable. So fo most of it we stayed away from teh complex and dined in surroundign restaurants. When we made our frustrations known, the resort management were not beating down our door to make sure the remainder of our stay was pleasant. All in all a very nice looking resort that is suitable for adult groups but not for families. The facilities are most defintely of a high standard but the service is poor. Overpriced in my view - reunion need to provide better service to their guests - Disney accomodation beats it hands down for service.

Reviews.Title: “OK Stay, but not 5 star, for sure”
Reviews.Author: Fred1943
Reviews.Content: Stayed at south villas. First floor because of having two small children with us. Wanted to be close to the water park. It wasn't all that close, but within walking distance. Except for dropping off, parking is away from the water park facility. The three bedroom villa was clean and roomy. Easy drive to the Disney parks. Did not play any golf, but we were right on a course. Should have brought a couple of sticks just to practice a bit. To the person, everyone is nice, helpful and friendly. A small shopping center with a Publix is just outside one of the gates. Here are some of my observations for you to consider: 1. We were there the first week in May. The swimming pool for the six or so buildings in our complex is somewhat small. Not a concern for us, but could be during high occupancy periods. 2. Appliances are "low end". Not a problem for a short stay, but the oven did not work the first day, the dishwasher when running sounds like a freight train coming through the unit & the apartment size washer & drier were really noisy and were 'marginally' effective. Not a big deal, but caught my attention. 3. The furnishings were not what I expected. Not a light, airy, vacation type look one might expect. Very heavy, dark appearance throughout in the entire villa. Not a big deal, but, again, caught me off guard. 4. Wall mounted flat screen TV in each bedroom. Nice touch, but the living room TV was hooked up to a Bose sound system that no one, I found, could explain how to operate all the features (at least in English) The only explanation I received on how to adjust the volume was to "push the button" on the TV set. It might have helped if I spoke Spanish, but I don't think it would have made any difference. Written directions would have been a plus. 5. There was no trash room, dumpster, bin, whatever at the villa. The explanation was to just leave your trash outside & someone "will get to it". That works, but if you leave it out in the evening that 'someone' is a raccoon. A design flaw. 6. 24 hour security, but if you look 'normal' you get a wave through. Worked for me, but just be advised it is more a privacy gate than security. 7. The water park is great for the kids. However, it opens 9:00 AM and closes at 5:00PM on weekdays (10-6 Friday & Saturday). If you are on a Disney intensive vacation, plan on giving up park time to use it. It is a lot smaller than you would think by looking at the pictures. During high occupancy periods it would be standing room only. 8. Had dinner one night at the 'eleven' restaurant one night. OK, but really pricey. Full meal with wine & drinks with the ++ and 20% tip charge, can easilly put it in the $400 range for 5-6 people. Not worth it. Service is friendly, but not as attentive as one might expect. Let's face it, if the tip is a 'given' there is no reason to try to 'suck up for the extra buck'. 9.Van transportation is provided throughout the complex. However, I wish they had a Disney shuttle available. Even at an additional cost. 10. We stayed there for $199.00 ++ a night, which came out to be about $250.00. It was an "internet special" price. I think that is at the absolute top price range for where we stayed! 11. The pictures on line accurately portray the resort, but it is really spread out with a lot of empty space. It doesn't have that 'resort' feel to it. More like a condo or apartment complex. 12. Would I recommend staying there. Yes, but not unless it was priced down to at least what I paid. Would I go back there again, probably not.

Reviews.Title: “My Favourite Resort In the World!”
Reviews.Author: hailey-x
Reviews.Content: Reunion Resort is by far the best resort I have ever visited and I adore my time here. I go with my family each year, and last summer was the 4th time, so instead of visiting nearby attractions as much (eg. Disney- which is literally 10 minutes away!) I stayed around the resort using the excellent facilities. Reunion is perfect for anyone, but as a teenager it was amazing! There were lots of other teens there too and so I made a lot of friends, and not for one minute was bored! We hung out in the pool called The Cove and private water park, the rooftop hotel pool or one of the many smaller pools, in the games room and around the golf course or in each others apartments and villas. My villa had a pool, and was the most luxurious place ever- my room had 2 queen sized beds in it, all for just me! The views across the golf courses were incredible. To sum up my stay it was amazing- all the staff were very helpful and had that lovely amercian charm, the resort's location and amenties were perfect and the friends i made are unforgettable. The worst part was leaving, I actually cried! all I can say is, roll on august, we're coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort if you don't mind walking or taking car to activities”
Reviews.Author: alexrn716
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the past at the Omni Championsgate villas that are down the road so we could not help compare the two. Accomodations: We stayed in a 3 bedroom villa at Centre Court and felt that furnishings and decor were comparable with maybe the Omni being slightly nicer but not enough to make a difference. The layout of our villa at Reunion was not as family friendly with the bedroom with the twin beds near the front with a very bright outside light shining all night long into room. If you want a sleeper sofa make sure to ask for villa with one because ours did not have one. The other bedroom was a double and we thought it was going to be a queen. We made do but the Omni reservations make it easier to make sure you are getting what you want. The Reunion resort is huge and I am sure if we needed to we could have moved to villa with another set up but we did not. Activities: Waterpark is awesome. The area is far from most villas but they have a shuttle and parking if you choose to drive. They have a zero entry area for young ones and great lazy river with slide (42"and up). During late April the "love bugs" come and they are very annoying. They don't bite but like flies they don't relent and land on all the food and drink. If it was not for the bugs we would have stayed longer each day at the waterpark. If you stay in the water they leave you alone. Food service is good. Did not have problem getting served. It is expensive and they do not allow outside food or beverage. We left during lunch and ate at the pool near our villa a few days. Tennis: We stayed at the Centre Court that is right next to tennis courts. Pro was excellent very friendly and they offer clinics for all levels and the kids! Took a private lesson and enjoyed it. Spa: My mother had a pedicure at the Spa and said it was nice. Not a large Spa but friendly competent service. Golf: We did not play golf but the courses (all three) looked amazing!! Dining: We had in room dining the first night because it was so late when we checked in. It was not very good and expensive. We stayed away from the dining options on property. There are so many takeout options nearby if you have a car including Chili's, Subway, McDonalds and the Publix grocery store. Overall we liked the Reunion better for the waterpark and tennis but the Omni is much easier to get around. Customer service for both resorts were excellent. Very friendly at both hotels. Go with the best price. I would stay at both resorts again with out reservation.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel but you need a car”
Reviews.Author: AntCar
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our two sons 12 and 14 in a two bed apartment on the 10 floor for 5 nights We had a very good holiday playing golf twice and visiting several parks. We were a little confused by the dress code which the info in the room claimed to be no denim and jackets preferred for dinner Forte closed the weekend we were their but we visited Eleven where the food was ok but many people were dressed in what could best be described as casual beach wear ! The Sushi restaurant at the main bar was very good Overall a very good experience

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: safa_in_England
Reviews.Content: Fantastic resort with excellent amenities only 10 minutes away from Disney parks. I booked through the hotel and stayed in Seven Eagles section. After 7 days of park hopping i asked my son what his favourite part of the holiday was and he said the hotel pool. One gripe was the cleaning of the apartment, it was always very late in the day (between 5pm and 7pm) and we weren't happy with the quality of the clean (dishes always came out of dishwasher dirty due to overpacking etc) despite us speaking to the staff on numerous occasions.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre accomodations and nickel and dime-ing at Reunion!”
Reviews.Author: gtqiii
Reviews.Content: The resort is a beautifully manicured large resort. The building where we checked in was elegant and modern. I was excited to check- in and see our condo as I was impressed with the initial building. i was quite disappointed when we checked into our condo because it looked like any average condo we have rented before in Orlando. In fact, the other condos were better (I.e., Sheraton Vistana Village, Summer Bay etc). I was more disappointed because we spent 3Xs as much on the Reunion Resort as any other condo in Orlando. I wanted to try it since it got great reviews. So, it was an average-looking condo. The next issue is that we booked a 2-bedroom for my husband and I and our 3 young children. Instead they gave us the very average looking 3-bedroom 2-level condo. I'm not sure why because the resort did not appear to be busy. The kicker was that they wanted us to lock one of the bedrooms so we could only use the 2 bedrooms we paid for or charge us extra $$$. Well, it was ridiculous because 2 bedrooms were upstairs and one was downstairs. If we locked the main floor bedroom, we would be shut off from the main bathroom (which had the only bathtub for our children to bathe in) and it also had the only safe to store our valuables in the whole condo. Further, we prefer to always sleep on the same level as our 3 young children. Also, I have never rented a 2-bedroom condo in orelando with the use of only 1 full bath- AND this resort was more expensive than the rest. If I knew they were going to force this awkward set-up on us, I definitely would have booked another resort that also had wonderful reviews. Finally, our plane doesn't leave until the early evening and we needed a late checkout. Usually at nicer resorts, they are pretty accommodating about late check-outs--as long as there are not other guests trying to check-in- especially with the higher price that we paid for the resort. I asked the resort for a late checkout and they asked for $50 ( while the resort is nowhere capacity). Very disappointed in these tactics at trying to get extra money out of their guests. Although their waterpark and golf courses were nice, I would never stay at this resort again. There appears to be a lot of empty lots in the residential section and it does not appear that the resort is as busy as other resorts in the area so it appears that they are trying to make up their shortfalls.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location for family trip to resorts”
Reviews.Author: DepDawg
Reviews.Content: We chose Reunion from TA for proximity to Disney etc and it turned out to be a great base for our trip. 15 mins to Magic Kingdom, Animal Kingdom, Typhoon Laggon etc and 25 to Seaworld. free valet parking with a very friendly team who went out of their way to help out, carry up shopping to the room etc. We stayed in a 2 bed apartment in the main Reunion Grande building and it was well appointed with balcony, kitchen etc and free wifi and wired internet pls 3 flat screen tv's. The onsite water park is excellent but drinks/snacks are relatively expensive there and your own food is not allowed so many people go back tot their own place to eat. The pool / bar at 7 eagles was nice (2 x jacuzzi), table tennis etc but limited sun chairs and busy on the weekend so get there early !! We didnt eat at the hotel restaurants but the one on the ground floor looked nice and had a good menu which seemed better priced than the menu on the roof restaurant called 11. Criticisms - the turn down service was sporadic if it did come came very late - eg 21:30 some days We encountered some noise from the floor above sounding like furniture being moved around which the hotel blamed on a group staying there, but which continued after they had apparently checked out so I suspect this is just because of the tiled floors transmitting noise between floors - ask for a high floor room !!! Would I go back ? - sure if we were going to Disney as a family it was a great base with good facilities. Also if I were an avid golfer the 3 courses would make it worth a trip in it's own right. Thanks Tripadvisor (again!)

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding resort with outstanding service.”
Reviews.Author: vluke64
Reviews.Content: My husband, eleven year old daughter and I stayed in the main building, "The Grande Reunion" I think, and our 6th floor 2 bedroom apartment was beautiful, huge and new (it seemed). It over looked the driving range and had a balcony with a great view. With no-tipping service, we expected that the staff would not be as enthusiastic, but the service was outstanding and the quick, courteous, free valet service was a favorite. The water park was awesome. We only wish we had planned more days to stay at the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Resort Destination!”
Reviews.Author: Kevinmawdotcom
Reviews.Content: Reunion Resort offers the best that there is in Central Florida, The exclusive Water Park is a beautiful place to relax and the chlorine free water is perfect for bringing younger children into. The 'Lazy River' is great and the snack foods and drinks are well prepared if a little pricey. Can't wait to go back and take some more golfing lessons and spend time on the courses. Kev www.kevinmaw.com

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: christyreznor02
Reviews.Content: The hotel is excellent. The villas offer everything you could ever ask for. Comfortable beds. Very clean. Friendly and attentive staff. Great location. Close to Disneyworld. Cons: The pool by the villas does not offer towels so guests have to get them from one of the other pool locations, which is silly. All of the pools should offer towels. Room service does not start until 4:00 p.m.

Reviews.Title: “Close to Disney, great value for the $, overall very nice”
Reviews.Author: amytude
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two summers ago while vacationing with family. This resort is expansive, everything from very large homes to 1 bedroom units. We are currently on a shorter 6 day trip. We typically rent directly through owner to receive the most competitive rates. Less than $600 for a 3 bedroom unit is a bargain. Grounds are impeccably maintained. My one major gripe is the water park. They have evidently limited owners in how many visitor guest passes they are able to give out. Part of the fun of this resort is being able to swim in a larger pool. We were offered one day at the rate of $60. I would just like to be able to pay a flat fee (not $60 a day, mind you) to be able to use this during our entire stay. Try explaining to your autistic son that we are not able to go to that pool when he sees all the cool and fun things to do there. They have plenty of other pools, but if you have 7 & 8 year olds they want water slides and lazy rivers! My husband golfed here on our stay two summers ago and thoroughly enjoyed it. They also have a spa, which I have not been able to use. We love that we feel away from it all, yet have a short drive to the theme parks. I would recommend a stay here, but be aware of the water park issue (if it applies to you) before booking.

Reviews.Title: “very good choise”
Reviews.Author: surymetro
Reviews.Content: we came back for a vacation trip whit our young kids , and we very happy about the grat condo we get very clean and brand new furniture . we very recomeded as a choise to go in orlando

Reviews.Title: “A happy wife is a happy life. Wow she loves this place.”
Reviews.Author: Shread
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for a trip to Orlando. Not beside the theme parks so more relaxing for my wife and I. My teenagers (16 & 14) enjoyed the three bedroom layout as they have private space. The suite had everthnig that my house has and more. We even had a blender for my son's favourite food, a fruit smoothie. We spent a day just walking the resort and wow. The beautiful pool facility includes a bar and a fitness centre, but I only used one of them. The golf looked great but no time. The water park and lazy river was excellent but very quiet. The spa was relaxing and the prices were reasonable. We ate in the suite every night or at the theme parks. If I am ever back in the Orlando area, I would book this in a minute. A little more than I wanted to pay but the value is there.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT resort if you play golf, otherwise it is just good”
Reviews.Author: bendover10
Reviews.Content: We had reserved a one bedroom villa in the seven eagles area. Due to lack of availability we were upgraded to a two bedroom villa in the main hotel. The room was unbelieveable, hugh with all top quality ammenities and kitchen appliances. We did get to see the room we were supposed to get and would not have been happy with it. It was old and worn, carpet coming up, old tv's, etc. The help is the finest I have seen anywhere. There is a "resort fee" tacked on to your bill and this includes valet parking and all tipping. My biggest compliant is that this is not a "resort" unless you play golf. The main hotel has a pool on the roof with limited hours. There is a large pool in the seven eagles area with better hours but it usually is very crowded. There is no lifeguard. The water park also has limited hours 10 am to 5 pm. I can't imagine why it doesn't stay open later. They rent bikes but there are no bike paths. You have to ride on the road. The grounds are huge and the place is a little hard to figure out there are many private homes, there are actually school buses that come on the property. If you are a golfer and can afford to stay in the main hotel you can't do better than this. Otherwise there are better places with more activities.

Reviews.Title: “The best way to do Disney with young children...”
Reviews.Author: ebalestro
Reviews.Content: This resort is a wonderful choice if you have young children who can't withstand 12-hour days at the parks. We were staying a week and planned to do several days at the Disney parks, but knew with a 1 yr-old and 3 yr-old we would have cranky children who would not be able to tolerate all meals on the road. Reunion Resort was wonderful at check-in, very professional and friendly...the lobby is beautiful and the grounds are meticulously maintained. My father-in-law played golf on 3 courses and said they were unbelievably fantastic. We stayed in the Centre Court Ridge area of the resort, in a 2-BR villa. It was beautiful, spotless, and had every amenity you needed. Daily housekeeping was impeccable, beds were made, towels refreshed, and everything cleaned. We had a huge balcony with views of the golf course. Flat screen TVs, dvd players, ipod docks...and all stainless appliances. We had a washer/dryer, too, which we made use of---it was great not to have to pack several changes of clothes per day. The resort provided safety rails for the beds, and also a pack and play for my 1 yr old. Our complex had its own private pool, but we chose to use the property's water park which had huge heated zero-entry pools for the kids, a huge play area, and a lazy river. It also featured crafts and activities for young kids and teens, and had poolside bar and food service. IT WAS WONDERFUL!! You had to drive to this area, but that did not bother us. It was a 10 minute drive to Magic Kingdom, a little less to Hollywood Studios...and minutes from dining and other attractions. There was a PUBLIX grocery store less than 3 minutes from the resort, and a CVS with a Minute Clinic. (Dunkin Donuts too, for all you coffee lovers!) We ate breakfast in our room, and kept plenty of snacks on hand to bring to the parks. We often ordered dinner "to go" from area restaurants, and brought it back to our room so the kids could watch a DVD while we ate dinner. All in all, the hotel gets an A+ for service, quality, value and luxury. They really did it right. This is the way to do Disney...why bother renting a tiny room with 2 beds from Disney when you can get your own living space with full kitchen, dining room, large soaking tubs and separate bedrooms!! Feel free to message me with questions.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: sniggy
Reviews.Content: We stayed for five nights in a 3-bedroom villa. The villa was very comfortable. I was impressed by how nicely done it was. For instance, all the fixtures seemed above-par. Henckels knives in the kitchen...expensive window treatments...very comfortable beds. It seemed like someone took a lot of care to make the place top-notch. The waterpark was amazing...perfect for our kids who are 7,4 and 2. They actually heat the park and the lazy river...something we learned isn't standard after staying at the Omni last year. We rented through All Star Vacation Properties which not only gave us a GREAT rate, they also gave us FANTASTIC service and great rates on our rental car and stroller. Can't say enough about these people. We'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “A paradise for golfers !”
Reviews.Author: AuldCom
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in a very nice one bedroom villa overlooking one the three golf courses of the resort. The “Forte”, the main restaurant, was unfortunately closed but we had very good lunches and dinners either at “Eleven” and “Clubhouse Restaurant”. Staff was globally very friendly and helpful, Part of a package “Stay and Play”, we played all courses, three very nice and well maintained layouts designed by famous Arnold Palmer, Tom Watson and Jack Nicklaus.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: shannonmee
Reviews.Content: BEST resort ever!! We travel everywhere and this place is incredible! The staff are the nicest... they never say no. I have never seen a better maid service. They come everyday and make it perfect.. they don't miss anything There are a lot of restaurants there.... a little pricey but, great! Everything is charged to your room key no cash! It is great We ordered food by the pool and the food was amazing! Everything about the place is wonderful Nothing negative If you have a chance you should rent bikes and bike around the complex there are neighborhoods the houses are huge! Any age will enjoy this place.. there is something to do for everyone Great location HIGHLY RECOMended!

Reviews.Title: “Exellcent Place”
Reviews.Author: JJS3
Reviews.Content: I was at the resort for a presentaiton - so was only there about 24 hours and did not golf or use most of the faciliites. The people at the conference who did golf said the courses were amazing. The rooms were large, very clearn and immaulate, with everything a family could want for a lenghy stay. Very comortable beds with lots of pillows. Large baths with enoumouns shower. Washer and dryer in the closet. The staff was friendly and propmt - even though they have a no tipping policy. The common areas were exellent and the checkin was quick. Had dinner in the 11th floot bar and grill. Good food well prepared, even if the menu was somewhat limited - but when I asked for changes, they were very accomodating. Will defintely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience”
Reviews.Author: BSchloss
Reviews.Content: We hosted our NAVIS Leaders Conference here with about 150 people attending. The rooms were amazing - very spacious and luxurious. The meeting space was top notch and the food was excellent (especially loved the sushi bar in the lobby). We had a great time and would definitely consider returning here for another Conference.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable service, excellent golf courses and fantastic convention services team.”
Reviews.Author: BusTravlr77
Reviews.Content: Our company recently held our bi-annual conference at Reunion. The staff is amazing. Everyone from the valet to the bartenders and housekeeping staff was simply outstanding. Played golf on all three courses. We liked the Watson course the best. The rooms were beautiful. I would definitely stay here again and hope that our company chooses to hold our event at Reunion next year.

Reviews.Title: “Value package with minimum amenities”
Reviews.Author: NYSpiffy
Reviews.Content: What resort does one know that only has room service between 4-7pm? and they come in plastic take out containers. It's like Days Inn with great golf courses. The Nicklaus course is beautiful and Watson, Palmer are not too bad either.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service”
Reviews.Author: MRCascio
Reviews.Content: Really great service. Always friendly and extreamly helpful!

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Conference Ever!”
Reviews.Author: RonFromOregon
Reviews.Content: Traveling from Oregon, I had the pleasure of staying at Reunion Resort for the first time. Our company hosted a conference with over a hundred of our best clients. Let me walk you through my experience. When I called to make my reservation, the reservation person was very knowledgeable and personalble. They had some really good suggestions for me which really made my stay better. Upon arrival the registration/front desk staff was great. That process was really fast! The accommodations were "off the hook." We had a 3-bedroom unit with a full kitchen, living room, flat screens everywhere, and a view of one of there golf courses. Perfect for entertaining and relaxing. Our meetings could not have gone any better. The meeting and convention staff were very (very) attentive. The meeting rooms were set up perfectly and the food was great. We had a few of our meals outside which was awesome. We also enjoyed their lobby bar and the 11th floor bar and restaurant. Great view of the fireworks! Everywhere we went, the staff was warm and professional. In short, we had a great stay at Reunion Resort. I would highly recommend you give it a try. Ron from Oregon!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and wonderful venue for business”
Reviews.Author: sbs_49_11
Reviews.Content: Our company and clients enjoyed the wonderful staff and great service at Reunion Resort. The facilities are first class, proximity to the night life was good and the food was off the charts! We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Best golf, waterpark, location for Disney.”
Reviews.Author: Goloworlando
Reviews.Content: Stayed a number if times now in the villas south. 3 bed, 3 bath, full service but with full kitchen and proximity to stores. Hotel amenities but flexibility of a self catering private home. Golf is outstanding for all levels, I'm a 4 but wife is a 27, both enjoyed. Kids went crazy in watermark, where there were more lifeguards per pool than I've ever seen.

Reviews.Title: “Lacked heart and soul, an unfinished resort.”
Reviews.Author: beanbod
Reviews.Content: Visited with family over the Christmas and New Year period 2010/2011. The resort promises a lot but is quite barren in places with many empty / unsold building plots. Whilst the hotel building is neat and clean we were disappointed with the rip off of a Club House which we had selected for Xmas Day. $420 inclusing a $65 compulsory tip for 4 adults and 1 child!!! In addition the staff had no discretion and literally stood over us watching us fork our food into our mouths, I did joke at one point that we should invite them to sit down and join us - very uncomfortable. The Golfers amongst us chose to play the Disney courses for £65 per round rather than fork out the $130 per round at Reunion. We did not see many golfers at all as we drove around. Access to Disney parks is good, not too far away by car, there is however no shuttle from Reunion. The Publix nearby was excellent with incredibly helpful staff. To sum up, we found the resort had very little atmosphere and felt a bit like an unfinished resort. It has so very much potential but fails to deliver and is a rip off - far more atmospheric places to stay for far less money.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaTravelbug
Reviews.Content: Our 2-level 3 bedroom accommodation was well equipped, clean and very comfortable. We stayed for 5 nights but did not get to use any of the resort facilities because of the cold weather spell in Orlando. We are a family that travels a lot and this is one of the better places we've stayed at. The only minor complaint was that one of the toilets clogged up 3 times but the complaint was promptly addressed each time we called about it. We'd be willing to overlook this as a problem with that specific unit and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: DANNY052
Reviews.Content: we stayed in six bed villa which was just perfect .we arrived late at night the security on the gate was very polite and helpful to direct us to our villa. the mangement company were there the next morning to welcome us and advise on anything we needed and again on the morning we left to make sure all was ok. the villa was 100% with the only problem being the lovebugs . the whole of orlando had the same problem at this time . the only negative was we were not allowed to use the water park and golf courses. i cannot understand the reunion people because there was no crowds using the facilities and the number of people with the same complaint was easy to see and hear.i dont understand why dont want to make money in there own resort . no big problem because there are plenty of places near by for golf and fun and we went somwhere different every day. we have stayed in other villas before and reunion has got top class villas but not that much better for the extra expense and then you cant use the facilities they have in there resort. D H NORTHERN IRELAND

Reviews.Title: “Never wanted to leave!”
Reviews.Author: Chickietravel
Reviews.Content: Great friendly service, beautiful spacious accommodations, loved the restaurant on the 11th floor, quiet, perfect!! we stayed in the main building in a two-bedroom -- big living room, full kitchen, comfy beds, it even had a laundry room. We could've moved right in!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay. Will be back.”
Reviews.Author: Mike_the_traveller
Reviews.Content: Before I start with the good let me mention some negatives. I called ahead of time the day of my reservation to make sure the baby crib / pack and play was in my room when we arrived and also noted it in my reservation. Upon entering my room, NO crib can be found. I had to call housekeeping again. The reservationist also said there were no wifi in any of the villas. To my surprise again, there were wifi! The waterpatk front door guard only give you one towel per person and refuse to give you more than one. Before entering any of the pool areas, there are signs everyone that fell you drinks are prohibited from outside. Well, if that was the case maybe the resort should make it easier to purchase drinks at the bar. Half the time no one was working the bar area and there are no service by the pool. Here are the positives, and there are lots. Free parking free valet throughout the entite resort. That saved us a good $15-$35 per day. Free wifi and free LAN line Internet in room! Another saving of $9-$15 a day. Full kitchen and new stainless Steel appliances, made all breakfast in room and snacks. Another saving comparing to Disney resorts. We were in a 3 be 3 bath unit south villa. Absolutely huge and clean. But we dud not have a golf course view that they advertise about. A matter fact, most of the villas do not seem like they would gave a view of the course. Only a select few. Didn't bother me too much since we were never in the room. If you want to golf, this place is for you. Huge course, designed by three big names, and a good club house. Resort is not for you if u want to wake up, walk down stairsv to the pool or to the restaurants. Most of the villas are far far far far away from each other and the main hotel. And calling the shuttle is really a pain. If you stay here it's almost necessary that you have a vehicle. Overall I was extremely happy with my stay. But that was partially because I paid under $200 a night. I believe regular rates are much much higher.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: xabbar
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at Reunion having been there about 2 years ago. We booked a 2 bedroom suite/apartment in the main resort building. It was beautiful. This unit is a small apartment with 2 bed/2bath, fully equipped kitchen, laundry, dining/living area and balcony. Everything was immaculate. We shopped for some basic foodstuffs nearby at a Publix and had breakfast 'at home' and sometimes dinner. With young children this can be very convenient, especially after a long day at Disney and too much junk food! The fact that the resort was a 15/20 minute drive from Disney was a plus - it was a nice, quiet respite from all the hustle and bustle of the parks. My husband would be up early for his golf game (there a 3 courses) and we would be off by 10:30am. If you are looking for a very nice, affordable location with good service and well maintained grounds/amenities, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: philhollowayinuk
Reviews.Content: We recently privately rented a 3 bed villa in Seven Eagles Drive on the Reunion Resort for the 1st week of August for a Disney Vacation. Checkout VRBO.COM - Listing #232164 and www.florida7eagles.com. The accomodation was clean, well appointed and large. We had great views out of the windows of the golf course. Bedrooms were very pleasant, all had ensuite facilites and the beds very comfortable. We used the Seven Eagles pool and the Water Park which were both FAB. Distance to Disney was a mere 15 minutes drive. Reunion Resort is immaculate, well kept and certainly had more facilites than we used. Across the main entrance road was an excellent Publix Supermarket and other useful shops. Cost was about £750 for the week, a bargain for a property of this standard. Would definitely recommend to anyone, but if you can; come when the weather is less hot, It hit 105 degress whilst we were there!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable, Very Clean, Excellent Security and great for kids.”
Reviews.Author: HC_TRAVELER_FA
Reviews.Content: Took my wife and two grandkids (11 and 3) to Disney for the week of Aug 16-21. The two bedroom Villa had more than enough room for the kids to play watch TV and have fun, while we had the privacy of our own suite upstairs... The kitchen was well appointed with all needed utensils. The tip-less no cash policy is a plus. The hotel provided daily activities for kids, water Slide Park and pool was an added amenity and break for us. Location is close to Disney and area restaurants. Ordering food through room service is pricey, however there is a grocery store about two miles away. Great bar and restaurant for adults in main resort building. Will stay there again next year……

Reviews.Title: “Private Pool Unsanitary.”
Reviews.Author: GLOBALTRAVELER4
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and purposely rented property OV403S, located at 7403 Velleux Street. because it had a private screened pool. When we arrived the pool was covered with winged insects. The screen enclosure was intact and no screen panels appeared loose or torn. The next day we called the front desk and spoke with "Misty". Misty had a lack of comprehension of how severe the insect issue was, even to the point to state 'that this Florida'. The Reunion staff arrived shortly after and attempted to scoop up the insects. Then the pump was activated. The insects remained. On the 26th a pool contractor arrived with 2 Reunion representatives and they said they would take care of it. We went out and about the Orlando Attractions. We arrived early that evening in hopes to finally enjoy the pool. Again, the whole surface was overrun by winged insects. The 27th, our last night, I took a sample of the pool water to the Front Desk manager around 4:00 pm to convey my dissatisfaction with their results. She offered to switch homes, but I replied we are checking out tomorrow, but were not happy with the pool. You are better off renting without the private screened pool. Their small water park is inclusive with the nightly rate. This will be our last time at this resort. Way overpriced. Property OV403S has no ceiling fans.

Reviews.Title: “Reunion is a great option when staying in Orlando”
Reviews.Author: 1mayday1
Reviews.Content: Spent a week with the family in Orlando and decided to stay off-campus (non-Disney). We've stayed at Reunion before and always had great experiences. We're a family of 5 and find 3 bedroom condos essential for our survival. The condos at Reunion are always very nice. You can find very reasonable rates at Reunion through numerous rental sites. Reunion has 54 holes of fantastic golf (pricey), a wonderful water park, and many pools scattered throughout the community. It's within a 10 or 15 minute drive to most of the Disney parks. Just beware, if you're not booking through the actual resort perks such as club membership, location, and quality are not guaranteed. We booked directly through an owner this time who led us to believe that he belonged to the club when he in fact did not. This meant no water park or club privileges which is a big reason we stay at Reunion.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for a golf trip”
Reviews.Author: raincheck10
Reviews.Content: Went on a golf outing with a large number of guys and found the Reunion Resort to be a perfect place for a golf trip. We stayed in the 3 bedroom villas at Center Court and the rooms were fantastic. Nicer furnishings than my own house. Food and staff at the Resort were all topnotch. The golf courses were all challenging and in great shape. I would certainly come back here on a golf trip or with the family.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our 14-night stay at Reunion”
Reviews.Author: bbovie
Reviews.Content: Our Canadian family of 4 (children ages 7 & 9) just completed 14 nights at Reunion. The resort is large and beautiful, the staff are very friendly & efficient, and our 3-bedroom condo was spacious and very comfortable. We booked through Travelocity, and the resort initially had us in a less-desirable unit, but we were able to move to a better location without a problem. We had full use of the resort's pools, great golf courses and tennis. Our kids loved the resort's private water park and spent many hours there over several days; they also enjoyed several of the resort's 10 pools. Dinner at the resort's "Eleven" restaurant was excellent; we also dined at their "Clubhouse," where the food quality was uneven -- plus we waited 35 minutes to be seated, although the restaurant never became more than half full; management's excuses for the wait were unsatisfactory. The resort is a large, gated community, which helped us feel more secure. We never used the resort's free shuttle service, opting to drive from our condo to the other on-site pools, golf, water park, etc. Free parking was plentiful wherever we went. The resort is huge, but easily navigated by car. Here are our overall impressions: PROS -- Beautiful, lush landscaping, expertly maintained -- Large condo unit; quality beds, linen (we stayed in Heritage Crossing) -- Daily maid service; (occasionally forgot to supply soap bars or coffee; no big deal) -- Fantastic private water park for the kids; efficient poolside service for drinks/lunch -- Large (75-foot?) pool & hot tub steps from our condo unit; we had it to ourselves, most of the time -- Professional and very helpful, friendly staff; everyone we dealt with on the phone or in person was great, without exception! -- A large grocery store & pharmacy were literally across the street; super convenient! -- Our son had a minor medical problem, and the resort recommended a Medical Clinic that was only 5 minutes away; excellent Doctor and staff CONS -- A bit farther from the Disney parks & Downtown Disney than we would have liked; distance is only 8-9 miles, but tourist traffic often led to congestion and longer drives than we wanted; however, we learned to time our trips to avoid most of the tie-ups -- Only two on-site restaurants, and very limited dining choices nearby; other than a Chili's about 3 miles away, there were only fast-food places, which we avoided completely -- (sort of a 'CON') Reunion adds 18% gratuity to all on-site services, including food/beverages; that, plus the local taxes made things a bit pricey; we knew this before we arrived, but it was still startling to pay $85 for a relatively simple, poolside lunch (including 2 Gin & Tonics) at the water park. The resort is very upmarket, but be prepared to pay for it!! We don't regret the cost, at all. The staff were so good, we would have tipped them 18% anyway, and often topped up to show our gratitude for their superb service. -- The central air-conditioning unit in our condo was quite noisy, but did keep us comfortably cool in the hot, humid August Orlando climate. -- There was no Wi-Fi Internet coverage in our condo complex, but there were high-speed ports throughout the unit, and the Internet speed was quite good; I would have preferred Wi-Fi, but it wasn't a deal breaker With the provisos mentioned above, we'd certainly recommend this resort to others and will likely return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay- Rented a Home, However ...”
Reviews.Author: Southton
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a 4 day stay at the Reunion Resort. We decided to splurge a little and rent a four bedroom home with a private backyard pool and a lovely view of the golf course. Overall, our stay was fabulous because it was problem free. However, do check on your reservation before you go. I called the resort directly. We originally reserved one home then decided to upgrade to another. No problem- we were able to get the home we wanted with all of its added amenities. The resort is good about sending email confirmations, but as our trip drew closer I noticed that none of them stated the property number we were staying in. I wanted to confirm that we had the upgraded house that we had already paid for in advance. When I called reservations, I was surprised to learn that we had been moved to a comparable sized home, but not with the special amenities like the home that convinced us to upgrade. The reservations folks did apologize, promised to look into the matter and get back to me shortly. They called me back promptly (I was expecting the worse that we would have to settle), but they were able to put us back in the right home. I still don't know what exactly happened. Perhaps we got bumped for another guest who was staying longer. The rest of our stay went without a problem. We were cheerfully greeted at check-in. More importantly, the home exceeded our expectations. I was fearful that the pictures were too good to be true and the property would be tired and worn. That was not the case. The home was immaculate. It was very clean and housekeeping came daily. Our backyard pool was not screened, because of the golf course view, so we had little bugs and leaves in the pool. That's understandable, so I called to have it cleaned and they were very responsive each time. No complaints on service. Also, our home had free wifi service. The grounds all over the resort are very well kept. The water park was also fun, ... however the pool hours are short. The shuttle is very convenient and will pick you up and take anywhere on the resort property. The resort is very convenient to the Disney Parks. By the way- you can see the Magic Kingdom fireworks show every night from the 11th floor outdoor pool/bar/restaurant. There is also a Publix grocery store and a few fast food joints just outside the resort boundary. So, if you have a rental car, you don't have to go very far. Overall, our experience was great. I would stay there again. It can be pricey, but for a short stay and especially one you don't mind splurging a little, it's a great experience. I would have given them a 5 star rating, but the whole switcheroo thing made me a bit salty, even though they did make good on it, but only because I called and confirmed in advance. Enjoy your stay!

Reviews.Title: “Reunion Resort - Unclear on Policies”
Reviews.Author: saintglen
Reviews.Content: Although I have taken holidays in Orlando for the last 9 years - I am planning to visit Reunion Resort for the 1st time. I have booked a villa via some very lovely people - who have confirmred that although I will need passes for the Water Park (which are required to be consecutive days) I will be able to access all othe facilities, golf, spa, tennis, restaurants as long as I have a 'Credit Card'. In effect I will be a house guest for 2 days. Having read other reviews on this site - this conflicted - so I called reunion directly and was eventually put through to the Membership Section - who informed me I could not access golf, spa or tennis without being a member. He was not particularly helpful and seemed unsure. I called the private villa owners who assured me this was not the case and that Reunion representatives state this to prevent people booking privately. They are going to check this through, they live locally I will be able to contact them should there be any problems. What a sad state of affairs - Wyndham need to sort this out quickly or they are going to soon have a very bad reputation. It is becoming very political and it seems they ar treating the private villa owners very badly. I would welcome advice for anyone out there - who knows what the exact position is regarding this matter. It is astonishing that you can book a villa at Reunion - but not be allowed to use the facilities. As a regular visit to Orlando who has had 1 or 2 bad experiences - I always check my holiday out in great detail, I feel sorry for the poor people who will be shocked by these policies. It is also astonishing that you cannot even pay for the services. Wyndham - you need to sort this out quickly - or you will fast lose business.

Reviews.Title: “Great to stay - if you dont want to use ANY of the facilities!”
Reviews.Author: Jem7979
Reviews.Content: We stayed in reunion as it had come highly recommended. The resort is beautiful and a skip and hop away from Disney and the I4. However because we rented privately through a villa owner we were not allowed to use the water park, the golf and actually it felt that we were not particuarly welcome in the hotel either. I felt like a second class citizen and I certainly wouldnt recommend or go back. It is no wonder that the place is like a ghost town!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with new policies”
Reviews.Author: Cantray2000
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Reunion Resort every year for the past five - it was always fabulous until this year! We have chosen to rent from private owners and have struck up good friendships with the owners we have rented from the last three years. They signed us as guests and we could take advantage of the wonderful facilities - paying for the privilege of course! We're from the UK and each year, we check direct with Reunion Resort for a price for our holiday - usually a three week period. Each year, we suck in our breath with the figures which are quoted as they are highly overpriced. It always appears as if the Resort is more geared towards short-term stays of less than a week. In those cases, the luxury price would probably be OK but the rate becomes totally unreasonable once you start looking for a stay of two or more weeks. This is one of the reasons we chose private rental - also we get to exactly chose the villa which suites our needs. In past years, we have spent huge sums of money on resort - making use of golf, waterpark and the restaurants. We are probably the exact kind of customers Reunion should want to encourage. This year, we were denied access to golf and the waterpark as the villa owners now only have a limited number of passes to give away to their guests. Needless to say, we spent very little on resort and felt annoyed to see most of the facilties barely used! This new policy appears to have come about as a way for Wyndham to restrict villa owners from renting privately and to force the owners to put their villas in the "Reunion Rental Program". Perhaps if the program offered more realistic prices to guests, then more guests would rent through the program! Come on Wyndham - sort yourselves out! It can't be good business sense to deny potential customers access to facilities? Surely there is a happy medium? We're ready each year with our hard earned cash to spend on your resort - but this year you just didn't get it as we visited Omni Resort who were more than happy to help us spend our money!

Reviews.Title: “Canadian Family-2nd Visit”
Reviews.Author: the3hooks
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd visit to the Reunion resort (our 1st was July 2009). We stayed in a 3 bedroom villa located in the Heritage Crossing area of the resort (closest to main entrance). The villa was clean and nicely decorated. Each bedroom had a flat screen TV (this may be different for each unit),ceiling fan etc.The kitchen was fully equipped with a granite counter area for eating (3-5 bar type chairs).The unit had balconeys off the main room and master bedroom.A small washer and dryer allowed us to do laundry at will.Each building (we were in Building "B") contains 6 units, 2 on each floor.We were very close to the community pool which was very nice.The resort itself was very quiet at this time of year.Any contact we had with the resorts staff was pleasant and service (ie: extra towels,soap etc) was quick.Shops,restaurants,gas stations etc. are close by and all the major attractions are about a 15-20 minute drive.Overall we enjoyed our second stay at the resort.Sometimes it does pay to "pay" a little bit more when it comes to accommodation.Many of the properties located on Hwy 192 (Irlo Bronson Hwy) are starting to become very run down and the area itself is very busy.As for the majority of the International Drive area, unless your a crack addict, forget about staying there!

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodations but be prepared to pay in full up front”
Reviews.Author: boyntonbeach
Reviews.Content: This is my third stay at Reunion Resort. It is no longer a Ginn Resort but a Wyndham Resort. I was angry and surprised to find that my week-long stay with the resort was charged in full two weeks before I arrived (with no partials refunds allowed), of which reservations failed to inform me. Travelers need this important information. As usual, the resort accommodations were wonderful, but the place was empty. Perfect for me who wanted the peace and quiet, but not appealing for families wanting the energy of a busy resort. The other problem was Forte restaurant was closed and only the clubhouse restaurant was opened. My three-bedroom superior room accommodations were wonderful and nicely decorated. Housekeeping is minimal (beds and bathrooms), no one mopped or vacummed the floors during my week-long stay. For families looking for a low-key, relaxing environment, golf (my husband loves the courses), swimming, spa, etc. Reunion is great (but be prepared to pay in full in advance). For families wanting to be in the heart of the action, Reunion may not be the place for you (but it is close to the Disney parks: 15 minutes). Also, check out the city of Celebration, 10 minutes away, especially the Wine Emporium. Great food, great wine, simple, and with music. A small movie theater is great for teens with an ice cream shop next door.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous: great service, beautiful accomodations, excellent pool complex”
Reviews.Author: ChattanoogaMomofTwo
Reviews.Content: Everything here was first class. Service was impeccable: staff was warm, welcoming, helpful. Condos with beautiful decor, great linens, stainless steel appliances, nice television, free internet, washer and dryer...every detail addressed. Pools are terrific, well maintained, tons to do for kids. Great restaurant on the 11th floor of main buildling for dinner/drinks. Close proximity, too, to all the fun at Disney, Universal, etc. In short, loved it..relaxing, comfortable, home-like.

Reviews.Title: “A beautiful resort with a superlative staff”
Reviews.Author: rm_bronx
Reviews.Content: We spent a week here on family vacation - we don't golf or play tennis, but had a perfectly lovely time going to the pools, watching the World Cup, and hanging out together when we weren't at the theme parks or other attractions in the Orlando area. The facilities and rooms are of highest quality and the staff is very attentive, well-trained, and friendly - they really make the experience. We ate almost all our meals in the restaurants on the property, all of which had good food and good service. The only flaw is the recorded music that plays in the outdoor spaces.

Reviews.Title: “over priced for what they offer and it seems vacationers have caught on”
Reviews.Author: Jacob1968
Reviews.Content: we we there in June 2010. This place looked deserted. If i say there were 30 families at the whole place i would be generous. Although you don't want it too crowded either, it is obviously not good for a holiday feeling to be with 2 other families around a giant pool. I can't imagine this place making it very long like this. Their waterpark is fun for the kids, but when you charge over $30 for two margarita's in a cheap plastic cup you can be sure that you chase families back into their appt for F&B.

Reviews.Title: “Recommend, But Hotel Service Needs Polishing”
Reviews.Author: drgrossman
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean and it was well maintained. I was pleased to learn that this is now a Wyndham property too. My son loved the water park and we liked the quiet surroundings. The service at the hotel needs polishing. This started with making reservations. Reservations was not doing what most reservation agents do, which is d their best to help the guest with the best options. Instead, after being quoted a price I asked about FL discount, then I asked about a possible weekend discount. As I was booking the reservation I looked at the website. "$100 off the second night". I inquired about this and saved an additional $60, but I felt as though the agent did not want to give me this discount. Odd, but I suppose not unusual. There is an automatic 20% gratuity on everything. Even when the service is lacking or when they make mistakes in your order and do not do much to rectify their mistakes. This did not "rub" me the right way. I would have expected better service from in this setting. We were checking out on Monday, but on Sunday housekeeping did not clean our Villa (D-102). They saw us leave at 10am to go to the water park, but when we returned at 5pm it was never cleaned. When I called the front desk they said they would check into it and someone would call us. 15min later I called again and the front desk was surprised to learn that no one called us yet. UGH! I asked to speak to the Manager on Duty. I got the housekeeping supervisor. I asked if she was the MOD and she was not. Then I spoke to the MOD, who was supposedly the Director of Housekeeping. I told her the entire story and she answers me by telling me that there is AM MOD and not the PM MOD, but she would help me. The fist thing she did was apologize. The second thing she did was put me on hold. Five minutes later, she told me she checked with her supervisors and they said they cleaned the room. Folks, I am not an expert, but this put fuel on the fire. Was it an illusion that the room was not made up? Maybe someone from housekeeping made up the room, another person came in put everything back the way we left it and we never knew the real story. I got frustrated at my lack of progress and said I would come to the front desk to speak to the PM MOD. I spoke to the PM MOD and explained everything to Fabio, the Director of Guest Services. He asked me what I wanted to have them to do. At Reunion Resort, this is an unacceptable question. If Fabio is the MOD, then he should be empowered to fix the problem. Perhaps, with some experience or training an MOD will present some solutions that would be appropriate for rectifying the problems. BTW, Fabio decided to comp one of our meals for the foul up from lunch, but he never addressed the bigger issue of the housekeeping error. To me this was a bigger issue. They never cleaned the room and they said they cleaned the room. Incidentally, they did clean the room by 5:45, I watch the cleaning crew strolling to the villa. Folks, I am not looking for a free night, but for crying out loud, this is a resort. Don't you make it right for the guest and make sure they walk away happy? I would like to recommend this resort, but I would also like to caution you that service is closer to a 2-3 star hotel. I hope that the GM realizes this and makes some corrections so that your stay is better. By the way, the beds are VERY comfortable. It was one of the first times I had trouble waking up because I was so comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “recommended for anyone”
Reviews.Author: 99redballoons
Reviews.Content: Took the family for a week to theme parks but didn't want to stay in any of the resorts. Reunion is just great for getting away from the frenetic atmosphere of the parks. If off route 4 and so is easy to get to and is only about 20 mins or so from Disney etc. What we liked was to have a full on fun day but then come back for a real rest in our own place. We stayed in a 3 bed house in Oconee Street that had a 7 seater car with it. There are 3 golf courses on the resort and this house was near enough to walk to the Grande hotel for a drink or meal. You can even order room service to the house but the house had a massive stove and fridge and BBQ so it was like a luxurious home from home. We'd get back from the parks, have a swim in our own pool and generally relax with home made margaritas which was lovely. There is a big Publix nearby to stock up on food and drink and some restaurants in Champions Gate. The water park on the resort is free with great pool side service and it was really quiet. As well as going to Universal, Busch Gardens, Disney, Wet n Wild etc we had a brilliant experience on an air boat at Boggy Creek and saw alligators in the wild which was awesome. Briliant stay really recommended for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Disney, Golf and Spa at Reunion Resort”
Reviews.Author: Redee2Run
Reviews.Content: My extended family met at the Reunion Resort in Kissimmee and spent 4 nights. My brother and his family with little children stayed in a private villa with pool which was very luxurious. I stayed with my husband and parents in 3bed/3 bath condo at Sunset View Circle. Our condo was very beautifully furnished and very comfortable. The only drawback was the highway noise at night. Of course, I did have the windows open since the weather was cool. I think in Summer most people would have the air conditioning on and the windows closed so noise would not be a problem. The best part of our family vacation was my visit to the Ginn Spa. It is located in what looks like a private home near the Reunion Grande Hotel. It is not huge and there weren't many other amentities (sauna, jacuzzi, steam room) however I had the best massage EVER given to me by ANGELA. Ask for her by name because she is amazing. I've been getting massages all over the world for 25 years and this was THE BEST! I tried at first to resist her suggestion for a hot stone massage because although it looks pretty in every spa brochure printed since the 1980's the old usual routine of piling hot rocks on my back doesn't help my tired old muscles... especially after spending an entire day at Disney with the neices and nephew and out-laws. However, Angela told me she actually massages with the stones in her hands and it was WONDERFUL!! Massage therapists can be stingy or generous depending on how much effort they put into the massage. Angela worked very hard and gave me everything I expected and desired and then some more!! She has a gift and uses it well. I'm still purring 3 days later.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Villa Stay at Reunion Resort”
Reviews.Author: wrldtrvellr
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a mid-winter break in a 3 bedroom villa at Reunion Resort, in the Centre Court Ridge community. The villa itself was fresh, beautifully decorated and immensely spacious. Our family of 4 was more than comfortable. The resort grounds themselves are massive, and it should be noted that a fare bit of walking is in order to visit the resort facilities, although a complimentary shuttle and driving are options as well. The pools are abundant, and the water park is a hit for younger families. We noted that a $6 per person charge was levied for using the water park however, and this was not previously communicated to us by the otherwise attentive and thoughtful resort staff. Reunion Resort is highly recommended. It is quiet, out of the way and a relaxing atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic stay at reunion”
Reviews.Author: EvieCee
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a private rental home and it was amazing. We could not believe the size of the resort and still do not think we saw the half of it. The facilities are fantastic with beautifully kept pools and gardens. Will look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Heaven - Great Golf, Property, R and R, Food and Staff”
Reviews.Author: spike9386
Reviews.Content: Arrived on a Wednedsay with 7 friends from college and we thouroughly enjoyed every part of the property! We played all three golf courses - one was more challenging than the next and we all had a different favorite. I loved the Nicklaus course - long par 3's, lots of sand and water - challenging but not impossible. The staff at the pro shop, starters, rangers and cart girls were all A+. Course was dry in parts but would definitely say it was a homerun. The 3 BR/ 3 Bath villa was off the charts. Immaculate, beautiful kitchen which was nicer than any of ours at home. Great balcony to unwind or have a cigar. Flat screen TV's to watch the NCAA's. Awesome! Property was well kept and the staff was on the ball!!! 5 staff greeted us at the Grand on our way to an sumptuous steak dinner at Forte. We had drinks on the rooftop at Eleven and enjoyed some of the games they had on in the lobby bar - they rolled in a few extra flat screens. Sushi chef in the lobby seemed popular too. We hit the water park and had a fun lunch while enjoying the lazy river - we all agreed, we can't wait to bring our families as they had a great water park, slide and grass area with bouncy house, arts and crafts and basketball. Fun drinks and ice cream completed the fun! We especially enjoyed the 7 eagles pool - outdoor tv's, 2 hot tubs, nice gym and arcade for the little ones. We had a cigar in the hot tub while sipping mojitos - good times. A lot of Atlanta Braves and their families were there for spring training. Saw hall of famer Sutton at breakfast and David Wells was playing in front of us. Tough place to leave but can;t wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection”
Reviews.Author: Hinsdalemama
Reviews.Content: We had a grat stay there. Everytning was great: the rooms, the water park and pools, the helpful stuff, and the food was amazing! We are coming back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury home with everything you could want and more!”
Reviews.Author: aynesh
Reviews.Content: What luxury to rent a home for our 3 young children, their grandparents, and a separate living quarter over the garage for our nanny. It's like a whole suburb in here. The restaurants are good quality, comparable to what we are used to coming from Manhattan. There are 2 cute little playgrounds, several swimming pools and a fun water park. The weather is just getting warm enough to really enjoy the water park and the crowds are not here yet. They have complimentary swimming diapers!! The shuttle arrives promptly and took me and the kids all around the resort when my husband had the car. I also strolled nearly everywhere; I enjoy walking and find nearly all the distances manageable; it's helps to know I can easily call for a shuttle if I don't want to walk home or get caught in the rain. Overall, the service is agreeable and responsive, but you do have to keep after them about some things. There was confusion over heating the pool. Although a key reason we splurged for a rental house was for the pool, no one mentioned that most of these houses do not have heatable pools and it took days for them to find other options for us. It's wonderful to have housekeeping every day, although they spray way too much chemical cleaning products, leaving fumes throughout the house. You also have to ask for mopping, which I did because we have a crawling baby. There is limited room service, so be prepared to get your groceries as soon as you arrive. I did a lot of research on tripadvisor to find this place and my family keeps thanking me for it. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Totally Worth the Splurge!!”
Reviews.Author: jccHalifax
Reviews.Content: Having rented vacation homes for several years in the Kissimmee area, this year we decided to splurge and go for a home in Reunion Resort. Let's just say it TOTALLY exceeded our expectations! Initially, the price tag for 10 days was a bit shocking, but in the end I could not have been happier. The photos of the home did not do it justice as it was much larger then it appeared in pictures and the decor/furnishings were amazing. Plus it was sparkling clean which to me is worth the extra $$ as I'm a bit of a germ-a-phobe, especially having toddlers/babies who are constantly playing on the floor/carpet! The resort has everything you could ever want- a spa, golf, it's own waterpark, on-site restaurants and is less then 5 min to a supermarket, liquor store, drugstore, Subway, Dunkin' Donuts, etc. I'm not one to write reviews for places that we have stayed, but felt compelled to write one this time as I was so pleasantly surprised at the overall quality and location of the rental home. Reunion Resort is the BEST rental community in Florida!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort: Value, Convenience, and Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: CambridgeMass
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at a villa in Reunion. The resort is reasonably priced, especially in comparison to hotels at Disney. It is a short ride to Disney, which serves as a nice decompression time after the bustle of Disney. The resort staff goes above and beyond to be helpful and insure that you have a great stay. If you want board games, just call! They will deliver them to your house. Forget to return the movies you borrowed? They will come pick them up after you leave. Recommended! p.s. Orlando has had a drought recently, so the resort is not as "green" and plush as it usually looks. The gold course, however, still appears to be in good shape.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous property, tremendous value, close to disney, villa was incredible”
Reviews.Author: koneydog
Reviews.Content: We just spent 4 days in Feb. at the Reunion resort in a 3 bedroom, 3 bathroom villa. The rooms were spacious and well decorated. Full kitchen. Full dining room and living room. 50" flat screen TV in living room and one almost as large in the master. We had 3 children who split a room with 2 double beds, and their grandparents who had their own room with queen bed and bath. The beds were VERY comfortable and we wish we could have spent more time in them. It was too cold to go to the pool area or golf, but these areas looked just as nice. This was a huge resort with houses, villas, condos, and hotel rooms. We booked through travelocity and got an incredible deal, however we were not offered a 3 bath option. When we called travelocity after we found out there were 3 bath options they wanted to charge us 900$.
