Initially, the resort said that they couldn't help us out since we booked through travelocity, but after I wrote a letter explaining our situation and that we did not know there were 3 bath options they responded immediately by email and said they would accomodate us for 30$/day! Bad opinion of travelocity (not the first time we have had problems with them). Kudos to the resort management. The housekeeper kept the villa spotless and the resort was a tip-free place (but would have gladly left her a tip). We also had a large deck with a full table and 4 chairs and 2 lounge chairs, too bad it was too cold to use it. Took about 10-15 min to drive to Disney property. There is a grocery store close by and a Duncan Donuts as well. Most of the other restaurants are only 5 minutes away. If you have a large family and can get a decent price we highly recommend this resort. It is quiet and a nice getaway after being around kids all day. We have nothing bad to say about this place. Parking at Disney is only 12 dollars per day at all parks, so don't worry about transportation. It was easier to drive than take the buses to the disney properties.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: TrvlBug007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort as part of the American express Orlando vacation package for 5 nights. We had a 3 bedroom condo. On arrival we checked in at the tower where an associate gave us the keys and all the information while we were seated at her table.This is a tipless resort where all gratuities are already included in the price. When we arrived at the condo,it was ready with groceries stocked as described. It was clean and tastefully decorated with luxury amenities. Though we did not get much time to explore the resort between our disney parks visits, we did manage to go to their waterpark, which though small, was fun. Our condo overlooked the golf course and had an easily accessible swimming pool in the backyard. Overall it was a great and pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “By Far...My Favorite Resort”
Reviews.Author: James-Laynie
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 1-BR Villa by the tennis courts. It was HUGE and so spacious. It had a FULL kitchen stocked with pots/pan, glasses, cups, mugs, silverware, dishes, utensils to cook with, and baking pans. There was a separate dining room too. The only bathroom was the one in the one bedroom we had. It would have been nice to have a half bath for guests who came to visit. But, how often do you have guests visit while on you're on vacation? (Well, when you're staying here you're gonna wanna to invite EVERYONE you know! ) There was even a front-loading washer and dryer so bring your own detergent. The decor was beautiful. I actually got some great ideas that I'd like to incorporate in my own home. There were flat panel TVs in both the living room and bedroom. WITH a DVD player in both also. This was nice because we could have our little baby watch his DVDs in the bedroom while we watched TV in the living room. MASTER BATH: I write about this because it's a big deal to me. The master bath here is pretty close to my DREAM bathroom that I would like to have one day. A HUGE tub (no jets though) that I could lay in and my feet didn't/couldn't even touch the other end of the tub. There was a separate stand-up shower too and a double-vanity. LOVED THE BATHROOM. TENNIS: We were right by the tennis courts which you have to go the main center to book a court and pay like $20 for the day to play. NICE facility if you're a tennis player. POOL: The waterpark there was fantastic. The lazy river was a nice size too. For babies, I even noticed that they even provide you with complimentary swimmers, in case you forgot to bring yours. For kids, when we were there, they had activities in the lawn area to keep them entertained. My first visit to Reunion was in 09/2009. We went back 01/2010 with another young family, husband, wife, and 2-year old daughter. The guys went golfing and us girls went to the spa. Best facial I ever had. I've paid for a facial (The Breakers in West Palm Beach) and just felt like they washed my face...this however, made my pores feel so clean. They do extractions! All in all, we made ourselves at home here. We brought our own food to make and snack on and cookies to bake. It was and still is (even after visiting the brand new Waldorf Astoria Hotel - Orlando) my FAVORITE resort.

Reviews.Title: “amazing as always!”
Reviews.Author: luv2travel1229
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this resort before and it never disappoints! Great atmosphere, great staff and unbelievable value. SOOOOOO close to the parks and all the action yet, situated in a beautiful and tranquil setting.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet... A little too quiet.”
Reviews.Author: StellaCO
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was very nice. We stayed in a villa away from the main property and near the water park. The back of our villa faced trees and some construction lots. We were the ONLY people in the building- in fact none of the other villas had furniture in them. If you want privacy this is great. A little creepy, but private. The location of the hotel made it easy to get to other parts of Orlando from the interstate including grocery stores and shops. The water park was nice. If I ever stayed here again I would stay in the main hotel, hopefully it would feel less like The Shining.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay - great for relaxing, kids, sports and access to Disney”
Reviews.Author: Monkfishuk
Reviews.Content: The resort is an absolute gem. It combines great service with luxury. Great for sports, in particular golf but you dont have to be a 'golf nut' to enjoy the facilities. The Water park is fantastic and leisure facilities for the children are in-surpassable. Access to Disney is so easy yet you get the feeling that you are a million miles away from the crowds. This place is paradise.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Customer Service but not the Property”
Reviews.Author: love2travelky
Reviews.Content: Let me start off with the high points. The property is beautiful! Golf Courses and the Waterpark for the kids was great. The 3 bedroom apt. that we stayed in was great except for a few malfunctions. The washer and dryer never did work properly. I had the wring my clothes out after each wash. I tried every diff. cycle to try to get it to work. The dryer takes forever and is loud! The coffee maker was broke, I requested a new one 3 days in a row. Finally got it after the third day and calling 5 times. Each time, they would say someone would be right over with one. When we booked the reservation in July, we had requested a particular area. We we checked in they had no rooms for us in that area. They were not even going to put our family in the same unit. After much discussion, we finally three apt. in one unit. Each of the apts. had problems during our stay. We all agreed customer service was horrible, except housekeeping. Other customer service problems, too many to report. We will not stay here again. We enjoy the Grand Cypress Villas much better. Customer Service and rooms are outstanding there. And the price is better.

Reviews.Title: “A great base for all the attractions in the Orlando area”
Reviews.Author: Stacey_Barton
Reviews.Content: We were looking for some Winter sun in a location good for "sporty" adults & children - and we found it at the Reunion Resort in Orlando, only 20 mins from Orlando airport. We stayed in the self-catering apartments near the resort entrance. They had excellent facilities, (air-con, filter coffee provided every day, free internet, washing machine/dryer, ...), were built well, were very clean (serviced every day), and we walked out to the communal heated pool - fantastic. (Note some apartment blocks are quite a walk from the pool). You need a car as the resort is huge (3 golf courses, tennis camp, gym & pool complex, hotel & residential houses), also you could nip to the nearest supermarket 5 mins away. For the kids, there is a good little water park, communal heated pools, and computing/games rooms near the gym. For the sporting adults golf & tennis, although the kids also had great fun with tennis & golf lessons. Golf & tennis tuition was excellent (Jamie on the tennis courts is extremely helpful & runs group fitness & coaching slots that are great). The golf centre is very friendly again with excellent teaching and a laid back approach to getting you on the 3 golf courses - I only saw one course but it was in good nick & challenging. Local sights: -- Sea World - excellent attractions, shows & rides -- Wild Wiley Airboat Tours - wonderful wildlife trip on the lake -- Cape Canaveral - 40 miles away, nicely done, interesting -- Disney's Hollywood Studios - pretty awful. Lots of queing, chaotic, little really to see, dissapointing attractions Overall: a resort that does what it says on the tin. Note that it is "cash-free" which means that everything has a 20% tip for the staff. We would go self-catering again as you can get a break from the processed food that you tend to see when out & about. Massage in room is VERY pricey - spa itself looks to be in one of the small homes.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect place for a peaceful family reunion”
Reviews.Author: Sandrin
Reviews.Content: Having stayed for a week at universal, we needed a place to rest and to make a break before visiting NYC. We were a party of 7: my husband and I, our children 9 and 13, my mother and our two best friends husband and wife. The check in was fast and professional with a courteous and welcoming staff. We chose a 3 bedroom apartment and had far enough space for our party. Everything was perfect, each room were impeccably clean with little details that make you feel at home. The spacious kitchen has everything needed. We had a patio where we used to eat and talk at night : let me tell you about the quietness of this place, although it’s a huge complex, we never have been disturbed by other people, all the time it seemed like we were in our own garden : ask for a patio, you won’t regret it. The daily house keeping is a plus; the staff is efficient and very nice. The GINN has three pools, the roof top one is beautiful and has a breathless view. Nevertheless we decided to stay near the lazy river for our children and we didn’t regret our choice, it was awesome and my 8 years old boy would have never left the pool! Fresh towels are given when you arrived, you have a great bar service where you can find kosher food and we always have found seats to relax. During our stay my older boy had a health problem and the concierge desk has been very helpful and reactive: 5 minutes later a doctor was on the phone and despite he was ok to see my boy he preferred sending him to the Florida Hospital Celebration to make blood exams. They took great care of him and after a day he was ready to continue his summer vacation. As a conclusion The GINN has been a perfect place from the beginning to the end of our stay and I recommend it to everyone who wants to spend a restful and peaceful family time.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Experience!”
Reviews.Author: djfitz30
Reviews.Content: This is my second time back to Reunion, Our kids love the Villa's private pool & the water park. There isn't much about Reunion I can't rave about (except the $12.00 drinks). The complete golf staff and the three golf courses were fantastic - And having Disney right down the road you can have your cake and eat it too! We look forward to going back for our third time next fall and has become a staple in our vacation rotation-this place has it all for both adults & children. Off-season is the best time to go - the golfing is always available,(never had to wait for a tee time) the pools are a lot quieter and the water park is a little more managable with less people. Take advantage of the Publix supermarket right down the road along with a liquor store, Subway & Walgreens. Great place for a golfing vacation w/ friends or a Disney vacation w/ family without those Disney prices.

Reviews.Title: “As nice as expected”
Reviews.Author: MrsJEssex
Reviews.Content: We spend four nights in a one bedroom superior villa which was matched up to our expectations. It was serviced everyday, which is something we wasn't expecting. It was very comfortable and spacious. The resort itself was very well kept. Our only whinge with our stay is that as it is a 'no cash' resort (ie your given an assigned card to your room/villa when you arrive) there is a graturity charge added onto automatically to meals, drinks etc. We have no problem with tipping if the service is worth tipping,but then it should be at our discretion not at someone elses. The service we received in the club house was not worth the $20 service charge we got added on to our bill, this annoyed us so much that we cancelled our reservation at the resorts 'Eleven' restaurant the following evening. And if your ever in need of a concierge, good luck, the desk was never manned whatever time of night or day we went into reception!

Reviews.Title: “Total Luxury - Perfect Stay!”
Reviews.Author: walker1971
Reviews.Content: This was our 5th visit to Orlando, originally as adults living in children's bodies and loving everything Disney and later travelling with our young children and still loving every minute. We have stayed in villas in Kissimmee (great at the time, first visit, decade ago) then at a Disney Hotel (great for location, rooms left lot to be desired) and then a privately owned villa on this resort (lost for words, but will have a go). The resort is a gated community which put our mind at rest knowing we wouldn't be alone in the middle of nowhere and looked like a quality place to stay. The villa, having booked at vrbo.com looked great on the photos, but blew our minds as soon as we stepped through the door. It was and still is the nicest, most luxurious place we have ever stayed (and there have been many), from the beautiful furnishings to the large clean pool and lanai and every single item considered when you want to stay home from home on holiday. We eat out often but also wanted the convenience of eating healthy meals inside as a family and everything was available to do this. The resort itself was ideal for accessing the Disney Parks, and although we always hire a car, the last thing you want to do is spend a 40min drive each morning (are we there yet?) getting to the parks, which is basically why we come to Orlando. There are a number of lovely restaurants within the complex, a great waterpark if you choose to stay at home and obviously the golf (expensive though, rent clubs elsewhere!). There are also a good number of local eateries nearby and a large Publix. But the one thing that made this such a special holiday (aside from the company) was the most delightful villa - a taste of how millionaires may live! Will most definitely return to this Resort.

Reviews.Title: “exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: debbie020
Reviews.Content: Reunion Resort is about 40 minutes from the airport. Before driving to the resort we stopped at Publix grocery store to get a few snacks and breakfast things. When we arrived and checked in we were treated first class. The Bellmen were right at our door to help us with luggage and even the 5 bags of groceries. Our room was on the 3rd floor of the Reunion Grande (hotel like setting). We were so impressed when we walked in. The kitchen was so beautiful. My husband commented that he wished our kitchen was like this at home so we may be making some changes! The kitchen has everything you will need, even coffee and filters, creamer and sweet & low, and we bought juice, fruit, waffles, syrup and sodas for the fridge. We also had a washer and dryer right inside the room so we wouldn't have needed to pack so much for our 5 day stay. We were at Disney 3 days and animal kingdom a 1/2 day. Our 4 yr old daughter loved the waterpark and it was not crowded on Sunday when we were there. We also drove to Cocoa Beach so our daughter could play in the ocean. The other cool thing we did was attend the Disney Polynesian resorts Luau. The Reunion Resort concierge made us a reservation the night before and it was really a fun thing to do. The service was first class, the room service from the Clubhouse restaurant (pizza and nachos) was great. This resort is a cashless tipless resort so you are never really allowed to tip, although my Captain Morgan and Diet Coke that I ordered at the pool was $8.00 with a $2.00 service charge so that might be how they make up for me not tipping. The one negative was when I was sitting by the pool on a Friday at 1pm there wasn't a wait staff until I called and then someone came to take my order, they didn't come back but I was done sitting in the sun by then anyway. The pool on the 11th floor is a great spot to see a view of Epcot fireworks at 9pm. our suggestion for a family with young children is to bring a stroller to Disney or rent one for $15 for a single or $31 per day for a double stroller. Our 4 yr old did great for about 4 hours then got super tired and wanted to be carried back to the monorail, then the tram to our car. It does seem convenient to stay at a Disney property onsite but the Reunion Resort is within 10 minutes by car and it was such a beautiful property with alot of room for the 3 of us. You can also take a backpack to Disney which will be inspected but load it up with juice boxes, snacks, etc...I saw people eating at various times from large baggies filled with crackers, wheat thins. And the last suggestion, get the fast pass. We didn't and wished we would of because we did stand in line for splash mountain for 50 minutes but our 4 yr old loved it! Space Mountain is set to reopen after remodel at Thanksgiving 09. It's been shut down since March. We were at Disney October 22, 23 and 24...keep this in mind because this is when they have their not so scarey parade party for paid guests. The park closes at 7pm but by 4 it was getting crowded with alot of people in costumes. Our best day for no waiting was a Thursday (October 22). Animal Kingdom was awesome with the safari ride and the Kali Raft ride. We will be going back to Reunion Resort because of the location, accomodations, and outstanding service we received.

Reviews.Title: “FLORIDA AT IT'S FINEST”
Reviews.Author: rjsmother
Reviews.Content: My husband and adult children vacationed at the Reunion Resort for the second time in Oct. 2009 and stayed in a 3 bed/3 bath villa. It is unbelievable and puts all Disney resorts to shame. Our whole family loved the free water park that is onsite and in walking distance to our unit. The villa was outstanding with 3 huge bedrooms and everyone had their own private bathrooms which was really nice. The kitchen and living rooms are very tastefully decorated and very clean. My husband and I agreed that we just love staying at the Reunion Resort just to chill and relax. Families will love the Publix grocery store only a few minutes drive away to you don't have to dine out every meal. I can't say enough good about this place and look forward to going back soon.

Reviews.Title: “A BEAUTIFUL PLACE FOR A PERFECT FAMILY MEMORY!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: nelsons654
Reviews.Content: It doesn't get any better then this! The home we stayed in, the poos, the grounds, landscaping, location..............it was all perfect!!!! I took so many pictures of this beautfiul home because it was like a dream! I would highly recommended this hotel!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Accomodations, Wonderful Golf”
Reviews.Author: ToujoursMax
Reviews.Content: We chose the Orlando area and the Reunion Resort this year for our annual golf trip with 4 couples. PROS: Reunion has 3 pristine courses, a water park, other pools, spa, and 4 restaurants. We were given two 3-Bdrm villas that seemed new, were very well equipped, & comfortable. We ate lunch every day at the Clubhouse Grille - the food & service were excellent. CONS: The master suite was very large w/king bed; the other bdrms had 1 queen and 2 doubles and were much, much smaller. Good for families, not so much for couples. Would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely first class resort!”
Reviews.Author: sk8mom
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Reunion Resort this past winter and absolutely loved every minute of it. We stayed in a deluxe/superior villa which was amazing! We had 3 bedrooms (2 being upstairs) and plenty of room for our family of 5. A community pool was out our back patio and it was hard convincing the kids to go to Disney - they just wanted to swim out there. The waterpark was also really nice. The kids loved the lazy river and water slide. It was such a nice relaxing resort that we plan on staying there again this winter.

Reviews.Title: “Just not worth it!”
Reviews.Author: TheMommyPlanner
Reviews.Content: Yes I am picky when it comes to my vacations, but that's because I do enough research to justify what it is I want. Trip Advisors is ALWAYS my go to and I have been very successful w/them, but... Reunion Resort 4 * , NOT! It's a shame, because it is such a beautiful place, but w/the bad customer service, false advertising and unprofessional staff it just was not worth it. Ok, so hear it is..just came back on 9/28/09 from Reunion w/my husband, 2 kids and another family of 4. We were hoping to have a semi relaxing vacation w/Disney for 3 days and the other 3 days to hang at the Resort. Who knew that staying at this so called 4 star resort was going to be more stress full then Disney?? We booked back in June after doing research and reading some of the reviews we decided to go w/this place. Big Mistake, Huge! Reasons we booked: 1 - 4 star resort 2- 10min from Disney 3-Large enough Villa for 8 people 4- Kids Eat Free w/ purchase of adult meal 5-Interactive Kiddie Spray Park 6- Gourmet restaurants 7- Pool side dining and bar 8-Golf (Husbands) 9- Spa (Mommy's) 10-Children's Activities So they came through on # 2&3. I was notified 7 days prior to my arrival that the 2 best restaurants were going to be closed during my stay (of course that was 2 out of the 3 restaurants the kids eat free). 5 days before my arrival they then notified me that the kiddie spray park was going to be closed due to renovations, so I called the Manager and I was very upset. I understand it's low season, but c'mon you tell me 1week before I leave. No apology, nothing just if you want to reschedule, for another time??? You break that to 4 kids. It was not the end of the world, but i did work it out w/ the manager that they would honor the free kids menu at the other restaurants (so I thought). About 3 days before I left I contacted the Concierge to confirm (again) our reservation and find out exactly how the "kids eat free" works, he then notified me as of Sept 1st they are no longer honoring this?? I just spoke to the Manager 3days prior and he never said a word. I spoke w/another manager and she said their was nothing they could do, it was now the Hotel policy from Corporate and they would not honor it (they eventually did but what a disaster when we were checking out). Moving on to poolside dining, what a joke. Big sign at the bar, to call your food & drink order in and it will be delivered to you. Thanks, had to wait 1/2hr per drink! Golf - our Husbands are avid golfers, but choose to rent clubs at the resort instead of bringing their own. My husband was missing 2 clubs and have to call 2x in the middle of playing to have someone bring them to him (annoying). They did say they would comp his rental, (but another disaster during check out). Spa - this was about the only relaxing moment at this place, but it didn't last very long (over-charge, again the drama at checkout). Ok last thing - Kids activities, haha! I lied - not the last thing, the lazy river was filthy and when a few people complained (not me) they smurked and walked away. And let's not forget about the "professional" lifeguards. They can't let a little kid down the water slide who is less than 1/2inch shy of the height requirements, but they have no problem throwing water bottles to each other off the side of the cliff where it almost hit someone in the head, go figure?? Point is, don't stay here! There are so many better places to stay. If you can, stay on Disney property stay, and if your thinking about staying here don't, you will be better off at Motel 8, at least you will know what to expect!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort for families”
Reviews.Author: OxfordshireDreamer
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many hotels throughout the US and Europe and definitely felt that this was of the top 3 hotels that we have stayed at. We were originally booked in to the Omni at Championsgate and were contacted 3 days before our stay to say they had had a computer glitch and the Omni resort was full. We were switched to the Reunion and were upgraded to a 3 bed apartment free of charge. The apartment appeared to be brand new and equipped to a very high spec. The breakfasts were great and the kids (age 5 and 9) loved the water park with the lazy river and slides. There are plenty of dining options on site (and room service) and a Publix within 3 miles. We have previously stayed at one of the Marriott resorts which was very tired and dated in comparison. If we return to Orlando in the future, this is where we'll be staying

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic !”
Reviews.Author: emily_b78
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Reunion resort with my husband and my 2 yr old. This resort was 5* plus! My son loved the waterpark and we loved the pools and waterslide. We were in a 3 bedroom villa that was beautiful - Granite counters, stainless steel applicances and the unit itself was beautifully decorated. The kitchen was fully stocked with all the necessities you need - cutlery, pots, pans, and they even provide dishwasher detergent and laundry soap. They only thing they didn`t supply was dish soap which we had to buy. Although a washer and dryer were in the unit, they are very small and did not fit alot of clothes and did take a very long time to dry. With that being said, it was still nice to have that available. The beds were very comfortable and the master had a very large ensuite with a shower and separate soaker tub. The unit was extremely clean and they would send people to clean it daily. The resort was about a 15-20 min drive to Disney and about a half hr drive from the airport. The only time I found myself complaining was the staff - or lack thereof - at the pool. We waited 30 mins before we had the server come back to take our lunch orders. They only had 1 person serving the pool area and the deck area. They had daily activities for the kids which was great. They even had free swimming diapers available if you forgot them! They also had a beach volleyball area by the kids waterpark. There was a Publix supermarket across the street and for food there was a Chili`s restuaurant about a 5 mins drive away. Overall, this resort was fantastic, and our next stay in Florida will definately be at the Reunion Resort!

Reviews.Title: “Canadian family review of Ginn!”
Reviews.Author: the3hooks
Reviews.Content: We are a family (mom, dad, teen son) from Ontario Canada, and stayed at the Ginn reunion Resort in Kissimmee from July 30 until Aug 5th.The property is very large and still growing. It is a mix of townhouse type condos and what appear to be private homes (most likely rented out).The main tower building is extremely nice, some what like the King Edward or Sutton Place Hotel. Check in was quick and courteous and our 1 bedroom was available (we checked in at 2pm).We were placed at the Seven Eagles complex building G. If you’re looking for a location close to the main pool/fitness area this is it. Unit Itself: Nicely decorated and furnished, very clean, air conditioned, excellent kitchen with utensils/pots/toaster/kettle etc.Two TV's (not flat panel or HD) one DVD player Note: All units are individually owned, so furnishings TV type etc can vary, but are very similar so as not to spoil the feel of the resort itself. Key card entry and secure locks. Main door to condo building (3 floors w/ 2 units on each floor) automatically locks at 11pm until 6am.Washer and dryer located on main floor (free of charge!)Main bed comfortable, pull out couch-not so much! The bathroom lighting was not bright enough (ladies for your make-up) and the tap water, although not poisonous, smelt like sulphur! Not good for making tea or coffee, so be warned! Bedroom and living room had balconeys.Small but use able. Housekeeping: Very courteous, efficient and attentive. Extra towels, dish liquid sheets etc. sent without issue. DVD went on the fritz and it was replaced the next day (they offered a loaner but we weren’t that desperate). Main Pool/Fitness area: Very nice. Large warm pool, 2 hot tubs, poolside bar with food. Covered area with tables to eat, or bartender will bring it right to you! Plenty of loungers, but as noted before in another review, limited tables with umbrellas. Plenty of towels. Overall very nice. Open very early until 11pm.Note: This is not the water park. We did not attend there, so cannot advice. Poolside food was excellent and drinks reasonable for a hotel. We did it as a treat. All charged to your room. NO TIPPING ALLOWED. You are told this specifically when checking in as it is already added to your initial cost. Golf Courses: Several. We don’t play but they looked nice. The resort is very large but has many sidewalks and paths for walks encoded not use the restaurants in the main building, so we cannot comment. Rooftop pool is very nice, so if you stay in the main building, that would be your main pool. Security is very visible consisting of uniformed professional looking security personnel in marked vehicles. You will need a car to travel to area restaurants, food stores and of course attractions. If you go left when leaving the resort there is a Publix, Pizza Hut, 7 eleven, Walgreens drugs, gas station, Pappa Johns pizza, Subway. If you go right and travel west (under I4) there is a McDonalds,Chili's,two gas stations, another Publix, CVS drugs and other smaller stores. The area is under development so I am sure other restaurants are on the way. 192 Attractions, Disney etc, are about 15 minutes on I4.To get to any where further east on 192 (Irlo Bronson) turn left from the resort, follow the road until it T junctions with a main highway, go left to Poinciana Dr and then left again. A back route. Overall, a nice stay on a very nice property. We made use of a "two for one" type special. We are used to staying in places like Country Inn and Suites/Extended Stay/Hilton Garden Inn etc.This was a treat for us, so the deal was great. We would not pay full price for the rooms and we don’t consider it quite a 5 Star resort (I think that the King Edward, Royal York and Casino Rama Hotels are better). Would we stay again: Yes, but as mentioned, with a deal on the price!

Reviews.Title: “good”
Reviews.Author: dobbyNorthants
Reviews.Content: Nice resort and good villa,four bedrooms with pool.The beds were very comfortable and facilities in villa very good.You need a car to get around resort,water park great for toddlers.Ate in Forte and club house restaurants,very good.Cleaning excellent,polite and friendly staff all round.Golf courses great. Would recommend this resort as a quiet getaway from the mayhem of the parks !!

Reviews.Title: “OMG!!! This place is unbelievable.”
Reviews.Author: TexasRhonda
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 3 bedroom/3 bath condo in the Sandy Ridge Area. These condos are very spacious and beautifully decorated. Balcony is accessable from family room or master bedroom and is huge. Table with 4 chairs and 2 chaise loungers with a view of the golf course. Clean? Immaculate! I have never stayed in a hotel or condo in all my travels that was this clean. When I say these condos are fully equiped, I mean fully equiped. They provide tide detergent for the washing maching, dish washing detergent for the dishwasher, shampoo, conditioner, soap, garbage bags, paper towels. Fully stocked kitchen with pots, pans, silverware, dishes, coffee pot with coffee, blender, fully size stainless steel appliances with granite countertops. Towels are provided at the pool, so you don't need beach towels. The main pool is the only one we used. It has a lazy river that we stayed in for about 5 hours one day. The grounds of this resort were breath-taking. Palm trees, flowering shrubs, etc make you feel like your in your own private paradise. I have read alot of reviews that led me towards or away from a hotel/condo. I am writing this review so everyone can know that this resort is as great as everyone says. This was THE BEST accommodations we have stayed at in all our travels.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic :-)”
Reviews.Author: Guggien
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 3bdr apartment,and everything was fantastic.The whole resort was very clean,and the staff always did their best. This is one of the best places we have stayed.

Reviews.Title: “This is good living!”
Reviews.Author: ConnieS
Reviews.Content: We returned today from a weekend trip to Reunion Grande Resort. I wanted a great trip for my husband's birthday. I didn't want him to worry about anything and at the Reunion Grande he didn't. Positives: - VERY clean (and we looked)! We could not believe how clean (eat off the floor clean) our room was. - We reserved a 1 bedroom and was given a 2 bedroom unit. Although we didn't need all that space, we loved the extra room and extra shower/bathroom. The deck was large and with the breeze it was perfect for sitting out in the morning and evening. - The bed was awesome. Best sleeping I've had in a resort. Quiet, not a single noise could be heard. We never saw anyone in the elevators or on the 5th floor. It was as if the entire floor was empty. - The kitchen was perfect size. Had everything you would need to eat in. We didn't eat in the room, but if we were going to stay longer we would have definitely saved money by eating in for breakfast and lunch. - The Seven Eagles pool was fairly quiet with plenty of chairs. The water park was very active (as you can imagine) and wasn't a place for people who want to stay away from the crowds. We went to both pools, one each day and although the water park was more active for a couple with no children, it was still by far the better place to hang out for the day. - All restuarants are located in the Grande Tower - so if you stay in this part of the resort you don't need transportation. You will need transportation if you stay in a private home or villa. The pool food was mediocre and expensive for what you get. Skip it if you can. - They made special attention to prepare a gift from the resort for my husband's birthday. They gave him a nice wine opener set and a bottle of wine (which we gladly consumed in honor of his birthday). - Although some folks were not happy with the mandatory 20% service charge, I liked it. I was trying to give my husband a good trip for his birthday and it was nice not having to carry around cash to tip. It took a lot of pressure off me and my husband who is always reaching into his pocket tip. - The sushi chef - Chief Ha is fantastic. We eat sushi often and have never experienced such a wonderful burst of flavor and textures as we did with Chef Ha's creations. We had dinner reservations at Forte on Saturday night, but decided to cancel the reservation and remain at the lobby bar enjoying various creations for 3 hours! This was by far one of our best meals while also our lowest check. Very good value! - We had dinner at Eleven on Friday night. They don't take reservations, but we never noticed long waiting. The food was very good and the tapas style eating of small portions of various dishes was an experience we've not had. We split 3 dishes and then finished off with the choc. fondue. Again, for a several hour meal with drinks we thought the check was very reasonable. - We had breakfast, lunch and drinks at the Club House restaurant. Lunch was fantastic - get a split of onion rings and sweet potato fries as your side - incredible. Breakfast was okay, although not anything special. Drinks were good and not too expensive. - When checking out, I asked to for the business center so I could check-in for our JetBlue Flights. Tania (I hope that is right) was very nice and checked-in for me and printed the boarding passes. We are so glad she did that because when we arrived to the airport the line for JetBlue check-in was very long. With the boarding passes we just went up to the curbside check-in, paid $2 a bag and walked straight to the gate. Could be better: - With the emphasis on sun damage/cancer I was very surprised at the small number of umbrella's at each pool. They are premium and you must get to the pool upon opening or you won't get one. Reunion should invest in more umbrella's. For the folks that want to burn, they don't have to put the umbrella up, but for many they were jumping on open umbrella's before couples were leaving them. The slight movement that you are leaving - you will have your umbrella taken. We also saw a couple lose their umbrella when they both went into the pool together. My husband and I tag teamed our spot as to not lose our umbrella, but that didn't make for a very enjoyable morning and afternoon at the pool. - Everything is very spread out - more so than the maps show. There isn't much shade as the resort is still fairly new. Therefore, walking is in direct sunlight. A better screening of trees for shade along walking paths would cut down on the number of shuttle runs. For now, take the shuttle, but as the resort matures hopefully there will be tree lined shade along the walking paths. - The menu's get a little boring if you aren't eating in your room. Food rotation might entice more people to eat in the restaurants. - There aren't any stores in walking distance and the lobby store is very limited on what it offers. I forgot a few things and wasn't able to buy them at the lobby store. We didn't have a car, so there wasn't much other option but to go without. - I thought the resort, for the price, could include some bottle water in the room daily. A nice touch would be two bottles per person. - Service could be better. I thought for the few people eating in the restaurants the service should be better. I ran out of iced tea often and that is something that is easy to keep an eye on. - The breakfast buttet could be improved. In fact, with so few guests eating the $15 breakfast, they should expand the main menu so the food is fresh and not sitting out all morning. It would probably be more cost efficient for both the resort and for the guests. Lessons learned: - never, ever, arrange for a car service. We booked backstage limo (also known as limo123). 1 hour late picking us up at the airport with excuse after excuse as to why it was somehow normal for them to miss picking us up. Took 4 phone calls to get someone to the airport. 20% Gratuity is not "optional" it is mandatory. They were late picking us up at the hotel for our return flight. Rent a car so you are not held captive at the resort and your time is not wasted by the lateness of others. Our trip was perfect except for the limo service (which was the highest rated limo service in the Orlando area). Learn from my $200 mistake and rent a car. Orlando is easy to get around. You can park for free at Reunion. Other facts: - We met very nice people, but I had a feeling we might be one of only a few guests at the resort. Everyone we met "owned" a villa, home or condo at the resort. We didn't meet anyone that wasn't an owner. The resort is more of a lifestyle vs. a hotel. It has a home feel to it and is not like a Ritz or Four Seasons. It has a casual feeling and we felt like we were coming home each night when we returned to our room. It was very comfortable. If you want a place that is away from the Disney crowd, this is it. Still close to everything, but yet far away. A quick flight from Wash DC on JetBlue. I couldn't decide between Omni or Reunion. I chose Reunion for the the guest rooms. We are glad we did. Thanks to everyone at Reunion Grande for making my husbands birthday weekend enjoyable and restful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay - Surpassed all expectations by far!”
Reviews.Author: efrainer
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 days at the Ginn Reunion, in a townhouse accommodation. We were pleasantly surprised by the upgrade, as we had reserved a two bedroom villa. My wife could not believe we had a whole house, on vacation, to ourselves. The townhouse itself was very modern, with a master bedroom in the ground floor with a master bath, complete with garden tub. The kitchen was small, but covered all the basics. We made good use of cooking facilities, which saved us bundles of $$$. The living room and dining room is where we spent most of the time. It really felt like a home away from home. upstairs we 2 more bedrooms (one with two beds and one with a king bed) and another bath. Needless to say, it was much more space than we needed (we only have two kids), but we sure loved it. Several homes away, we had a pool we could use. Also, there was the big resort pool (with poolside bar) withing driving distance, as well as a waterpark which is a great amenity to have. We did not make use of the resort restaurants - we are former Orlando natives and love dining near the International Drive area. nonetheless, this was probably the best resort we've ever stayed at. When we come back, I know where we're staying. Very much worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “#1 Place to Stay in Orlando!!”
Reviews.Author: ist2008
Reviews.Content: Reunion resort far exceeded my expectations. With two young kids, we rented a 3 bedroom villa and stayed there for 5 nights. The villas were amazing, clean and very spacious. The staff were very accommodating and delivered a pack and play to our room upon our arrival (for free). My 4yr old son loved the water park - It's a small park but was plenty for a 4 year old. Things you should be aware of is that your room key is essentially a debit card and is used to purchase anything at the resort - they do not take cash or tips during your stay. The tennis courts are wonderful and they even leave the lights on for you if you plan on playing when it is cooler at night - The rental fee for the court is $20 when the clubhouse is open and free when they're closed. Renting tennis rackets is $8 so bring your own if you can. In short, I would highly recommend this resort to anyone traveling to Orlando. I booked through Orbitz and we paid approximately $1400 for 5 nights which included renting a minivan from Avis...

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: emano70
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Ginn 2 summers in a row and have absolutely loved it. The water park is amazing. My kids, 7 year old daughter and 5 year old triplets can't wait to go again. They would rather spend the day at the water park at the Ginn than go to any of the Disney parks!! We stay at the 3 bedroom villas that we call 'home'. It's got everything that u need. Rooms are very clean and spacious each with its own flat screen TV and dvd player. Ensuite bathrooms are fab. The grounds are absolutely gorgeous. I strongly recommend this place for people with kids who want to unwind after a busy day at the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Ginn Reunion - Absolutely amazing”
Reviews.Author: amp512
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ginn Reunion Resort in Kissimmee, FL between 5/30 and 6/5, we got one of the 3 bedroom villas and it was absolutely amazing. Our villa (you can call it condo) was clean, and very well furnished. Cleanliness was our biggest requirement and it was well served I would say well beyond expectation. Resort was less than 15 minute ride to all Disney attractions. Our villa was close to onsite water park but depending on availability you may get your villa far enough that you would have to actually drive to the water park. Kitchen had all the utensils, silver ware, and plates and pans. We didn't play golf but they have one of the best courses in the country with onsite golf academy. We ate at 11 one of seven onsite restaurants and food was pretty good. Breakfast was pretty good and reasonable priced. This resort is 100% cashless so everything you use on resort will be charged to your room card so don't loose the card. We have stayed at Ritz Carlton and Four Seasons and the quality of rooms and cleanliness was as good as Ritz and Four Seasons but Ritz and Four Season would probably provide better service since they are full service hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mfgn
Reviews.Content: long time since i was not positively surprise by a hotel. We rent a intermediate 5 suites house with pool. The house was perfect, it was like staying in a 5 star hotel with the privacy of your own home. The service (house keeping, concierge etc.) was excelente. The resort has a water park that my kids loved (had hard time to take then out of the pool to the disney parks).

Reviews.Title: “WOW, WOW, WOW!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jen205
Reviews.Content: Great resort. Outstanding rooms - very clean. Fantastic water park on resort, which is FREE to guests. Friendly, helpful staff (my parents went to the wrong condo, twice, with groceries. Security guards helped them find our condo, and carried the groceries, both times. Would not accept a tip of the service). Luxury accomodations at a resonable price.

Reviews.Title: “Great resort and rooms”
Reviews.Author: bay192003
Reviews.Content: Stayed for several nights in June as part of a group outing with some friends from around the state. Had a three bedroom, 3 bath villa. Hugh room with all kitchen items stocked. Bedrooms were very large and each had its own bathroom. Washer and dryer also in unit. Great use of space and lots of room for everyone in the family to move around and have their own space. Very secluded and quiet even though the resort is quite large. Very nice staff and grocery store right outside and Disney is close. Really enjoyed our stay and the water park was very nice. Great views from the top of the Grand Reunion building also. Golf courses looked great wish I had a chance to try one. Can't go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: dresser79
Reviews.Content: Blended family of six, first trip to Disney World. Incredible deal on Expedia, included air and car rental, so we took it and saved $2,000 over Disney Hotel price--and the three bedroom, three bath villa was magnificent! A bit of a drive to Disney (15 minutes) but worth the trip. Was like staying in a model home, with incredible views, huge patio. Florida is HUMID and rains daily, but this was worth the trip from California alone.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at the Ginn”
Reviews.Author: Travelerdaddy
Reviews.Content: This place is really nice and a short drive to Disney. I suspect these are owner rentals. We were travelling with a 20 month old toddler and looking for a spacious place with seperate bedrooms, a kitchen, and a nice pool. First, the room. We rented a 2 bedroom villa and got a 3 bedroom on the first floor for the same price. Since we were staying the first week in May, we were in between spring break crowds and summer vacationers and got a good price, $200 per night. Each bedroom had its own bathroom and the beds were very comfortable. The master bedrrom was huge with a large bathroom (seperate tub and shower). The kitchen was brand new with stainless steel appliances and granite countertops. There was a dining room with seating for 6 and a nice size living room to lounge. There was a patio overlooking the golf course (watch out for errant balls!). Higher floors had balconies. There was also a washer/dryer in the unit. There are two pools- we visited the Waterpark, and what a nice, clean place. Unfortunately, we didn't get there until 4 PM and it closed at 5 PM the one day we made it there. Perhaps they extend the hours in summer. We didn't make use of the restaurants except for the Clubhouse grill located at the Golf Academy. Food was good and kids eat free at all restaurants. While the resort is huge and you feel very isolated, there is a Publix right outside the main gate and you're a short drive from the madness on I-drive. The concierge contacted us a week before arriving and offered to stock our fridge. Even though we didn't utilize it, I've read great reviews on this service. Gratuities and a resort fee are added on, there is no tipping and it is a cashless resort, so everything is charged to your room. We will definitely be back and hope to make more use of all the amenities the resort has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic family holiday”
Reviews.Author: kmolyneux01
Reviews.Content: stayed for 1month with my familyages from3 months to55 .11in total something for everybody at the resort and so close to all theme parks and downtown disney reunion is acredit to the leisure industry of america .going back in may/june 09 cant wait. k molyneu england

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could possibly want!”
Reviews.Author: jojosmaman
Reviews.Content: We had a spring break stay at Ginn and we were more than happy with our choice of resort! From the moment of check in to our departure date we felt like nothing was too much trouble for the staff here and even though we booked privately and not through the resort we were treated as guests of the hotel. Unlike the other reviewer we were happily offered a 1pm check out with no extra charge when we asked, maybe this was because we were staying in a private condo? The waterpark is amazing and we spent most of our time here when we weren't at Disney and we were told that the other pools are lovely too. Ginn is a work in progress and obviously things have slowed due to the recession but even as it stands this resort beats many of its rivals hands down due to the amenities on site. Its location is excellent too with it being just two junctions away from Magic Kingdom and 15 mins from I- drive. We will definately be returning!

Reviews.Title: “beautiful, even to non-golfers”
Reviews.Author: corbusiette
Reviews.Content: Fantastic in every way! We rented a 2-bdrm cottage directly from the owner (through vrbo.com), and it had all the trimmings: spacious shower, lovely kitchen, plush beds, 3 Tvs, internet service. The report also was great. We dined almost every night al fresco at The Clubhouse, where the food was fresh, kids ate for free, and we enjoyed a relaxing view out over the golf course. This seemed especially civilized after our frenetic days slogging and Fastpassing around Disney!! The Water Park also is not to be missed...the kids loved it, although, sadly, we were so busy we only got a couple of short swims there. I would DEFINITELY stay there again if we return to ORlando.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are great, resort is too large”
Reviews.Author: MainlineJoe
Reviews.Content: I have to give a somewhat mixed review, only because the web site and the reservations clerk omit certain things you should be aware of before you decide to stay. We stayed in a 3 room villa, that was fantastic. very large, fully equipped and beds were truly the best we have slept on at any resort. Housekeeping was generally good, although on 2d day after a long day at Disney we got back to our villa at 5 pm and house keeping had still not cleaned the room. we were told that it takes house keeping sometimes until 6 to get around to clean rooms. The resort is much larger than what the map they hand you when you check in indicates. we thought we could walk to the water park from our room, but in reality it was a 2 mile walk. So we were constantly driving to the swim park. Also the last day we were there, they closed the swim park to any additional people at around 1 pm because it was too crowded. If I had a young family and we just got off a plane and were looking forward to the swim park there would have been a lot of unhappy faces in my family. Luckily we were already in. Also, they don't let you bring your own drinks into the swim park. Watch out for those $10 pool side drinks for the kids. Ouch!! We had 2 meals on site and both were excellent. the tappas restaurant on the top floor of the main building reallly was excellent. When we first arrived we had lunch at the golf restaurant. Service was slow although the place was not crowded. Took 20 minutes to get drinks. Hostess just stood at main area in front of us and made no effort to move things along and help out server. oddest thing about the resort was that it appears not yet 50% completed. Our building was 2 miles from the swim park and there was just this vast wasteland in between, waiting for construction to begin. Kind of takes away from the lush pictures you see on the web site. Also, we asked for a late check out and we were told no. This struck me as odd because (1) the day before, house keeping did not get to our room until 5 (see above); and (2) the 12 buildings in our area of the resort were pretty much empty. At night, there were maybe 6 cars in front of our building that had approximately 16 units in it. The other buildings parking lots were equally empty. Finally, the concierge service was excellent, although I was surprised they did not offer disney tix at a discount that many other resorts provide when they are bought in bulk. One more thing, this time I mean finally, by the end of your stay, you will get tired of seeing the 20% resort fee/gratuity added on constantly. Our room cost $229 but after all the add ons, it was more like $290 a night. Again, ouch!!

Reviews.Title: “The place to stay if you are visiting Orlando”
Reviews.Author: naplesm0m
Reviews.Content: Reunion is a bit off the beaten path of International Drive, but if you are staying in Orlando, there is no better place to stay. You can rent houses, condos or stay in the high rise. There is an awesome pool for the kids, all the golf you could want, and the flexibility to be able to eat breakfast and snacks in the room instead of eating out for every meal is key for us.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: riehenduffer
Reviews.Content: For those fed up with International Drive and the cookie-cutter hotels in the Disney zone (and you know what I mean), the Reunion Resort offers a great alternative.... with some footnotes that may be positive to some but negative to others. Why the slight hesitation? This is not your ordinary hotel. This is not your ordinary vacation location. But then again the Reunion Resort is not an ordinary place. Who would love this place? -- Those fed up with the typical Disney experience and want a little class (and you know what I mean here as well) -- Those willing to rent a car and drive around (but a footnote here that you will need a car to get groceries at the nearby Publix and even to get around the Reunion Resort area) -- Those that want to play golf, hit some tennis balls, exercise and not have Disney 24/7 -- Those who want a place for the kids, well, to be kids (water park and the kids activities) BUT ALSO not have the kids dominate the vacation -- Those that want some space - consider the 3 bed / 3 bath units that provide space for everyone to do their own thing without getting into each other's hair -- Those who want to be near Disney (only about 5 mins in the car) but want to get away from the Orlando noise Who won't like this place? -- Those who want to do Disney 24/7 and be immersed in that environment -- Those who want to eat crappy take-out food or overpay in local restaurants, meaning those who have no desire to cook together as a family now and then (what a shame given the beautiful kitchens and potential to save some money by eating healthier food without all of the other hassles) -- Those who want to walk everywhere and won't rent a car (this is a reason for only 4 stars on location - near the airport, near the Disney stuff, but need a car inside the resort and also outside). -- Those who are not active in sports, so they will feel that they are not getting any value from the golf courses or tennis courts And the final and most important reason: -- Those who are really stuck-up snobs, who want to "see and be seen," who cannot relate to good people who want to have some vacation fun, etc. (if you want that type of kick, then go overpay at the Ritz or a Disney hotel) Does this resort deserve 5 stars? Yes and no. I would say "No" if you consider the Four Seasons and Ritz hotels as being five stars. This place would rate about 4.625 stars in that situation. The hotel staff does not have that "Four Seasons polish and refinement," but then again you're dealing with real people - and really nice and pleasant people that will take care of you. All in all, we will return to the Reunion Resort, and will even consider buying a condo unit (once the prices hit some sort of a bottom).

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations - and I'm a pretty picky guest!”
Reviews.Author: Nanriema
Reviews.Content: We originally booked our Disney trip through Expedia at the Mike Ditka's Lighthouse Key Resort. About 2 weeks before our departure, an agent from Expedia called to inform us that they had to change our accomodations due to "management issues" at Lighthouse Key. They gave us the option of booking at the Ginn Reunion at NO ADDITIONAL CHARGE! It was the best thing that could have happened. We arrived in the early evening and when we opened the door to our condo, we were so pleased with what we saw. Our entire stay was fabulous. The one minor issue we had with the washer was IMMEDIATELY addressed by a very kind maintenance worker. He arrived within 15 minutes of my call to the front desk. My only wish is that we had a longer stay there! I am a very picky person when it comes to overnight accomodations and this place was amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay for families going to Disney”
Reviews.Author: KrisHur
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Orlando and decided we were not going to pay $$$$ for 2 bdrm room (w/out kitchen) at Disney. We found the Ginn Reunion; it was perfect and a real bargain. Without asking we were upgraded to a 3 bdrm villa. The room was spacious, well appointed and very clean. Granite kitchens, marble baths, everything you would expect at a 4 star. Kitchen was well equiped, coffee maker (w/reg and decaf coffee, sugar, creamer), toaster, blender, pots/pans, utensils, plates, bowls, washer/dryer, dishwashing detg, washing machine detg, paper towels, highspeed internet, etc, etc. There was also a little veranda table was nice for am coffee and drying swim suits. Location to Disney was good; 15-20 minutes from our door to the parking lot at Magic Kingdom. Also close by a large Publix and CVS (both good sources of discount Disney trinkets) . Although we do not golf (there are 3 courses and the only USA Annika Soernson (sp?) golf school) we loved the place anyway--it is extremely child friendly but still upscale. Non-amusment park days were spent at the water park; we easily wasted an entire day with our 2.5 year old daughter at the waterpark and lazy river. Even in sunny, warm FL the pools were heated to a lovely 80 degrees. Nice plus, swim diapers are provided if you forget yours (or extras). Food/beverage service is prompt and the menu is diverse (salads to burgers and a bit of everything in between). The only downsides we found were the hours of the waterpark, fitness facility and lack of restaurants. The waterpark opens at 11 and closes at 4 (5 on Fri, Sat, and Sun); we found it a bit inconvenient when looking for a morning or afternoon only activity. The fitness room, while adequate, left a lot to be desired. Small, under a/c'ed, no water, teeny towels, crammed w/mediocre equipment and over inflated balls/bosu. Other than the hotel, there are no good restaurants in the immedate vicinity--you'll have to take a drive to Orlando. The Ginn is HUGE, it is quite possible that you will wind up staying on one side of the propery but have to drive to the water park, pool, restaurant, etc. Downside? We didn't think so. We didn't mind it but saw some other reviewers did. Parking lots at the water park, and hotel were ample. The "adults" pool (children welcome, but then the waterpark is open why would you go?) at 7 Eagles had minimal parking but we never had a problem getting a spot.

Reviews.Title: “Great famil getaway”
Reviews.Author: BKnoxville
Reviews.Content: Everything about the resort was perfect, the help, the villas, the amenities. We had never been to the Orlando area and I chose the Reunion based on the very high number of positive reviws on this and other travel sites. The resort has a lot of activites for children, waterpark, pools and for golfers, three courses, plus a world class practice facility. They upgraded our accomodations (without me asking) to a 3 BD villa which is a very nice and roomy condo-like space. From our check-in at the resort to our early morning ride (we were able to check-out online) to the airport in a Reunion resort vehicle, everything was perfect. Driving around the area, and seeing a lot of the resorts/hotels, I kept thinking to myself and actually several times mentioned to my wife, that we picked the right place for our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect!! 5++++++”
Reviews.Author: RaspMK
Reviews.Content: We didn't know what to expect... and let me tell you to as soon as we walked into our Villa we knew we would have a hard time saying Good bye. It was absolutely beautiful, extremely clean and the housekeeping did an amazing job! Our family will definitely be returning to just enjoy the grounds. The pools are great from the roof top pool to the lazy river, everything is prestine and the staff was great! It's very close to Disney and to small shopping plaza's. A hidden gem is right!!

Reviews.Title: “We will return or buy property here”
Reviews.Author: pickytraveler10
Reviews.Content: The Ginn Resort is an excellent place for a vacation in Orlando. There are 3 championship golf courses, a water park and a beautiful spa on the property as well as hotel dining. The resort is upscale but not stodgy. We enjoyed the exceptional service and immaculate accomodations. All tipping is included which is very convenient. It is only 20 minutes from the theme parks. Highly recommended for a relaxing and fun experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place”
Reviews.Author: WestIslanders122
Reviews.Content: We recently rented a 5 bedroom house in Ginn Reunion. It was a fantastic stay. The food on site is delicious, the hotel itself is beautiful. Golf perfection (if a little challenging!) and the pool area is gorgeous. Only problem ( should be told before arrival) is that if you have a private pool and you would like it heated (otherwise it's freezing) there is a $75 a day charge and it can take up tp 10-12 hours to heat up. So call ahead and ask that the heat be turned on! Otherwise amazing place with super friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Best resort in Orlando area hands down”
Reviews.Author: DISNEYWORLDFANATIC
Reviews.Content: Let me just start off by saying we were a little nervous to try something new. We are Disney fans and only stayed at Disney resorts since I was a little girl. Nothing could compare to this experience. It was amazing from the moment we drove through the gated extrance till the time we left. We had a 3/3 condo and it was decorated nicer than I could have ever imagined. It was so nice to have 3 bathrooms, getting ready in the mornings was a breeze. We were going to stay at one of Disney's Deluxe resorts and priced out that it would have been 1500 dollars more for the 2 nights because we would have gotten 2 rooms to fit the 6 of us. You really can not beat what you get for the money. The waterpark was so much more than I imagined. The kids loved it and did not want to leave. Whenever we left the property they kept asking when we were going back to the hotel. The lazy river was amazing, took us about 10 minutes to get around it, never seen anything like that at a resort. The kids waterpark was so well thought out. 2 kid slides and tons of sprayers, the temp of the water was 85 degrees and felt wonderful. We did not get to do to much on property because we had a very full weekend but plan on going back soon and just staying at the resort and not doing any parks at Disney because frankly the kids would have rather stayed at the resort and that is fine with my husband and I. You could litterally spend a week here and never leave the property. There is a Publix about 1/2 mile away from the entrance so we would just go pick food up to have in the unit. So we would not worry about going to get breakfast or snacks. The kitchen was awesome and had everything you could possibly want or need. We enjoyed eating on the balcony and being able to just relax in the unit. If someone wanted to go to bed they did, went in the room and shut the door. It was great traveling with a family. At a regular hotel it is almost like you are cintantly telling the kids o quiet down, or go to sleep because someone else is trying to fall asleep in the bed next to them. Here at Ginn it was like living in a house and I will recommend this resort to everyone I talk to. I know we felt great after the long weekend, we said that usually we are worn out and exhausted but I think by having a big unit like we did (about 1800 sq. ft.) we spent a lot more time in the rental and got to relax. When we stay at Disney property it is almost like we can not wait to get out of the rooms because there is nothing to do in the rooms and the kids are way to confined. There maid service could have been a little better but all in all it was just fine. Our building did not have but only 2 other couples in it so that was probably why it took longer for them to restock our room. If you have the chance to go to this resort....DO IT!!! You will not regret it at all. Oh and the view are unbelievable, we had an amazing golf course view. Weare getting information now on purchasing a unit in the near future since we practically live in Orlando.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Kent_England_Sjw
Reviews.Content: We hired a villa here directly with the owner (much much cheaper than going through the resort!) and stayed for a week at the end of September 2008. The resort is beautiful, excellently maintained and the staff are extremely helpful. The waterpark is excellent as are the other facilities - highly recommended. The only thing Id say is that you can easily spend more than you realise since everything is cashless but then 20% service charge is added on top and it's very difficult to keep track of everything, particularly if your group is large!

Reviews.Title: “Ginn Reunion Resort-hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: SillyCleveland
Reviews.Content: The Ginn Reunion Resort offers something for everyone. This was our second year staying over Spring Break vacation time (once in April and now in March). It is a large gated community with golfing, Annika Sorenstam Golf School, a hotel, villas and private homes. When you book a stay, you have access to everything on the property. Each 'section' of villas has their own pool along with a community type of pool/clubhouse. Their is also a large, expansive lazy river and water play area. If you have children this is an excellent place in comparison to a Disney Resort. Not only are the accomadations cleaner there is plenty to do if you choose not to go to a park one day. There are Kid's Camps and daily scheduled activities at the water area. Call ahead and they will send you the schedule. We have stayed in a villa both times and both times over Easter. They offered an Easter basket service (for a fee) that were delivered late evening. The daily rate for the accomodations were the same or cheaper than at any resort around the parks (March is always more expensive than April). We have always rented a car and flown into both Orlando and Tampa airports. The Tampa airport is easy and quicker to get in and out of and, as a result, not much longer to get to the resort. And, because we flew out late from Tampa, we checked out early from the resort on departure day and spent the day at Busch Gardens in Tampa.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Ginn Resort”
Reviews.Author: marydallas2008
Reviews.Content: We just returned from The Ginn Resort in Florida which was absolutely beautiful and the staff was terrific. This resort has three championship golf courses, a great water park, wonderful pools and delightful restaurants. There is no tipping and all expenses incurred at the resort are charged to your Ginn Resort card which is given to you at check-in. Amy at Dream Makers Vacation Services (www.dreammakersvaca.com) was great in handling our reservations and helped us decide what accomodations would best suit our family's needs. The resort has a hotel, villas, homes, and estates. We rented a four bedroom home with a pool and hot tub and it was perfect. With two young grandchildren, it was great to have a washer and dryer so packing could be kept to a minimum. The resort is close to a grocery store and only 15 minutes from Disney World. It was nice to have a quiet place to come back to after a busy day at Disney! We will definitely do this again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Fantabalous”
Reviews.Author: Traniece
Reviews.Content: This resort is amazing. We were a party of 6, and drove over 18 hours to arrive to Reunion. The young lady from England at the front desk, I believe her name was Vicki, was wonderful. She was very friendly and pleasant, and after such a long drive it was welcomed. We had two reservations; the 1st a 3BD house with private pool. Absolutely beautiful, just what the lovely pictures showed. The 2nd was a 3BD villa, also lovely. My only regret is that we had tickets everyday for an amusement parks or dinner theatres, and I just wanted to enjoy the resort. I will be going back and I am sorry that I own a timeshare in Orlando because I will only be reserving the Reunion Ginn.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort”
Reviews.Author: Kingston1Devon
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay at the Ginn as the reviews were soo good and it was truly wonderful. We stayed for two weeks in a 3 bed deluxe villa based in Carriage Pointe, the villa was beautiful and equipped with everything you needed. It had 3 bedrooms, 1 King bedroom with a balcony looking out over the golf course. The second bathroom had a double bed and the third bedroom had two single beds. Each bedroom had its own plasma tv, which was fantastic as the children had their own room to go and chill in when they wanted. There was a washer and dryer upstairs. Downstairs had a downstairs toilet, dining area, open plan lounge into the kitchen with a smaller dining table and chairs. The kitchen was stocked with every utensil you could imagine. The housekeepers came everyday and cleaned and restocked with coffee, milk and sugar and dishwasher powder. The toiletries were replaced everyday in each bathroom and each bathroom had a hairdryer available. We loved the waterpark there, aswell as our children, it was soo chilled. Towels were provided and sunbeds always available. The food at the waterpark is very good too and lots of it. You do not have to move from your sunbed the staff will ask you if you would like drinks or food. There was a community pool at Carriage Pointe with a thermal bath you could go to which was always empty. The Ginn staff were soo friendly and helpful you only had to ring the front desk for any advice or questions and they would sort it out. On our previous visits to Florida we stayed on the disney resorts and I can say that I will definitely not be going back. The Ginn villas provided soo much freedom and relaxation and even with the mild hurricane we experienced the villa provided soo much space on the horrendous rainy nights rather then us all being stuck in one room. Also it is situated about 5 minutes from the main I4 West and all the Disney Parks and International Drive signs you could need were all soo easily signposted. I can thoroughly recommend this Resort and will definitely stay there again on our next visit, it was a fantastic place.

Reviews.Title: “Travelling with US Airtours / Welcome USA?”
Reviews.Author: M2Man
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ginn 25 July - 15 August inclusive. Good points were, the golf course, tennis courts, waterpark, staff, proximity to Disney Bad points were, our house stunk of cigarettes, the aircon was not initially working, the house was very poorly maintained (poorly decorated, broken curtain track, damaged mirror, blood on carpet, pool sign fallen off wall, loungers badly worn) and our view of the golf course ended up being the back of someone elses house. For the first three days our house was not serviced despite several calls to front desk. Newspapers were delivered very sporadically and in the last week we only got one paper. We were moved to another house (which was fine) but we were still hemmed in by other properties. Restaurants were empty and lacked any atmosphere, although the food was good. The Eleven Bar had (in my view) an obnoxious bar man meaning we never went back there. I contacted my agent regarding the problems we encountered. Turns out that the holiday was booked via US AIrtours and Welcome USA who appear (again in my view) to have negotiated a less than acceptable deal which is why you end up with a house in a less than favourable position, which is poorly maintained and lacking the daily service that the Ginn website talks so much about. Apparently I should not have looked at the Ginn website as it does not reflect the holiday package that I bought! Would we go back? We might in the future but if we did we'd book direct with Ginn to ensure a good property that was fully serviced and properly maintained

Reviews.Title: “Not the 5 star resort we were expecting”
Reviews.Author: ckrobynToronto
Reviews.Content: After much research on resort properties in or around Orlando, we decided on the Ginn Reunion based on the positive reviews here on Trip Advisor, and by the lovely pictures we had seen posted. We wanted a 5 star resort where we could be pampered and enjoy a luxurious experience. We booked a two bedroom condo in the Reunion Grande which is the main (and only tower) hotel building on the site. I received an email from our personal concierge Derek a few weeks before our scheduled arrival introducing himself and asking if we wanted him to stock our condo unit with groceries. There is a Publix nearby and we rented a car, so this was not necessary. Our rate for this condo was an average of $350 per night so our expectations were high. We were looking forward to a week in a beautiful condo on a resort where we felt the service would match the $ paid. There is no question that our condo was magnificent. It was huge and beautifully decorated with lovely bathrooms and a very modern kitchen with stainless steel appliances. We chose the Grande building because we wanted to be in the main building, not on a street nearby. We wanted access to the restaurant on the 11th floor and the pool as well. The Grande also has a gift shop, and a nice lobby with a sushi bar that opens at 5pm each day. While we enjoyed the resort, there were a few issues that were a little hard to overlook. Our stay was in late August which is not a very busy time in Orlando and we found out the resort was operating at about 40% occupancy. Even though there were probably more staff than guests, the service was quite poor. For example, turn down service was offered through the hotel website for our condo, and we had to call down the first night to ask for it. It was hit or miss - sometimes they came, sometimes they didn't. When they did come, they would turn down the beds and leave - they did not replace our dirty towels with new one's, they were simply left on the bathroom floor. I found this very odd. The light inside the shower stall was burned out when we arrived, I called down to the desk to report it and it took almost 8 hours before it was replaced ( I had to shower in the dark). We had a very unfortunate incident whereby my husband's wallet went missing from our condo - we searched the entire unit inside and out and it was nowhere to be found. We had not left the resort that day and saw the wallet in the morning before we left for the Seven Eagles Pool Pavillion, when we returned from the pool late in the day we could not find the wallet. I went down to the front desk to report the missing wallet and spoke with Front Desk Supervisor who stared blankly at me and asked me what I wanted her to do! At the very least she could have said she was sorry to hear what had happened and offer to call resort security! I was very disappointed in her lack of compassion. We did meet with security and they were wonderful, concerned and helpful. It is important to also mention that as we were searching for the missing wallet we actually lifted up the mattress on one of the beds and saw a pair of underwear that did not belong to us!! I was shocked that this was possible in a 5 star resort, shocked and somewhat disgusted to say the least. The Ginn Reunion has the makings of what could be a 5 star resort, but sadly to say they are not there yet. The property itself is lovely, albeit very spread out. Transportation is required to get to the Seven Eagles Pool and the Waterpark. If you are relying on the resort's transportation be prepared to wait 15 minutes or more for a shuttle. I had to ask the pool attendant to call for a shuttle 3 times before one finally arrived. I believe the Ginn has the potential to be an excellent resort option for people wanting luxury in Orlando, I will probably wait a few years before staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “The best ever!”
Reviews.Author: IzzyDorset
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in Orlando many times (usually timeshare resorts like Westgate) but we came across this resort by accident on the web and just seeing the pictures of the pirate ship in the pool for my 4 your old son made it appealing. However, on arrival we couldn't have been more surprised, the 2 BR condo (was in fact three bedrooms!) with brilliant size kitchen & lounge areas. We visited the pool most days and the kids enjoyed the kids activities around the pool (for example painting bird houses at a reasonable price of only a few pounds), the lazy river while we enjoyed the cocktails served to our sun loungers (& lunch occassionally). The checkin and checkout was v.easy. We even hired bikes for the kids for the week. Except for being around the pool and my husband and son playing golf, we didn't visit the spa (I wish! next time), all the staff were so helpful and courteous. We will definately return if we're going back to Disney area and would recommend it to anyone with younger children (mine are 4 & 8). Put it this way; the second week of our holiday was spent on Longboat key on the gulf coast and our kids just wanted the Pool back at Ginn !! Worth every penny - Enjoy

Reviews.Title: “Beyond My Expectations!”
Reviews.Author: LopezatWBCENews
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Ginn was amazing. That had to of been one of the best hotels I've stayed in, and I've had my share of hotels. The resort is enormous, 2300 acres. The resort is very well maintained, and the landscaping is gorgeous. The water park is incredible, for it to be in a resort. There is a lazy river, one water slide, and an incredible kiddy area.
