I'm 15, and I loved the kiddy area! The room is amazing, it definitely exceded my expectations of the room. We booked a 3 bedroom villa. The style of the room was tropical like. Each room has a Plasma TV, with DVD players. The beds have 800 count thread sheets. And the beds are amazing. After a long day at a theme park, your going to be very happy to plop down on that bed! The entire room is tiled, except for the living area, and bedrooms. There is high-quality carpets in the room. The kitchen, wow! There are stainless steel appliances, granite countertops, cups, mugs, salad making bowls, utensils, and anything you need to create a home made meal. The hotel offers free transportation anywhere around the resort, when you call them, and ask for it, they tell you to step outside, it'll be right there, it doesn't arrive for another 15 minutes. The staff was very friendly, and kind. The view of the golf course was just phenomenal! It looked like it came out of a postcard.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: KaInCanada
Reviews.Content: I found the Reunion Resort while browsing the web. I had no referrals, but read some good reviews and decided for it. We are just back from a week at the resort in a group of 15 people. We initially rented an 8-bedroom house but got a call from the resort a couple of months ago saying there was some problem with it, so they upgraded us to a 7-bedroom deluxe house at no extra cost. The house was amazing – spacious, brand new, beautifully decorated, plasma TV’s in all rooms, nice private swimming pool, barbecue, even had an elevator! My friends were all amazed at the great choice I made. And the resort is gorgeous, very well-kept. It also has an awesome water park, which my 4-year-old son enjoyed more than any Disney park. I just wish I hadn’t booked so many parks and stayed for such a short period, because we didn’t have much chance to enjoy such a great infrastructure. I’ll definitely stay at the Reunion Resort next time I go to Orlando, and I’m recommending it to all my friends!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but won't return”
Reviews.Author: SJ445
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd trip to Ginn Reunion Resort. We returned because the first trip was awesome. However , we had rented directly through the owner that time. We stayed for THREE nights this time and were in FOUR different villas! We had 7 people in our party. The 1st villa we checked into had no dining room table (nor was there room for one) and only had a bar type seating for 3. We called the front desk and they apologized & moved us (said it was an engineering mishap to that unit) We were moved to a 2 story villa that seemed OK until that night when we realized 2 of the bedrooms faced the highway. The noise and street lights kept us up all night. Called front desk in AM and they said they would move us. They apologized and said those units are known for those problems. We were moved into another villa (in another section) that was beautiful. All was perfect until that next AM when we were told we would have to move due to the owner of that unit coming in! Off we went to villa #4. Keep in mind it's not easy moving 7 people w/belongings as well as food, refrig, bathroom items etc. It took us close to 2 hours each time we moved. I thought at the very least, we would be offered a discount for a round of golf. All we heard was "sorry for the inconvenience." It's a beautiful resort, but the customer service left a bad taste and we won't be back. Too many other choices out there. We aren't people who are hard to please, but a 5 star resort needs to hire/train quality customer service. Just a note from mgmt along with the bill acknowledging what happened would have sufficed. I suppose we could have raised a big stink about it to mgmt, but this was a Grad gift for our son and we wanted to keep things on a happy note.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding In Every Way”
Reviews.Author: NYCBushbaby
Reviews.Content: I think it is pertinent to know about the reviewer when it comes to Orlando because there are so many places to stay and it caters to such a wide variety of people. This was our second trip to Orlando. Each time, we chose to stay 3 nites on site and 3 nites off site. Last year it was the Caribbean Beach at Disney and then the Hyatt Cypress. This year it was the Royal Pacific for Universal and Ginn Reunion. So I don't have the breadth of experience others might have. I have also never rented a condo before. If you just like a place to crash, there are many cheaper alternatives available. But the quality of a place affects how much I enjoy my vacation, how well I sleep, etc... If this applies to you, read on. I find it very hard to believe that we can, in Orlando, top this resort for the money we paid ($234 a night for the July 4th weekend. I presume the prices were higher for the holiday.) I also don't think that the resort is clearly marketing their amenities because I think they are unmatched (based upon my internet research) in this price range. WHY? 1. Quality: We paid for a superior room that was decorated as luxuriously as any 4 or 5 star hotel. It was immaculate and beautiful. The master suite and the living room had separate balconies overlooking the golf course. The balconies were large enough to hold tables and chairs. Granite counters, top of the line appliances, Cuisnart pots, Henkel knives, washer and dryer, spacious rooms, flat screen tvs in every room, free cable internet access and daily maid service. Tech support for our internet coneection issue was in our room within 30 minutes. You simply can not get a room with these amenities at a hotel or, I presume, a rented condo with the quality and number of amenities this resort has. Of course, I haven't even mentioned golf ... Which leads to my next category. 2. Hotel Services with the benefits of a condo: I didn't fully realize this until we stayed there. You have 24 hour food service, 24 hour concierge, food and drink service at the main pool, and all of the other amenities listed in other reviews. You can have your refrigerator stocked with food before you get there. The lobby of the main building is very impressive and beautiful. 3. Service: This was my Ginn Reunion moment. When I asked Jen from the Concierge how I could get tickets to Seaworld on line, she offered to have me email them to her and she would have a driver deiliver the documents to my doorstep. When I discovered that I couldn't do that, she offered to immediately send a driver to pick me up and bring me to the 24 hour business center. She suggested I come by driver, have a cocktail at the rooftop pool bar, and have a driver take me back to the room. When we left our jewelry in the safe, Jen called me personally to ensure me they would fedex the jewelry to us. 4. Location: We were in a small buidling on the edge of the resort. It was quite and peaceful, which was good for us. I got to the resort exits in 8 minuteson the highway. We had a spectacular view of the fireworks from our balcony. 5. Amenities: They are described by other reviewers and the company's website. As others said, the water park alone is a reason -- for kids and parents -- to stay there. It is huge and has great service and family entertainment.

Reviews.Title: “Central Florida's Best Kept Secret - keep it that way”
Reviews.Author: 150thBucktailPA
Reviews.Content: I really hesitate to review this resort because I want it to stay the hidden gem we found it to be.... but we have fallen in love with the place so much, that I'm going to. And we are already planning on returning here for a longer stay ,and possibly with a short stay at the one near St. Augustine around the same time next summer. That is if the economy doesn't continue to slack. We stayed here the last week of June, and were looking for few day layover while on our way to the southwestern Gulf Coast. Didn't necessarily want to do the theme parks and their water parks, wanted to avoid the crowds, but wanted some action that a 5 and 10 year old would appreciate. While looking at just about every hotel and resort option in the Orlando area and reading the overwhelming reviews on TA of the hotels and resorts glazing my eyes, I determined that they were all either used and abused due to popularity, overpriced, having to suffer through timeshare proposals, or all of the above. Then I stumbled upon the Ginn Reunion Resort website. It looked great on the website. 3 Golf courses, swimming pools scattered around the resort, a resort waterpark with lazy river and water slide, dress codes in certain places, gated and secure community, food and amenities, a spa, and the list continues on. But I figured it would be super expensive and out of our average middle class league. WAS I WRONG!! We were able to book (what we would consider) an upscale 2 bedroom/2 bath villa and were placed not far from the resort waterpark at an EXTREMELY reasonable price when compared to the other comparable resorts and hotels. I used the website as a source while speaking with a customer service representative originally from Wisconsin. She was great, very patient, very polite, and very knowledgable. I figured there would be hidden costs to go along with the great rate or probably a sales pitch so I asked her about it. The only extra costs to go along with the rate was the tax and a 9% daily resort fee. So I took it and hoped for the best not quite knowing what I was getting into even from the high percentages of positive reviews. It was an awesome experience from the moment we pulled into the Resort Front Security Gate... through the resort... up to the Reunion Grande where the check-in is located... to the villa... and the waterpark. The entire place is immaculate, clean, and beautiful. The resort staff we encountered were always polite, smiling, and professional. The villa had probably the most comfortable beds we've ever slept on. The villa was well-stocked with the expected necessities, very clean, spacious, and well decorated. Granite countertops, throughout. 3 large HD FlatScreen TV's with DVD players. Kitchen had stainless steel appliances and quality cabinetry. High quality carpeting where it would be expected. All the furniture was of a very good quality, as was the balcony furniture. The balcony had 2 points of entry via the living room and the master bedroom. The master bath was completely tiled with jacuzzi tube and a separate shower that could fit 10 people. It also had a separate room for the toilet. It was well stocked. The second bath was tiled and had a tub shower combo, and like the other was well-appointed and stocked. The "village" we were located in also had nice playground in the middle surrounded by the villa buildings. In one word, this place was "OUTSTANDING" A++++.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Florida vacation spot!”
Reviews.Author: utahgirl471
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying at this resort. I was traveling with my family (husband, 2 kids and my father) we rented a 3 bedroom townhouse and it was absolutely georgeous! We were in Florida to visit Disney and Universal Studios and the Ginn was only about a 25 minute drive from the parks. The property goes on forever. There was a small pool in our neighborhood, and a waterpark with a lazy river ride close by. At the water park they had music and games for the kids lead by the staff of the Ginn which was a lot of fun. We spent most of our time at the seven eagles pavillion pool, where they had plenty of lounge chairs around the pool, noodles for the guests to use, a covered area with tables and chairs where you could get out of the sun and order food. They also had a pool table and ping pong for the kids. There is a small gym there too... although it's not the "world class fitness center" the web site claims. Just a few treadmills and a couple of pieces of resistance equipment. But it's still very nice. In their main building you can go up to the 11th floor and there is a restaurant and another pool with large padded lounge chairs, and you can see both Disney and Epcot's fireworks from this level. It's a great way to spend the evening. At night at the 7 eagles pool they put up a huge movie screen and show movies and make popcorn. It's a great family time, you can float in the pool while watching a movie! The Ginn Reunion Resort did not dissappoint! I look forward to my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Very good overall”
Reviews.Author: Tusich
Reviews.Content: We just got back from 5 nights vacation at Ginn’s Reunion Resort. Overall experience is really good except for a few issues we faced. First of all, front desk people were really unfriendly during the check in. No greeting, no smile, no welcome. I felt like they were annoyed by us even though we were the only ones in the lobby (at 5:30 pm). They didn’t even show us on the map our room location until I asked them to do so. The room was great. We were staying in Heritage Crossing neighborhood, which is right next to the entrance and approximately 3 mins drive from the main building. We were on the 1st floor in 3brd. condo, but didn’t use other 2 brds, which were locked (we originally booked 1 brd room). The villa had very nice kitchen with granite countertops and all appliances, pots and pans, silverware, paper towels, dishwasher with soap, microwave, etc. Bedroom had a garden tub + shower and was very spacious. Both living room with the queen size sofa sleeper and the bedroom with king size bed had TVs and DVD players, which was really great ‘cause we brought lots of children’s DVDs with us. It was also very quiet despite of the fact that we had 1 other family of 5 living above us in the same building. Everything was very clean and neat. Housekeeping came every day, cleaned, washed dishes, changed towels. Also, it was so nice and convinient that we had a washer and a drier in the unit. After unpacking we went to have dinner at the resort’s Clubhouse right next to the main building. I knew from resort’s web site that kids under 5 eat free if you choose the buffet. However neither our seating hostess nor our server mentioned anything about that. Instead they brought children’s menu to choose from. After I asked them if it’s true that the buffet is free for children under 5, they agreed, but it was like I was pulling those word out of their mouths with the pliers and then they insisted again that I would choose something from the kids menu. I said that we’re gonna stick with the buffet, and after all they ended up charging me for my 4 y.o full price anyway. So, after this experience we decided not to use their eateries and stick with some simple cooking, since we had such a great kitchen. I went to nearby Publix (very good grocery store), 5 mins drive from Heritage Crossing, and bought everything we needed – bread, turkey, cheese, tomatoes, lettice, pasta, already roasted whole chicken, hot dogs, cereal, milk, orange juice, wine. I didn’t do much cooking, but we saved a lot by doing this and I don’t regret. You wouldn’t be able to do this in a regular hotel with no kitchen. We used the sofa sleeper, since there were 3 of us, but as I found out there were no sheets, blankets or pillows for it provided in the unit. So I had to call front desk and ask for the sheets, pillow and a blanket. 5 mins later guy showed up, but brought only 3 sheets… no pillow, no blanket. The other negative moments to be short are: 1) We ran out of paper towels one day and had to call front desk 4 times (every hr) to get it… 4 hrs later we finally got them; 2) Front desk said there won’t be any dive-in movies during the week, however, they had a movie on Wednesday and Thursday nights… we missed Wednesday night children movie because of that, which was really upsetting, since my daughter really wanted to see it. On Thursday I called concierge to confirm the time of Thursday night movie and was told that it will begin at 9 pm. I asked them if they’re sure, because yesterday it stated at 7:30, and they said “yes, we’re sure” and they even put me on hold to ask someone else to double check. When we got to Seven Eagles pool at 9 pm… you guessed it… the movie was over! My husband ended up calling the management and said something to them, and after all they played a movie for a 2nd time. The water park, lazy river and all the pools were really great and we had so much fun there, especially our daughter, of course. The water play area was never crowded and we could easily find plenty of chairs at any time of the day. However, they kept closing water park area due to the T-storms that occurred almost every day after 4-5 pm. Personally we thought it was ridiculous, because sometimes it never even rained and you wouldn’t see a lightning, but as soon as their staff heard couple of thunder sounds, they immediately shut down the park and kicked everybody out. Good thing that we had a pool at our neighborhood, right next to our room. And it was closed only once. The rest of the time we could enjoy it after we were kicked out of the water park. Next to the ‘big’ pool there was also a 1 foot deep kiddy pool, which my daughter really enjoyed. There were also 3 cranes living in the near by swamp whom we liked very much. They would come to our patio as soon as we would start eating and took the bread out of our hands. They were very cute and friendly. The view to the golf course was great. All neighborhoods and the main building are pretty far from each other, so be ready to do a lot of walking or rent/have a car. They had a shuttle though that can take you around the resort, but you have to call front desk first and then wait until it gets to you door and picks you up. Also, their kids camp play room was closed for renovation, which was a bummer, because based on its pictures and Ginn’s TV channel coverage was really cool with lots of toys, games, etc. Due to remodeling they moved kids camp room to Heritage Crossing and when we went with my daughter to check it out we were really disappointed. It was an empty room with plain walls and 1 small TV set. No sings of decorations of toys. My daughter didn’t want to stay there for a minute. They said they do some crafts if you sign up your kid, take them to the water park or to the small play ground that they have. I wouldn’t want my 4 y.o to do any of those. It was too hot to stay outside and be on the playground and I wouldn’t trust anyone to take her to the water park, so we didn’t use their kids camp.

Reviews.Title: “What a resort, what a pool, definitely stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: tangek
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are frequent travelers, and we have just added a new favorite to our list – Ginn Reunion Resort. Ginn is pronounced with a soft G, as in “Guinness” – named after the founder Bobby Ginn. The resort is part of a huge complex that stretches for miles with a hotel, multiple golf courses, a water park, and owner occupied homes. We traveled as a party of 4 adults and a 7 month old baby. We decided to rent a 3 bedroom house in the deluxe category with private pool, and were assigned to 1103 Watson Court. What a spectacular house! The main gate has 24 hour security. Upon arrival, we were given a pass to put in the window of our car so that we had access to come and go as we pleased. Check in was at the main building, and was very smooth. The House - We heard that all homes are individually owned, but centrally rented out by Ginn Reunion. So keep in mind that our description below is for the house that we stayed at. They must have common standards, but could be personalized differently based on the owners. -The house was 2nd to the end on a cul-de-sac and was perfectly quiet for a good night’s sleep. The house had a 2 car garage, which was really convenient to keep the car cool in Florida’s summer heat. The key to the front door was a key card, just like a hotel. Just inside the foyer was a lovely mosaic surrounded by tile floors. The first room, off to the right, was a study with a desk, internet connection, small flat screen TV, and a pullout sofa. On the left-hand side of the hallway was a laundry room with a full size washer and dryer, a large utility sink, iron and ironing board, and an entrance to the garage. The hotel provided two single-usage packs of Tide detergent. - The hallway led to a spectacular open kitchen with granite countertops and all the basic appliances – refrigerator, dishwasher, microwave, and coffee maker. The cabinets were stocked with all of the dishes, pots, pans, and utensils that one needs for meals. In fact, we cooked pancakes for breakfast and grilled burgers for dinner, and didn’t need to supply anything but the food. Ginn Reunion supplied a small Palmolive dish soap and sponge, and the maids ran the dishwasher for us each day. - The dining room table was next to the kitchen and had seating for 8 people. Beyond the dining area was an open great room that had a sofa, chairs, a TV, and a fireplace. We also found another wired internet connection in the living room. The living room had a door that opened onto a back patio overlooking a nature preserve and a golf course in the distance. - Off to the side, behind the living room, was a bedroom and full bath. The room had a king sized bed, ample closet space and a shower/tub combination in the bath. The floor was carpeted. - The bedroom, as well as the living/dining area, both had entrances to a small private outdoor swimming pool / Jacuzzi. The pool was surrounded by a patio with an outdoor table, chairs, and lounge chairs. There was also a large gas grill. The pool was small in size, but still comfortable for floating around and relaxing. The Jacuzzi had seating for 4 people. Note that the pool was not heated, which was fine in June but might have been cold in the winter. We also couldn’t find a net to clean out the pool, but when we called the front desk to inquire, they sent someone to clean it for us. - Upstairs, the master bedroom was spacious and comfortable, with hardwood floors, a king sized bed, large closet, desk, and a TV on a stand with dresser drawers. The bed had a Simmons mattress and was extremely comfortable. The private bathroom was spectacular, with a Jacuzzi tub, glass enclosed shower with stone floor, a toilet, and two separate sinks. The bedroom had 2 ceiling fans! Just outside the bedroom was an entrance to a 2nd story balcony (above the patio) with a table and chairs and a nice view. - Also upstairs was a wet bar and lounge area with super-comfy leather chairs that reclined flat and a game table. The wet bar had a sink, small refrigerator, and counter space to prepare snacks. - Behind that area was a 3rd bedroom with double bed, carpeted floors, a TV, a large closet, and a full bath with a shower / tub combination. - We requested a crib for our son. The hotel had forgotten to set it up for our arrival, but delivered a Pack-and-Play promptly after we phoned them. Note that it came w/ a regular bed sheet, not a fitted crib sheet. We were worried about this, but after wrapping the sheet tightly around the pad at the bottom of the crib, it stayed tightly for the 6 nights that we spent at the hotel. - The home appeared to be furnished by an interior decorator, as the theme of wood, wicker, and leather was tastefully established throughout the home, and all of the furniture appeared to be top quality. Having stayed at many 5 star hotels, the furniture was definitely on par. - Our house was cleaned daily, just like a hotel room. We did have some minor issues with the times that the maids came. Two days, they came quite early in the morning (before 10am) before we left for the day, and we asked them to return later. They then returned quite late in the day (after 5pm), and we ended up sitting around the house waiting for them to finish cleaning. None of the maids spoke English, so it was difficult to communicate what we wanted. The Water Park Perhaps our favorite part of Ginn Reunion was the water park. The complex is open only to resort guests and golf club members, so it wasn’t overcrowded and we easily found lounge chairs both days that we went. The lazy river was so much fun, we doubt that we’ll be satisfied with a “normal” pool again!! The resort provided tubes (including a child’s tube that our 7 month old baby could use with supervision) to float around. The current was strong enough that you literally could let it take you around in circles. The course had several waterfalls, twists, and turns to keep it interesting. Off to the side of the lazy river, but connected, was a “regular pool” area with a gradual entrance where small children could play with their families. And in the center of the lazy river was a water slide for use by older children and adults, We loved the slide, and saw everyone from 5 year olds to grandmothers making use. About 20 feet away from the lazy river area was a dedicated children’s facility with lots to hold their attention – 2 water slides, stairs to climb, rigging (like on a ship), ropes to swing on, and random sprays / splashes of water at unexpected moments. Everyone seemed to be having fun. And there were lifeguards throughout. We also ordered food at the pool. We were pleasantly surprised by the quality of the sandwiches, which were freshly made and tasty. The Main Hotel Building At the main hotel building, we also saw a rooftop lap pool on the 11th floor. It had great views, and would probably be better suited than the water park for people looking to get exercise via swimming laps. The 11th floor also had an indoor Asian fusion tapas bar that looked really cool, although we didn’t try. We dined twice at Forte, the American steak and seafood house on the main floor. The short rib special was excellent, and the light and tasty Chilean sea bass also deserves a mention. And the service was attentive – the manager helped us select a wine, and the waiters remembered what we had ordered previously despite 4 nights in between visits. Be forewarned – the prices are reminiscent of NY. We were able to walk from our house to the main hotel building by cutting across one of the golf courses. The walk was very scenic, with beautiful flowers, trees dripping with Spanish moss, and manicured greens. Unfortunately, we don’t golf so we can’t comment on the courses from that perspective, but they looked quite nice. We were on the lookout for wildlife, and saw deer, rabbits, a variety of birds, and cute little lizards. Note that the resort is tipless and cashless, so use your keycard for everything. The hotel has ~8 concierge staff members in place to help answer your questions or make arrangements. They contacted us in advance of arrival to ask if they could help, and also greeted us to see if we had questions while sitting in the lobby. The complex is so large that the resort offers a complementary shuttle van to pick you up and drop you off anywhere within the complex. And when my father forgot his hat at the restaurant, the staff delivered the hat directly to our home within minutes of us placing a call to the restaurant. Great service! During our stay, we chatted with several members of the staff at both the water park and the lobby / front door. Everyone commented that Ginn Reunion was a great place to work – it’s always a good sign when the employees are happy. The Surrounding Neighborhood Outside the complex, we found a Dunkin Donuts and CVS just a block down the road. A Publix is being built across the street, but for now, there is another Publix supermarket at Championsgate, about 1.5 miles down the road near Rt. 4. We also grabbed a late night bite at Chile’s restaurant in Championsgate, which was bustling even at 10pm. We drove from the resort to both Disney World and Epcot. It was about 6 miles to the main gates using the back road alongside Dunkin Donuts, or slightly longer on the main highway. Either way was easy to drive. In summary, we loved coming back to such a beautiful home each night, and found it very easy to get around the sights that we planned to see. The resort’s facilities were quite relaxing. We could not have asked more from our vacation. So book at Ginn Reunion and enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “Solid experience despite minor shortcomings”
Reviews.Author: Obama2008
Reviews.Content: Great property. Total A+ luxury condo. We were put in a different part of the property then we were originally booked in. Furthur away from everything-but quiet and with a great view. They did say up front that this may happen, but could not really understand since the property seemed less then half occupied. Other disappointments were lack of HD television and the fact that we had to kick and scream a bit for a clock radio with an Ipod dock after we were promised there would be one in the room. Paper never seemed to make it to the door which prompted calls to the front desk. Seemed funny since they make a big deal when you check in that you can "opt out" of the paper and reduce nightly bill by 75 cents. All fairly minor bumps in the road. The food was outstanding and fairly priced, even poolside. Waterpark was outstanding-and included in the price-which by the way was also outstanding. Tapas place Eleven was awesome and provided the ultimate in high-end take out for parents traveling with two little ones. Overall, I would give the place high marks. Say 86/100 factoring everything in. Very kid friendly, attentive staff, beautiful condo, clean, new, outstanding property. I would stay there again, especially if the pricing remains as attractive as it is currently.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: leslie58
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 1 week vacation at Ginn Reunion Resort. It was truly a lovely and relaxing vacation spot. It is very clean and designed nicely. The property is so huge that you do feel somewhat "disconnected," but a visit to the water park pool or the 11th floor bar/pool allows you to feel much more a part of the "resort" atmosphere. The property is upscale and appears to cater to its members. It is very golf-centered and has 3 beautiful courses. In fairness to the staff, they do make guests feel as welcome as members in the restaurants and bars. The water park and pool is absolutely wonderful. My 5 year old son learned to swim here and felt comfortable since he could walk right in to the water. The lazy river was amazing! What a gorgeous pool area. The Seven Eagles (main) pool, however, was a bit disappointing. It was very dirty on the bottom, which made it uninviting. Overall, the service is wonderful. Our 3 bedroom villa was immaculate and well-maintained with lovely appliances and furnishings. It would have been nice if movies were available either by pay per view or by rental. The 11th floor bar/pool area is very beautiful and has a great view. You can view the Disney fireworks from this rooftop spot, although they are distant and hard to locate if you are not up at the railing. All in all, it is a very tasteful and relaxing spot, although it caters more to adults. The Ginn Resort is quieter and much more peaceful than the Disney hotels and far less stimualting. It is a great place for young children who are already stimulated by all the theme parks. I would recommend this property for a quiet, peaceful, upscale and relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “If you love golf...you'll love Ginn Reunion”
Reviews.Author: CapsWife69
Reviews.Content: I traveled here on business and didn't know what to expect. The property is a time-share type resort with a big main building and then what seems to be about a square mile of condos, houses and three golf courses. If I had the time, I would have played golf! I was about 1/4 mile away from the lobby and had to take a shuttle to my meetings each day. The staff in the hotel, the very cool bar on the 11th floor and housekeeping where very nice and cordial. The pool staff were less enthusiastic about assisting guests. The Mojito on the 11th floor was the best I've ever had and the one by the pool, the worst - however- they did remake it for me when I asked them to do so. This resort has a great water park that we had a reception in on night. Great for families and golfers. Getting around without a vehicle was tough, but I imagine most people will have cars. The condo I had was huge! Room service was fine and always right on time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful- will definitely return”
Reviews.Author: KEWLBEANS
Reviews.Content: Rented a beautiful condo for a week and used the waterpark & pool, ate at the clubhouse & eleven. Everything was just great. Eleven is fairly pricey ($6 for a qtr cup of rice) but otherwise I was really happy with the accomodations and the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing golf !!!!”
Reviews.Author: OhsoLuckyt
Reviews.Content: Group of 12 golfers. You cannot use personal credit cards or cash during stay. This includes drink carts on courses. You're supplied a Ginn card for everything & then settle up at the end. EXCEPT!!! see the steak house fiasco below! A-- accomodations 3 private homes, very nice except !! 1-- No barbeque grills as promised at any of them 2-- Hot tub was there but if you wanted hot water it cost $60 more per day. Just let us know up front! 3-- We were promised homes next to each other yet we were blocks apart which was not very condusive to sharing in the fun as a unit! B-- Food We had the buffet breakfasts included, it was good but same old every day "scrambled eggs, potatoes, sausage, bacon" The fruit bar was good, the toasters took at least 5 minutes to heat up (Everyone was laughing) If you wanted juice it was an extra charge. Lunch was a hurry since we were playing 36 holes , ordered off "quick" menu all were $9.00 (hot dog BBQ pork or turket wrap) We ate dinner off campus except the last night, we ate at their signature steak house. Food excellent, however when we went to pay they would not accept our Ginn credit cards! we had to scramble for the $1,600.00. Not very nice!! C-- Golf. Courses were not in good shape at all, fairways hard as airport runways They cant blame a drought either since a few people we met were so mad they cancelled rounds & went 20 minutes away to "green" courses for only $60 per round. They need to water or redesign irrigation somehow . It was brutal Don't get me wrong, if they would have been in any playable condition they would have been great, they had some really nice hole layouts. Many ,many traps but hardly any rakes. The traps were enormous, & to get to the traps & back would take minutes, we gave up raking at many! The drink carts were limited & seldom available. One girl said she was the only one servicing all courses. We palyed only the Palmer & Watson courses since the Nicklaus greens were being aerated supposedly! (people did play we found out) BEWARE there's no break after 1'st nine on either so be sure to have a bottle with you for water refills. We've been to Doral, Innisbrook, PGA Tampa campuses past three years, this facility needs to either fire the manager in charge of golf or really get some classes in golf accomodations. The greenskeeper should be fired as well!! Believe me the Watson course was burned out terribly it was worse then public courses I've played on in Newark new jersey. (No kidding!!) The greens themselves were brown & really quick (actually unfair) I know this seems a little bitter, but if you spend near $1,600 for golf , flights & incidentals for 3 and a half days you hope to play on grass at least. T E R R I B L E e x p e r i e n c e !! Go to Innisbrook Thats an experience you'll love!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: cwaNy
Reviews.Content: I share the impressions that several other reviewers have mentioned. In short: lovely property, great location, good (but not always Outstanding) service. Ginn's web site is not particularly helpful in illustrating exactly what your particular unit will be like, but they are ALL furnished with high-end, amenities. The units were truly beautiful, clean, new and tasteful. We thought we were getting a bi-level condo (with a fourth room) and instead checked into a one level condo. It was lovely and spacious, but realized after we were already settled in that it didn't have the 4th room. The manager gave us a credit for the price difference. My three kids (ages 7-12) loved the pools. My mother traveled with us - she enjoyed the gym, the Seven Eagles pool (more relaxing for adults, but the Kids Crew main office is here too) . We stayed at Ginn during the LPGA golf tournament. It was very busy, but extremely well managed. My husband played golf and wants to come back with the guys for a golf outing. He found the courses to be more challenging than they looked. Most employees were terrific, some were only good. However, the accommodations are outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “Best Ever!”
Reviews.Author: FlickTravel
Reviews.Content: This is the best resort I have ever stayed at in the Orlando area. It is truly a 5-star, luxury resort. We rented a 5 bedroom superior home for a week. Our home was gorgeous! The kitchen had granite countertops and every amenity you could think of. We had a dinette area that seated four, two barstools, a separate dining room that seated six, laundry room, 1/2 bath, and a huge 2-story living room with sofa, loveseat, and chair. The master bedroom was on the main level with a king bed, bath with garden tub, 2 separate vanities, toilet in separate room, and huge glass shower. The upstairs had a balcony that overlooked the main level. There were 2 more queen bedrooms upstairs and 2 more two twin bedrooms. There were also 2 full baths upstairs. Every bedroom and the living room had flat screen TVs on the wall. We had a screened in lanai that housed another table with four padded chairs and 2 padded lounge chairs. We had our own inground pool with spill-over hot tub. Pool and hot tub heat were not included in the price. Since the water was warm enough, we opted not to pay the $50 a day to heat our private pool and hot tub. The resort has numerous pools. Our kids loved the main pool with the waterpark the best. There was a large flume waterslide (must be 42") that landed in the beautifully landscaped lazy river. There was also a huge kids splash park that had an additional 2 smaller slides for the little ones. This pool has complimentary beach towels to use while there. There is also a beach volleyball court. We were there over Spring Break and although the pool was busy, we never had any trouble finding lounge chairs. There are lifeguards on duty during the waterpark open hours of 10 am - 5 pm. The other pools on the resort are open until 11 pm. Our neighborhood, the Homestead, also had their own private heated pool, kiddie pool, and hot tub. No one was ever at this pool, so we enjoyed complete privacy at this pool after the waterpark closed. This resort is gorgeously landscaped. I want to live at this resort! Our home came with daily maid service. This is included in the price of staying at the resort. We booked through RCI, our timeshare website, not the resort and still received this complimentary service. This is a no-tipping resort, so do not tip anyone whether housekeeping, valets, or waiters. We did not purchase any food or drink while at this resort. It is a very pricey resort, and we were minutes from a Publix, McDonalds's, Pizzeria, and Chili's. The resort is 2 miles from Interstate 4, and 4 miles from Highway 192 where every imaginable restaurant is located. With traffic, the resort is about 10 minutes from Disney, 15 minutes from Sea World. Since we are a family with 4 kids, we chose to either eat at the house or go out to eat instead of eating at the resort. I would recommend this resort to everyone. I would love to stay here every time I go to Orlando. The resort is so large, quiet, and away from the busy roads near Disney. We loved the nearness to the theme parks, but felt like we were a world away from the crowds when we lounged at the resort. This resort is gorgeous and relaxing! You will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Slick operation”
Reviews.Author: PDH01
Reviews.Content: Non-golfers who stayed one night on our way back to the airport. Good place for a bit of R&R between parks and beaches. Everything very well-run and thought-through. You need to know/like what it is - pre-built conduminium - very spacious and new-built - devoid of character in the middle of nowhere. Good-sized & very well-furnished appartments. Our 3-yr old really enjoyed the pool area. Friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star Surroundings 2 Star Golf Courses”
Reviews.Author: LeslieOntario
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Feb for a golf/shopping/winter get-a-way. Our room was a 3 bedroom condo on the top floor. Centre Court Ridge was the name I think. The suite was classy, roomy, clean and quiet. The suite is fully stocked with higher end dishes, silverware.....etc. This is a fantastic property that is safe and high end but the price is affordable. We ate at Forte - the dinner was innovative and delicious. Overall the service was outstanding. My only complaint was the golf course. We played the Independence course. We were told (after we paid) we couldn't drive on the fairways due to the drought conditions. This wasn't a problem at championsgate or any of the Disney courses. The course was dry and tired and the fairway looked like it just had about 4 tourneys play through on it. The pace of play was also slow. Also we called for the refreshment cart about 3 times and no one came....told the pro-shop and they really didn't seem too upset - considering the other options I have for golf courses, they should step up their service in the golf department. I saw a decline in the course condition from 2007. The Disney courses were amazing (Magnolia and Osprey Ridge) Championsgate was in ok shape too but they gave us 30 dollars to use for lunch or in the pro-shop so that kind of made up for it. In closing - Reunion is a great place, great value and if you do want a cheap meal out one night Chilli's is right down the road.

Reviews.Title: “Best Girls Weekend Ever!”
Reviews.Author: COOKIEGIRL17
Reviews.Content: The Ginn resort is the best resort we have ever stayed at. I don't know how any one could ever say anything bad about this place. From the guard at the front gate to the engineer who came to see why our ice maker wasn't working, every person was friendly and went above and beyond. We had dinner at Eleven and every bite was delicious. We had drinks by the fire place that was poolside on the roof. The resort is spread out but we always had a car to take us around at a moments notice. Always smiles and happy to help. I dont think I would ever stay at another resort in the Orlando area. We are already planning another trip there with all of our families for the summer. This place is terrific!!!

Reviews.Title: “Spectacular resort......ok service.”
Reviews.Author: 2Putt
Reviews.Content: My wife and I and another couple stayed at the Ginn Reunion Resort for a week in March. The property itself and the accomodation is nothing short of spectacular. The condos are beautiful and the golf courses, pools, waterpark, and other amenities are pretty much as good as it gets. I find it hard to believe anyone could be disappointed with the accomodation or the facilities. Everything is first class. The golf courses are challenging and expensive ($165 per round) so I wouldn't recommend you go to Reunion for a golf vacation unless you are a fairly regular golfer and are prepared to part with some coin. There are 3 beautifully manicured courses and full clubhouse and practice facilities right on site. Our group consisting of two couples enjoyed the Palmer (Legacy) and Watson (Independence) courses the most. They were fair tests of golf and the tee blocks were friendly to the ladies and all handicap levels. The Nicklaus (Tradition) course has just been completed and we found it to be a bit too diffcult. There are fairway traps everywhere and the sand has the soft texture you expect to find in greenside bunkers so it is extremely tough to advance the ball. My 1 handicap buddy only managed to shoot 84 ! I suspect the Nicklaus course will be more enjoyable once the course matures a bit. Some of the other reviewers (and Ginn) rave about the customer service. I must be honest and say we didn't find it to be anything exceptional. For example, we didn't have a great check in experience. We arrived in the morning and completed a pre-check in and then hung out at the pool for the day. We were advised our unit would be ready by 4pm at the latest and it wasn't. Also, we booked 4 months in advance and had arranged to be in the same complex as our friends and they were not going to deliver on that either. They proceeded to put us in two different complexes. We finally got our accomodation at about 5:30pm in the same condo complex but only after insisting that we speak to the Manager. I still can't figure out why they fumbled the check-in because there were clearly a number of vacant units in our complex. We also found the food and drink service at the pool areas to be very slow. On the positive side, there is no tipping which makes it easy and there are a number of nice touches throughout the resort such as club cleaning, golf club storage, doormen, shuttles to your vehicle, security, etc. The service in the clubhouse restaurant, Eleven (rooftop bar) and pro shop was fine. It is worthy to mention that the resort is gated and Ginn security people and lifeguards always seem to be around. As such, if you are there with your children you will feel comfortable allowing them to go off to the waterpark while you go golfing, etc. Overall, we really enjoyed our stay at the spectacular Ginn Reunion Resort and we would not hesitate to recommend it to friends and colleagues. We would have gave Reunion a big 5 out of 5 but while the customer service was ok, we didn't think it quite lived up to our expectations for a higher end resort.

Reviews.Title: “Sprawling and imperfect but still a great place”
Reviews.Author: crazyandcrazier
Reviews.Content: Rooms here are huge, which is not to be confused with terrifically well-appointed. If you like to watch movies bring your own DVDs, because they don't have pay-per-view or any kind of movie rental, even in the shopping center nearby. I did love having a washer/dryer in our place, and shopping at the nearby grocery store meant we could have meals in our room, which had a kitchen, so that was all great. Because the resort is so sprawling we ended up driving to the pool/waterpark. We enjoyed it there, though (of course) buying any extras like ice cream or water can add up. The resort is "cash free" but that just means you'll get a big old bill at the end, since everything goes on your tab. This is a quiet resort and a nice break from all the theme-park craziness, if that kind of a break is what you need. It feels very adult, though there are kids around, and a small playground for them to play in. I'd be remiss if I didn't end with the fact that all the employees we encountered were amazingly nice--which counts for a lot!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: earz
Reviews.Content: Very roomy and in excellent condition. Pool area was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for extended family vacation”
Reviews.Author: chaplo
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 days at Ginn Reunion. Perfect option for our family of 4 plus in-laws. Townhouse was very nicely decorated, with w/d and laundry soap, coffee pot/and coffee, toaster oven, silverware, cooking utensils, dishwasher/and detergent....basically all we needed to buy was juice, milk, bread and eggs! Nearby in the Champions Gate shopping complex is a Publix and a pizza delivery/restaurant with good pasta dishes too. Kids (5 and 3) LOVED the waterpark. Only complaint is that one day, the maid service didn't show, even though we were out of the room all day (on a previous day, when we were room-bound due to a sick child, cleaning service came as soon as we ventured out in the evening). It is a little bit of a drive to the parks, but I found the downtime in the car restful for the parents as well as for the kids....which is important when you're doing the crazy pace of Disney. I found everyone we encountered at Ginn Reunion very polite and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever!”
Reviews.Author: rudy9
Reviews.Content: This has simply been the best vacation ever. We are on our last day of a one week rental at Ginn Reunion. We rented a 4 bedroom, 5 bath house on Exctiement Drive, overlooking the golf course. Stunning views. The house is very tastefully furnished and decorated...very pleasantly surprised. The staff has been outstanding, service excellent. We did the pre-grocery order, what a treat that was. The golf courses are expensive but well worth it and the Spa a real treat. There are lots of things to do in and around the resort area. Overall, very relaxing and first class.

Reviews.Title: “Over the top staff”
Reviews.Author: 4ms
Reviews.Content: Our family of four met up with extended family this past January . We stayed at the Ginn and they stayed a mile or two away in their motorhome. We booked a 2 bedroom townhouse. At check-in we asked if our room was ready and they said not quite, so we asked for a lower level and they had one ready. Bonnie, checked us in with such friendliness that our 2 sons 16 and 8 walked over to see what had us laughing and talking. We all sat around her desk conversing. We ended up with a 3 bedroom that was lovely. The weather was nasty during our stay , but I convinced my 8 year old to participate in a few kids programs. He entered the jump rope contest and won it because he was the only entry. Paul, Rachael, Amanda and Jarred followed him around in a treasure hunt like he was a king !! The kids staff was excellent!!! We can't wait to return hopefully with warmer weather. We were able to do laundry and we made quite alot of meals in the wonderfully supplied kitchen.( bring your own salt and pepper)Our hats are off to the Ginn !!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service”
Reviews.Author: TassPerth
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed in a 3 bedroom townhouse in January. Coming from Australia we loved the no tipping policy. The house was above expectation, very classy fit out, and comfortable furniture and fittings. The kitchen equipment all seemed practically brand new. Our home looked out over the Golf course which was quite beautiful on misty mornings and there was outdoor furniture to relax on. There was a heated pool a stones throw away with a fantastic hot spa bath, perfect for soothing weary limbs after traipsing around the theme parks. Of course there seems to be a whole range of accommodation types available in this resort, all of a very high quality. We sampled the breakfast in the Golf club house which was top class. We also had dinner in a penthouse restaurant in the main building. This was quite spectacular with rooftop pool, waitresses in Turqoise mini dresses with white GoGo boots, and amazing views of the twinkling lights (Oh, and the food was groovy too, Asian inspired Tapas This resort is certainly not short of staff, and they provide quality service . We did not play Golf as we were really in Florida to see the sights, but the courses looked top notch, and probably worth a trip in their own right. Really i cannot rave about this place enough, i cannot understand why anyone would want to stay in a hotel room when you can have space and comfort like this. All the theme parks are within an easy half hour drive up the main freeway.

Reviews.Title: “NIGHTMARE - We were robbed!!!”
Reviews.Author: JIMJSG
Reviews.Content: Our 8 bedroom home was robbed while we were on the golf course using the Master Code!!! Inside job???? $1,200 cash and a Rolex taken. No updates given while we were there, told to file claim with my insurance. No compensation given, questioned if we were telling the truth? (8 guys spent $9000 for 4 days.) Room not cleaned one day, clubs misplaced, food left in unit, pool would not heat. Grill extra although told home had one.......Beware!!!

Reviews.Title: “Falsely accussing me of stealing a bedspread and cushions $1800”
Reviews.Author: travelerjj
Reviews.Content: Horrible experience. I was there for two nights and days after my check out they are claiming I stole a bedspread and cushions for $1800 plus a cracked table glass. I am filling a complaint against them with the right government agencies. Not to mention the 3 hour check in after one of the units assigned was already occupied (they had not record of who was in the unit) and the second unit assigned was filthy and dirty (even food in the refrigerator) and in the third they are claiming I stole some items. All this happened at 2 AM after I drove with my kids from Ft. Lauderdale. If you stay here you are at risk.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Valefan
Reviews.Content: I don't know why this place isn't higher on the Orlando Hotel list - we loved it! Although our one bedroom villa was at the main gates which is about half a mile from the Grande Resort (where you can get breakfast and dinner if you want), it didn't put us off. We had a 1 bed but it was actually 3 beds with some of the rooms off the main area locked. The villa was beautifully appointed with everything you would need for a stay away from home. This included a washer/dryer which I didn't see mentioned on their website. We had 6 units of 6 villas in our section. Our section had it's own pool and jacuzzi as well as gardens. Although we did not use these, it did mean that if we chose to we didn't have to travel far. The staff couldn't do enough for us and we had breakfast there for the 3 days of our stay. We also had dinner in the clubhouse which offered good food at reasonable prices. This is a cashless resort. You sign everything to a card which is then chaged to your form of payment at the end of your stay. They charged 20% on all food but at the end of your stay, you were not charged a service charge nor were you asked to leave tips. Of course, this won't apply to anyone who brings in their own food (local grocery store is about 3 minute drive away in Champtions gate). We only took in 1 park which was Epcot and we drove there in just under 15 minutes. Really recommend this place. Much nicer than staying in a hotel plus at $199 or £100 for a night, it worked out to be a bargain compared to other places we could have stayed.

Reviews.Title: “A great place for large Family”
Reviews.Author: Pumpman2
Reviews.Content: We stayed over the December Holidays at the resort. for 13 nites. We had a 5 bedroom house that had a pool as well. The house was immaculate. I thought that it was brand new. We preordered some groceries and they were delivered on time. Check in was a breeze. (Free red apples Yum!) The house was in excellent condition even the most picky would be impressed. There is a waterpark on property that we used the kids loved it. Great for the 2-7 year old set. They have food there as well which was good. We had a choice of staying on property at Disney at a high price or staying here and this was the better choice. About 20-25 minutes from the Disney parks. EZ access, Lots of shops and restarants around. Lots of room for the kids to spread out.. We bring a suitcase full of toys for the 4 kiddies. The cleaning service organized these nicely everyday. They had high speed internet connection. We used it a lot. There is a small pool again great for the kids. You have to turn the pool heater on though and it took a few days to figure this out. The Cleaning people come every day and clean throughly and even do the breakfast dishes! Lots of space, wonderful service. The maintenance people came in 5 minutes when called. They delivered faxes to the house. The house is wonderful condition great furniture, beds, desks, TV's in every room!! My only pet peeve was the 6 remote controls to run the DVD player. I finally just directly hooked the player to the TV. We also had to buy a VHS machine for my son to see his VHS tapes. Over great, highly recommended. Very, Very, Nice...

Reviews.Title: “Loved Ginn Reunion”
Reviews.Author: Chloe56
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ginn Reunion for the first time in November. We had 4 adults and 1 child and stayed in a 3 bedroom villa. The room was amazing. It was huge and had more than enough space for all of us to move about comfortably. The property is close to Epcot and The Magic Kingdom. All of the staff was friendly and accomodating. We will definately be back and recommend it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “What A Beautiful Resort!”
Reviews.Author: viaustraining
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Ginn at Reunion over Christmas 2007. I had heard alot about the Ginn and had high expectations of the resort. I was not disappointed. It was beautiful. On arrival we were given a room - I say room, it was a two bedroomed apartment with balcony overlooking the driving range and golf course. The room was in the actual main resort building called the Grande. The furnishings and standard of fitments were really high. The kitchen was really well equipped absolutely everything that you would need. The staff at the Ginn were fabulous and couldn't do enough for you. The rooftop swimming pool called Eleven was fab as was the Seven Eagles pool. It is a cashless resort so you do not need to bother about tipping anyone this is included in your resort fee, which although quite pricey is worth it. My husband is a golfer and he reported that the courses were immaculate and the Nicklaus course especially was challenging - again pricey but he said it was worth it. Would not hesitate to go back and infact we are looking to book up another holiday at one of the Ginn resorts in another part of US.

Reviews.Title: “Golfers Dream, Family Fun”
Reviews.Author: Texlobo
Reviews.Content: Golfers Dream, Family Fun! Our party, which included, 4 adults, 2 three year old boys, and 1 infant stayed in a 3 bedroom villa in Seven Eagles from 12/3 – 12/10. Nearly everything was perfect with our stay. We were walking distance to Seven Eagles pool and the club house for the Legacy and Independence courses. The accommodations, recreation facilities, customer service, and value were unmatched, not to mention the immaculate condition of the Legacy and Independence courses. I personally liked the no cash no tip policy (you use your guest card only), though I did see one semi-negative review that mentioned they didn’t like this approach. The incidental cost can add up quickly but you can track them daily if you are worried about your budget, or you could also stay at a Motel 6, eat at McDonalds, and play municipal golf courses if you are worried about the money. We opted to rent a car because we had young children but we did not need it other than to go to the grocery store located about 1.5 miles away. Within the resort, prompt shuttle service was provided if we didn’t feel like walking. We never waited more than 10 min for a ride in one of their sweet Mercedes R350s. To be fair I did say nearly perfect as there were two things that could have been improved. We arranged to be picked up at the airport through the resort weeks in advance of our stay. However, the contracted transportation service messed up the pickup date. This resulted in a delay in our pickup by about 1.5 hours. In turn, Ginn did not charge us ($110.00/11 person van) for that transportation. We also checked into our accommodations 5 hours before the standard check in time so all in all we were unhappy, even with the SNAFU. The only other thing was that the pool kitchen closed a couple of hours early on Friday night without warning to free up staff for the prime rib buffet at the club house, the bar was open but no food. Golf; Jack’s course, The Tradition, is long with very small greens (can you say Pebble Beach). It was a fair and challenging. The immature or lack of landscaping as compared to the other two courses are obvious but the course condition was outstanding. In addition, the lack of a clubhouse, abundant home constructions going on around the course did detract from the overall experience. Give it a year and I’m sure the missing details will be in place. It is the hardest of the three, but it’s classic Jack. You can stand on the tee box and see how you are supposed to play the hole, the bailouts and risky shots are there if you want them. Palmer’s course, The Legacy, and Watson’s course, The Independence, are set within the main resort area. The clubhouse is centrally located near the main building. These courses are more mature and the landscaping, course condition, and surrounding homes are immaculate. The Palmer course is the easiest of the three but still challenging. The Watson course is tricky and probably needs to be played a few times before you understand where your supposed to hit the ball. The clubhouse is bright and friendly. It’s the only place that serves breakfast so it’s the main gathering point for all of the hungry hackers and families alike. The (non-breakfast) menu is an interesting mix with chili dogs, home made sweet potato chips with gorgonzola sauce, prime rib, burgers, and killer hash browns. The practice facilities are nice but nothing special. There is plenty of room with a couple of putting greens, chipping and sand practice green, and a double sided driving range. Water Park; The water park is right there on property. It’s a perfect spot for the kiddies. They had lifeguards at every bend, the kids area was cool, and the food was great. Try the corn dog nuggets. Spa, I didn’t go myself but my wife liked it very much. She got a pedicure, massage, and facial. I got golf. Bottom Line; Great Place, I’m already planning my return.

Reviews.Title: “First class resort for family!”
Reviews.Author: aronam
Reviews.Content: We had six adults and four children for four nights in a three bedroom villa. This resort is five star all the way with about a two star cost! Accomodations, amenities, food, events, and staff were all spectacular! I only wish we had more time to spend at the waterpark with the kids- Beach entry, lazy river, waterfalls, three waterslides, plenty of other water toys/activities, and totally heated- They loved it! It's so much nicer than staying in the usual hotel type setting, but has all the benefits and more on site. Though not in the plan this trip, the golf courses were gorgeous and will definitely be part of the agenda when we go back. This is where we'll stay whenever we are in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Look Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: Iprefer5stars
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week long trip from Orlando, and the only mistake I made was staying and revolving my trip around a stay at the Ginn Reunion Resort. We arrived late after traveling all day with my 3 children. I had booked a 3 bedroom home with a pool. When I arrived, I was told I did not book a room with a pool. They were rude and would not give me what I booked, after about an hour of going back and forth with the front desk I finally just asked them to get me a place since we were tired and hungry. They put me in a 4 bedroom house with a cold pool, in the middle of a field with a bunch of other houses and no landscaping. I thought it was at the rate I booked but found out the next day I was being charged a lot more and ended up paying almost 100 more per night. I called the general manager, he told me he would look into, he called me back while we were at Disney, I called him back and he left town for the week. But let me tell you what others have not about this resort: 1. The Villas and homes are privately owned and managed by the developer. The resort is spread out and you have to get into your car and drive to pool, or any other places. 2. This is not a resort where you have services like at most resorts, They have a pool and a lazy river that are nice but don't expect any amenities you would find by a pool at the Ritz or any other resort, they do not have water but charge 3.50 for a bottle, they do have activities for children, but they charge a lot for them, and the pool is located far from your room. 3. This resort is about 20 minutes on busy highway from Disney. 4. This is a golf community, most people come for golf. the course does not look as nice as the photos make it look. 5. Food is expensive and drinks even more $$$$ 6. They like to nickle and dime you to death. 7. The service is poor and the staff is unfriendly. 8. Beware when choosing this location for your next Disney or Orlando vacation. There are a lot of options and rooms available in the Orlando area. Try JW Marriott, they have a nice lazy river and the service is unbelievable. We did leave the resort four days early, They had a warning about the water in the binder about the resort, the warning said you had to boil water before you drink it. They would not serve water at the pools to us, you had to purchase bottled water. I feel the management and front desk were rude and just wanted to overcharge me for my stay. I spoke to Preferred Hotels and they said the rate I had would not be in the system anymore because it was a special rate and would be out of the computer system when I checked in. Orlando has taken for granted the fact that tourism is there only trade and has forgotten how to treat their visitors. It is crowded at the theme parks and Disney is not as friendly as a few years ago. Its such an expensive trip and for a resort not to honor a reservation that was given to a traveler is unacceptable. The other reviews which I read prior to choosing this resort said they loved this resort. I have been to a lot of Preferred Hotels and I'm not sure why they accepted this one to there list. I would have to say it was a very poor place to take children and try to have a vacation. Look elsewhere!

Reviews.Title: “Not Just a Golfer's Paradise”
Reviews.Author: LouT
Reviews.Content: This Place was amazing, the staff was friendly, the villa was spotless, the food was incredible, the views were fantastic, the pool and the hot tub were out of a dream and the waterpark is the best I have ever seen in a hotel, ever. I don't even play golf. It was close to Disney and we could drive ten minutes and be there. I don't like the fact that they don't take cash anywhere in the resort, but other than that, the Ginn is on the top of my list.

Reviews.Title: “I was happy to spend my Birthday at Reunion”
Reviews.Author: Daytripp-r
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Ginn Reunion Resort in June. I had a great day playing golf on my birthday and being pampered by the staff at the resort, they really know how to make you feel special. At night we went to Victoria and Albert's restaurant in the Grand Floridian at Disney World. Spectacular service and amazing food, pricey but certainly worth the splurge. The Ginn Resort has three terrific golf courses and, again, the staff are all about making your day as fun and enjoyable as possible. The restaurants at the resort and golf clubhouse are very nice and very reasonable. We stayed in a Seven Eagles unit and it was very nice. It had a great King bed and a lovely sitting area with a galley kitchen fully decked out. It was clean, comfortable and quiet. The Publix grocery is about 2 miles away and we were able to get everything we needed. One of the nicest things about being at the resort is it is a no cash and no tip facility. No need to dig into you pocket every time someone opens a door or carries a bag, a reasonable resort fee is added to your bill at the end of the trip, and is explained to you when you check in, so there are no surprises. The Staff are always smiling and happy to assist. Shuttle service around the property is readily available. The water park is very popular, and the pool at Seven Eagles is really nice. The spa services are top notch and all three Golf courses are a treat to play. I am already looking forward to my return trip to the Ginn Resort

Reviews.Title: “Don't know why you would stay anywhere else!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: smittygirl1966
Reviews.Content: Went down with our 2 small children for a week at disney, but didn't stay on disney as it was very important for me to have 2 bedrooms and a kitchen - at a reasonable rate. We had initially booked into the Horizons Marriott and checked out the next day. it was okay but not great, and we were looking for something really nice and comfortable since we would be there for a week's time. I had heard of this resort and even considered it before we left and so we decided to drive down and check it out. We booked it right away. the resort is gorgeous!!! We stayed in a 2 bedroom condo and it was very very luxurious. Beautiful furmishings, comfortable beds, marble baths, granite kitchen with stainless countertops and they provide all the kitchen basics like salt, pepper, coffee, etc. Beautiful and quiet golf course views. The waterpark was something out of this world and the kids loved it. Disney was just a short drive away. I can't even begin to tell you how wonderful, relaxing and comfortable it was staying here - especially after long and hot days at disney. The rates were very reasonable at $200 a night (well worth more) and honestly, if you are going to be staying at an off disney property, I can't imagine why you would want to stay any place else. I can't say enough of this place. We would definately return and tell all our friends about this place. WOW, it was AMAZING!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Incredible !!!!!”
Reviews.Author: sybo
Reviews.Content: Ginn is amazing. My 5 friends and I rented a 3 story Villa right on the Palmer course. The house was so big we could have brought another 10 people and all would have had a bed to sleep in. The staff is excellent, the golf is terrific. We never made it over to Disney, but the resort will shuttle you there if needed. There is a Publix grocery store 5 minutes away, so it was great to stock the fridge for our stay. When we arrive tthe staff led us to a house that we weren't to thrilled with as we wanted a pool table. No problem, they simply took us to a bigger house let us look inside, and we were drooling. The house had 7 bedrooms, 5 bathrooms, 3 huge balconies overlooking the course, a pool table, card/chess table, 2 BBQ grills (one of which was an awesome built in unit), a nice sized pool & spa with a huge "backyard" area. Flat screens in every room !!!! I can't say enough about the place, you simply must stay here !!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: TravelPulse
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Ginn in July for 15 nights.. traveling with young kids (2 &4) we were looking for a home away from home and Ginn lived up to that expectation and beyond! We booked a Superior 4 bedroom villa with pool which I can’t say enough about! All the rooms had TVs the Kitchen was fully equipped the furniture was of excellent quality everything was so clean and looked brand new and the great thing is that we got the full hotel service including very friendly house keeping(everything you'd expect from a 5 star resort but in your own home). From the minute we checked in the service was impeccable; we were escorted to our villa by the very friendly Ginn staff who helped us settle in immediately. Ginn is about a 15min drive to Disney which we didn’t mind at all, it was great as we could enjoy Disney but at the same time have a quite time once back at this very tranquil resort. About 2 min away from Ginn at Champions Gate is a Publix, a gas station, bank, walgreens, McDonalds and many other convenient stores. Since we cooked a lot at home having publix right next to us was defiantly a plus. As for the resort itself, the water park and pools were amazing the kids couldn’t get enough! The golf courses looked great even though we don’t play golf. At times we didn’t even leave Ginn between the pool we had in the home and the other activities Ginn offered it was more than enough to keep us happy (we still have plenty of unused days left on our disney tickets!). I have never written a review on Trip Advisor but Ginn deserves a very Special mention. I highly recommend it and would defiantly stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “amazing place to stay in orlando”
Reviews.Author: stuey44
Reviews.Content: This place was fantastic. From arrival the front desk were friendly and very knowledgable, and arranged for an escort to our villa. We stayed in a 6 bed 3 storey villa, which had no twin rooms. I called to discuss a move to another villa, and the front desk drove around, picked me up and showed me alternatives before making a decision on moving. They even helped us move from villa to villa. The desk were helpful everytime we called, and it was very nice to have maid service when your in a villa. Fresh towels and cleaned everyday while enjoying my time in disney. This place really is first class, and totally recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Ginn is better than home!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dmprin
Reviews.Content: This place is great. Stayed in the three bedroom. Place was so nice I wished I could pick it up and bring it back to live in. The rooms were big, everything was clean, and everything you could need was there. It was nice to put the kids to bed and have privacy and time as adults. We picked up some food at the store and made breakfast in the mornings. Very nice instead of eating every meal out when you are away. Saved us money. We had access to a pool feet from our villa, there is also a waterpark that has live music during the day and a lazy river that was a blast the kids wanted to stay there all day. We ate in one of the resturants above the main building, you can watch Disney fireworks from there and there is a great pool and sitting area outside. The food was good, but a bit pricey, but most of Disney is, you expect to pay. Tips are added to everything which takes out the guess work. The only negative is no transportation to the Theme Parks. we rented a car anyway, but had two teenagers who would have liked to go off on their own more and have transportation back to Ginn. If I go back to Orlando, I will stay here for sure, all the comforts of home and the price was bargin.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: SINYTraveler
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an 8 night stay at Reunion Resort. 2 adults, 3 kids (9,12, and 16). What a great place! We rented a 3 bedroom townhouse in Carriage Pointe. The place was beautiful. 3 bedrooms, 4 TV's, 2 full 1-1/2 bath, washer and dryer, great kitchen, own driveway and garage and daily maid service (we rented directly through Reunion itself). Pool and hot tub on premises in Carraige Pointe. This development is actually outside of the Reunion resort itself, yet is a gated community, just across the county road from the gates to the main section. We timed it to the water park, took exactly 55 seconds to get to it from our house. The water park was great, water was refreshing, even in July. The only minor complaint were that you really can't walk to the water park, no matter which development you were in, it is pretty far from all. We did not eat at any of the restaurants, but utilized the poolside service at the Water Park. Really no problems with cashless/tipless. The resort is about 10 min from Disney without traffic. If traffic on 192 or I-4 then of course longer. A CVS is just up the county road closest to the resort, and there are a Publix, 2 gas stations, a Chilis, Walgreens, and a Subway nearby at entrance to Champions Gate (exit for I-4).Otherwise, you do need to go to 192 for anything else you may need. We had a great time, and would love to be able to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “This place will spoil any other accommodation that your stay in again!!!”
Reviews.Author: LiverpoolValo
Reviews.Content: One of the best places I have ever stayed. It is like a home from home. Everything you could possibly want and more!!! The houses are amazing Cable TV and DVD in every room, Washing machines & Dryers. Ensuite bathrooms, terraces with amazing views. Onsite there is wonderful water park for the kids, with a shallow pool that has slides and an activity park for young children (as yong as 18 months) then there is the river lazy rapids which are great. The food served around the pool is lovely and not badly priced, the service is a little slow but it is brought out to with no queing - so who cares!!. Location wise to the theme parks and shopping is around 10 minutes away in the car depending on busy the I 4 Interstate is which is a the bottom of the road from the estate. Orlando International airport is around a 25 minute drive. There is a Publixs Supermarket and CVS Chemist also at the Estate gates which is really handy. Although we didnt play golf the courses looked amazing. This accommodation has now ruined any other holiday that I will go on as it simply is the best!!

Reviews.Title: “Few Compaints...But Liked Overall”
Reviews.Author: danie2020
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Reunion and based on the reviews I was really looking forward to staying there. Honestly, arrival day was a dissapointment because we utilized the grocery service to have groceries delivered to our unit. They stated the groceries would be in our unit when we arrived but they weren't, and when they did arrive they had been sitting out for some time. I was okay with it because I figured the yogurt, cheese, etc. woud get cold soon enough but the refrigerator wasn't working. So they came to the unit and retrieved all of the perishables and placed them in another refrigerator while they worked on it. A repairman came up and about 5 hours later the fridge was again working and they redelivered our groceries but I think by this time they spoiled. Even the bananas and grapes were disgusting and the yogurt was warm. They did credit the entire grocery order. The next day my husband found a maxi pad rapper under the sheets. I read one review that stated there were tons of bugs everyhwere and as I arrived I was thinking to myself, well this is Florida, and it is summertime, it's to be expected. But I didn't expect giant 2 inch beetles to be swimming toward me in the hot tub I was trying to relax in. Disgusted, I left, and the next day my 12 year old son said he had to leave the hot tub because a huge frog was swimming in it. Because it was so hot and I was determined to try the pool (this is the pool at Heritage Crossing) I tried again and the third day there was a gigantic beetle in the pool. I gave up trying to use the pool at Heritage Crossing and we (the whole family) really enjoyed the waterpark. The waterpark was very relaxing and I could easily stay there all day. You do have to wait about 30-45 minutes for drinks/food so if you think you're going to be hungry just order ahead of time. Or you can just walk up to the bar and get drinks. However, on one of the days we went to the waterpark I ordered a Cool Breeze, there were 3 employees behind the bar and not one of them knew how to make it. I mean, the drink did get made, the guy had to look on the menu to get the ingredients, he left off the best part (the pineapple)...it was just a little weird. Other than that, overall it is a nice resort and we did have a great time. These complaints, (other than the food spoiling) are relatively minor, (unless you really get freaked out by gigantic bugs swimming around you), and I actually do recommend giving the place a try. The staff was very nice and accommodating. We did 5 parks in 8 days and really weren't there a whole lot. I am netural right now on whether or not I would stay there again (as we do plan on returning to Orlando for a 2 week stay). I do think it's worth trying once. Tip* If you are going to Universal Studios/Islands of Adventure I think it i definately worth the extra money for the Express Pass. We got on every ride with virtually no wait and we went on July 3rd and 4th.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: blondiekdf
Reviews.Content: Once you stay here, you will not want to stay anywhere else! I have been vacationing in the Orlando area for over 25 years and have never experianced a resort like this. It is absolutely beautiful, first class all the way. All staff members were helpful, and professional. Food was fantastic, the pools were perfect, the 3 bedroom villa was elegant, pedicure at the spa was heaven! We had 8 people in our group, 4 adult, and 4 girls ages 7, 13, 16, and 20, there were things for all to do. We are already planning our next trip to the Reuion!! Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and Peaceful Retreat”
Reviews.Author: UpperClassChick
Reviews.Content: We rented a private "estate house" at Reunion directly from an owner. We are a couple in our early 30s (no kids). We had no problem getting into the gated community (the owner had given our details to the security people). The house was absolutely gorgeous - 4 bedrooms, 5.5 baths. Big living room, seperate sitting and dining rooms, gourmet kitchen, games room with pool table and games console, and some exercise equipment (treadmill, bike and cross-trainer) in the garage. There was also free wireless internet access and a little "computer cupboard" too. The pool and hot tub were gorgeous - both were "infinity". The pool is quite small, but has a beautiful view of the golf couse. The whole house is decorated and furnished in very good taste and it provided a luxurious and peaceful retreat from the hustle and bustle of Disney and the rest of Orlando. We only stayed there for four nights, but did get a chance to use the "water park" which was very quiet and enjoyable - just floating around on the lazy river. I enjoyed some early morning jogging around the golf courses - absolutely beautiful. Infact the whole community is really gorgeous. If you like proper golf (we only play miniature golf!), it must be an amazing to play there. We had a great time and are booked to stay in the same villa with the same owner again this September, this time for a week. Hopefully we will have more time to check out the community's other facilities (like the bars and restaurants). Reunion is quite an expensive place to stay, but that is a reflection of the quality of the resort. I would recommend renting directly from an owner - then you know exactly what you are getting and they will give you a good price.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect!!!!”
Reviews.Author: FishGurrl
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Reunion and had a wonderful experience. Arrived way before check in at 1:30 and there was no problem being escorted immediately to our villa. Staff was extremely helpful and pleasant. What a gorgeous place! Booked a 3 bedroom villa that looked like a model home inside. Beautifully decorated and appointed, it was just gorgeous. And so spacious! My two boys each had their own rooms and bathroom and there was even an office for my husband to work on his laptop. The master bedroom was huge and a gigantic walk-in closet, it's own balcony and a master bath the size of most bedrooms. Our villa looked out over the golf course and the villa was extremely quiet. I didn't hear any noises from outside people or otherwise. Very soundly built. Utilized the water park one afternoon and it was awesome too. The kids loved it. Didn't notice any bugs at all. Not one. It was only about 10 minutes driving time to Disney too which is a plus. There are security guards around the clock at all the entrances which is really nice. Won't even think of staying anywhere else after this visit! Just lovely!

HotelInfo.Name: Reunion Resort
HotelInfo.Address: 7593 Gathering Drive, Kissimmee, FL 34747
